It was a pity that there were too few people with the qualifications to practice, and even fewer with good talents. After screening the tens of thousands of troops in the territory, including a group of reserve soldiers, there were only more than 4,000 people with the qualifications to practice, and only half of them were worth training.

This ratio is far lower than that of the children of nobles. Obviously, the bloodline theory circulating in the Aslant continent is not completely without basis.

But in Hudson's opinion, this is more like human self-evolution. It is similar to selecting seeds. The seeds with the largest and fullest grains are likely to produce crops with better yield and quality.

The fathers of noble children awakened their talent for cultivation, and the essence of their lives was sublimated. There is a certain probability that this talent will be passed down.

After generations of continuous optimization and screening, the probability of noble children having the qualifications to practice cultivation far exceeds that of ordinary people.

Not only is the probability of having cultivation qualifications high, but the level of qualifications is also relatively high. This is also one of the reasons why the ancient noble families are more likely to produce strong people.

Looking at the test results that were constantly coming together, Hudson had a new understanding of the class stratification on the continent of Aslant.

Fortunately, the base number of civilian children is large enough. Even if less than one-tenth of them have the qualifications to practice, it is still a considerable number after considering this large base number.

"Duke, these are statistical test results.

Among the citizens aged 12 to 18 in the territory, there are a total of 926 people with magical talents, including 469 people with inferior talents, 376 people with low talents, 72 people with medium talents, and 9 people with superior talents.

There are 24,867 people with knight training talents, including 14,346 with inferior talents, 8,764 with low talents, and medium talents..."

After listening to Kane's report, Hudson frowned. This data was much less than he expected.

Including the refugees from the royal territory and the kingdom, the current mountain territory has a population of two million. The population between the ages of 12 and 18 alone is as many as 300,000.

What's worse is that having the qualifications to cultivate doesn't mean that one is worth cultivating. Cultivating people with inferior talents is a sheer waste of resources.

There is no problem with hard work making up for one's shortcomings, provided that there is a huge amount of resources invested. The cultivation qualifications of these people in front of him all depend on Hudson's grant, so where would there be so many resources for them to squander.

This kind of test may not be completely accurate. If some special physical qualities are awakened in the later stage, or if a fortuitous encounter occurs, it is still possible to change the qualifications.

"For those with inferior talents, just let them go back! Tell them that if they can cultivate the sense of Qi within three years, they can come back.

If someone can persist in practicing every day, they will not be assigned any tasks within three years, and their daily ration will be increased by 0.5 pounds of fish.

Those with magical talent will be incorporated into the magician group.

The rest of the boys were all placed in the reserve force. Those with lower qualifications were trained as warriors, while those with middle and upper qualifications were trained as knights.

All girls with the best qualifications will be kept, and the rest will be allowed to choose whether to stay. If they choose to stay, they will be trained according to the same standards. "

Hudson said with a sigh.

He has given these people the opportunity, but whether they can seize it is an unknown.
Chapter 479:
Chapter 159: Soldier Academy

Recruiting so many people at once made training a big problem. Teachers could only be drawn from the military, and whether they were qualified was not even considered.

The selection criteria of "lenient entry but strict exit" doomed this to be an extensive training. In addition to teaching the cultivation methods and sharing cultivation experiences, imparting knowledge and answering questions would not be difficult for a bunch of rough people.

Not to mention the officers who were born as serfs' sons, even the officers who were born as minor nobles were not very knowledgeable.

With limited resources, many small noble families only focus on training their eldest sons, and the rest only receive the simplest education.

Brothers like Hudson all received aristocratic education, and after completing basic knight training, they were able to obtain life essence, which means they are from a wealthy family.

The world of the nobility is so cruel, so one can imagine how cruel the training of the Knights Temperament's reserve forces is.

The so-called focused training actually means eating better in daily life, ensuring the nutrition needed for training, and stricter daily management.

There was no need to expect more cultivation resources. Hudson was not so generous as to take out the cultivation resources of more than 20,000 people at once.

It's not just a matter of money, but no one would sell such a large amount of cultivation resources.

The cultivation resources on the market are scattered and the prices are not cheap.

Backed by the Blackrock Mountains, the Mountain Territory can also produce some cultivation resources, but the wild resources are too scarce and artificial cultivation requires a period of time.

Although there were few resources for cultivation, Hudson reaped the benefits of the Koslo family's marriage alliances in terms of human resources.

In addition to the talents selected from the territory, there is also a group of minor nobles who have connections with the family and their children who are sent here.

If the family cannot train the child at home, they will send him to relatives for training. This is also a very common thing in the aristocratic world.

Of course, this kind of training is not free, and they need to work for Master Hudson to pay off his debts after they grow up.

It is not a loss to come here to work. After the children of minor nobles become adults, they will have to work for the great nobles first.

Bringing your children over in advance not only saves money, but also helps to build closer relationships and pave the way for future development.

"Family members" are labeled as "direct descendants" from the beginning. Under the same conditions, they will definitely be promoted faster.

This is how the whole Alpha Kingdom plays.

The private knight groups under the great nobles, except for a small number of family members and some knights who came from outside, the rest are all children of small and medium nobles who depend on them for survival.

Under normal circumstances, these people are enough for everyone to use. If there is peace for a few decades, there will be a surplus of talents, and there will naturally be no need to deliberately select from the public.

If Hudson had not been developing the Near East and there was no threat of war, it would not have lacked basic talent if it had developed according to its inherent model.

Judging from the development of the territory, he simply cannot afford to support tens of thousands of extraordinary troops. The main purpose of creating such a large base is to screen elites.

There are more than 25,000 people in the reserve knights, but that doesn't mean that there will be that many people in the final selection. Only the best students can stay until the end and serve in the knights.

...

"Duke, sending all these people to the academy is too big, isn't it?

If this gets out, we will be laughed at!"

Jose said bitterly.

Hudson waved his hand, and a soldier training academy appeared in the mountain territory.

Originally I wanted to call it the Magic and Martial Arts Academy, but I was worried about causing unnecessary trouble, so I deliberately lowered the name.

Selecting talents from serfs is already abnormal, and then training these people to become strong people would cause great hatred.

Not only the outside world, but also the nobles who are dependent on him and even the members of the Koslo family will stand up to oppose.

After all, as a member of the vested interest group, no one wants to have another group of people stealing their jobs.

Hudson, who was quick to accept advice, decisively changed the name to "Mountain Leader Soldier Academy" after listening to the suggestions of his subordinates.

In fact, it doesn't matter what the level is.

Just looking at the faculty of this academy is enough to dispel most people's concerns. It is truly an academy for training elite soldiers and has nothing to do with the Magic and Martial Arts Academy.

The instructors of the academy are all low-level knights recruited from the army. The only one who can be considered a strong one is the principal Hudson.

Even in the worst magic and martial arts academy in the entire continent, the average strength of the students is stronger than these instructors.

The situation in the Ministry of Magic is even worse, with magic apprentices becoming mentors. Rather than training magicians, it is more like training workers.

After tasting the sweetness of the huge profits from magic potions, Hudson could no longer resist and continued to develop unique Hudson potions.

In order to conceal his tracks and improve production efficiency, Hudson invented a unique method of producing potion ingredients separately, and the magicians in the territory only participated in the production of one link.

No matter how simplified it is, it is still a purely manually prepared medicine, so workers are naturally indispensable.

Not only is the cost of recruiting magicians from outside too high, but it is also easy for spies from major forces to infiltrate, so we just decided to train them ourselves.

Anyway, the early stage is all about learning basic theories, and the cost of training is not high. It requires a lot of money, which is something you will do after you become a magician.

Hudson uses a "beggar's edition" talent training model, focusing on cost-effectiveness. As long as the training cycle is short, the price is cheap enough, and the number is large enough, it will be fine.

It is not so important whether one has potential or not. Most students will stop at the low level, but if the base number increases, there will always be lucky ones who stand out.

Just because there are no cultivation resources to assist in cultivation now does not mean that you will not be able to obtain cultivation resources after making military achievements in the future.

It is unrealistic to let everyone break the class, but Hudson can still promote individual outstanding people to break the class restrictions and open a gap in the closed aristocratic system.

After all, there was no law explicitly stating that serfs could not become nobles.

In order to motivate soldiers to fight for their lives, after each war, the Alpha Kingdom would introduce a few lucky grassroots people to serve as role models for ordinary soldiers.

What Hudson did was nothing more than increasing the number of lucky people, and the number of people allowed in in the future may be slightly more.

As long as you are thick-skinned enough and modify your words, you can force the two to be classified into the same category.

It is easy to make a plan, but it is difficult to implement it.

Jose, the specific executor, was completely confused by Hudson's grand plan after seeing the final plan.

A super academy with more than 20,000 students, and new students joining every year, is completely epoch-making in the continent of Aslant.

All the academies in the entire Alpha Kingdom combined do not have this many students.

In a normal college, all the teachers and students together usually have about 800 people, and rarely more than 2,000.

They train elites, their instructors are all strong, and their students are also outstanding.

In comparison, the Mountain Soldier Academy, which is in a state of disrepair across the board, is a complete joke and is simply lowering the quality of the "academy".

"Ha ha......"

"Jose, you are too persistent. If you are afraid of being laughed at, then we can change the name from Academy to Base.

When it is promoted to the outside world, it is called: Mountain Leader Soldier Training Base, or Mountain Leader Recruit Training Camp.

I don't think any academy would lower itself to compare itself with a base that trains soldiers!"

Hudson said nonchalantly.

The name doesn't matter, the key is to be able to cultivate talents.

Initially, he really wanted to build a presentable academy, but unfortunately, not only was it very expensive, but he also couldn't train a large number of talents according to his wishes.

"Your Excellency the Duke, even if we don't talk about the number of students, why do we recruit so many female students?

Are you planning to form a women's knight group?

This has been tried before, and the investment and benefits are simply not proportional."

Jose said helplessly.

His dream was shattered. He originally thought that Hudson College was the same as the colleges on the mainland, and that as the vice-president, he would be in a high position of power and authority, and would have leapt into the upper class.

Unfortunately, the standard of Harris College is too low, and recruiting external students would be a humiliation to itself, not to mention gaining recognition from all walks of life.

"There are only over 5,000 female students, it's not as exaggerated as you say!

Don't worry, I'm not planning to form a women's knight group, I just want to train a small number of elites.

The assessment standards for all students are the same, and the last-in-first-out system is implemented.

There is an exam every three months of study, and 10% of the students are eliminated each time. Those who remain after three years are the ones who really need to be trained.

Men and women have different physical strengths, and among these female students, only a few hundred are able to stay.

This is the only time we will enroll students on a large scale. If we enroll students again in the future, we can just gradually raise the admission standards."

Hudson explained calmly.

As a pragmatist, talents are selected to serve the next war.

Recruiting so many students is not only about selecting outstanding soldiers, but also about improving the quality of the territory's population.

Although the academy's courses are mainly focused on cultivation, it is still possible to have one or two cultural courses interspersed in it.

Even if you are eliminated, the superficial knowledge you learned in school is still a valuable asset.

In the future, they can be placed in other industries and have higher potential for training than pure illiterates.

If you serve in the second-line troops, the war experience you gained in the academy can still be used.

It is unrealistic to command thousands of troops, but with a little training, it is still enough to serve as a centurion.

However, these things that may affect the course of history and change the future military structure of the continent can be done secretly and there is no need to announce them in advance.

If we can create a fait accompli, I guess Xueyue Territory will also be developed, and a bigger pie will be enough to appease the people under his command.

Criticism and hostility from the outside world can only make a few noises at most, but cannot shake his foundation.

"Your Excellency the Duke, putting aside these issues, should we find a way to improve our teaching staff?

With your reputation, there should be many nobles who will buy into it. I don't expect all the teachers in the academy to be strong, but at least they should be at the intermediate level (level 4-6)!"

Kane on the side complained.

When Hudson first appointed him as the Dean of Academic Affairs, he was terrified for a long time. He thought that he was not strong enough to manage the faculty and was ready to resign.

However, after seeing the ability level of the teachers, Kane suddenly found that there was nothing wrong with his position as the Dean of Academic Affairs.

Most of the instructors were low-level first-level knights and inferior magic apprentices. There were very few first-level magicians and second-level intermediate knights. As a third-level senior knight, he was a strong man in the academy.

"Don't dream. Even if they are willing to come and teach, they can only stay for a short period of time. Most of the time they have their own things to deal with.

This teaching model of working hard for three days and resting the net for two days may not be better than the current one.

What's more, apart from their greater personal strength, deeper knowledge and broader horizons, what other advantages do these people have?

The current group of mentors have all fought their way out of the battlefield and have extensive combat experience.

His personal strength is indeed a little lacking, but he is loyal and reliable.

The army relies on group strength. If an individual's combat effectiveness is insufficient, it can be compensated by group coordination.

There are so many magic and martial arts academies on the continent, but I haven't seen them train a few Saint Domain strongmen. Don't take them too seriously!"

Hudson said without changing his expression.

It's not that he doesn't want to improve the teaching staff, it's that he simply doesn't dare to!

An academy that specializes in mixing in private goods and bringing in a group of aristocratic tutors is simply asking for trouble.

Hudson didn't think that all nobles were as easy to fool as the noble children under his command. If there were any noble children who taught him, they would probably see through his plan quickly.

Even the staff in front of him might have seen through his plan, but they were not sure at the moment. Or they might have seen through it but did not say it, pretending to be ignorant.

After all, Hudson's series of actions, although seemingly skirting the law, were in fact a challenge to the aristocratic system.

There was no objection, because they had bought into Hudson's promise. Deep down, they had already imagined the wonderful life after the development of Xueyue Territory.

As for the interests of the aristocratic group, what does that have to do with them?

Apart from the title of aristocratic children, they now have almost nothing. If they want to cross the threshold of social class, they must first serve Master Hudson well.

To safeguard the interests of the class, they had to wait until they became a member of the vested interest group. At present, their interests were completely tied to Hudson.

The right way is to find out the gaps and plug all the loopholes that may cause trouble, solve the problems for Master Hudson, and build a career for yourself.

Without any major problems, Hudson no longer needs to worry about the subsequent site selection and school building construction of the college.

There are only two principles: speed must be fast; money must be saved as much as possible.

The total budget for the whole year is only two million gold coins. In addition to the free land, it also includes infrastructure construction, teaching equipment purchase costs and staff salary expenses.

After deducting a series of hardware expenses, the funds allocated to each student are estimated to be less than fifty gold coins.

In fact, even these fifty gold coins cannot be spent on every student, as the maintenance of teaching equipment must also be considered.

The maintenance of teaching buildings, dormitory buildings, and weapons and equipment are not big numbers, but war horses always need food.

As a reserve of the Knights Templar, learning to ride a horse is a basic operation. We don't expect everyone to have a warhorse, but at least two or three students should have one warhorse.

Fortunately, Hudson was doing well in the army. After leading the army on several expeditions, he had enough advanced weapons such as magic crystal cannons and magic crossbows, and did not need to spend extra money to purchase them.

Otherwise, with this little money, you may not even be able to buy all your belongings, let alone support a year's operating expenses.

The budget determines the standard of living. Don't fantasize about monster meat. It's good enough to have enough ordinary meat every day.

I guess you won't find such a shabby academy even if you travel all over the continent.

However, it is still too expensive to train soldiers.

If it weren't for the profits from magic potions, the Mountain Territory's financial income would not be able to support this academy.

...

"Franz, a man must stand up for himself!"

"Come over here quickly..."

On the large lawn in front of the castle, Hudson, who had no experience, began his career of taking care of children.

Melissa was lazily basking in the sun. With Hudson's hard work, she was pregnant with another baby, and now she didn't have much energy to take care of the father and son.

No matter how Hudson called out to him, his son just wouldn't listen. Following the principle of lying down wherever he fell, Franz just lay on the ground and laughed non-stop.

His eyes had long since shifted from Hudson to Bear Stearns and Maxim standing beside him. To the little guy, the miniature dragon and bear were much more interesting than Hudson.

Hudson doesn't dare let his son come into contact with these two guys because his son is so young. If he is led astray, he will have no place to cry.

Judging from age, Maxim is still a young dragon, while Bear Stearns is definitely a naughty child.

They are children themselves, and the consequences of asking them to take care of the children would be horrible.

However, Warcraft also has a rebellious mentality. The more they are forbidden to do something, the more they like to do it.

Hudson stopped them from getting close to his son, but he couldn't stop them from acting cute and attracting Franz's attention.

Melissa, on the other hand, was very open-minded and was very happy for her son to have contact with the dragon and bear. I guess she wanted to build a good relationship so that the Warcraft could be passed down from generation to generation in the future.

With two holy domain monsters guarding him, even if his son was spoiled, the foundation could still be passed on.

In the continent of Aslant, no great noble family has ever declined while being protected by powerful saints.

His son was not yet old enough to be reasoned with, and when he refused to accept his argument, there was nothing Hudson could do.

Deep down in his heart, he has decided that when his son grows up a little, he will arrange a tutor for him and give him a pile of homework every day so that he can feel the fatherly love as strong as a mountain.

Perhaps it was because she saw Hudson being defeated in the confrontation between father and son that Melissa couldn't help but burst out laughing.

"Hudson, you are so old, yet you are still competing with your son.

Franz is so young, how can he understand what you mean? Even if you want to teach him, you should at least wait until he is a little older!"

It's obviously nothing, but when you say it like that, it becomes a problem. A typical person who likes to watch the fun and not mind the trouble, Hudson rolled his eyes directly.

Now is not the time to be fussy. My son is too young and has no idea what he is doing. I can't afford to offend a pregnant woman.

Without any unnecessary nonsense, Hudson walked forward, picked up little Franz lying on the ground, handed him to Melissa, and said with a smile:

"The Koslo family rose to prominence under my leadership, and the next generation is crucial to whether it can maintain its foundation and gain a firm foothold.

Although Franz is still young, his education must be arranged in advance. The family's education system is too old and can no longer adapt to the current situation.

Melissa, you need to pay more attention to this aspect."

Regardless of whether the aristocratic group is corrupt, the education system of these ancient nobles for their younger generations is still very instructive.

Generally speaking, as long as the system is strictly implemented, the heirs trained will not be useless.

Those who have ruined their children mostly have mixed too much of their own subjective will into the education process, seriously interfering with the normal growth of their children.

Usually the stronger the parents' desire for control, the greater the chance that they will spoil their children. Even if there is a perfect talent training system, it cannot withstand the turmoil.

"Don't worry, Hudson. Before I got married, I copied a copy of the heir's training information from my family and will give it to you later to see if it can be modified.

If it's not too much trouble, it would be best to hold a family meeting and invite the elders to work together to develop a training plan for the next generation of children."

After listening to Melissa's complaints, Hudson smiled slightly. The Koslo family is now like a blank sheet of paper, allowing him to paint as he pleases.

The rules passed down by the ancestors had no binding force in front of him, the powerful head of the family.

In fact, the ancestors of the Koslo family did not pass down any rules, or rather, even if they set rules, they were not passed down well for various reasons.

Because the family had been separated for so long, each branch often had its own records and different interpretations of the same event, and no one could convince the other.

This is undoubtedly a good thing for Hudson. Without the burden of history, it can make rules according to its own will.

The family rules that the Koslo family currently follows were all added by Hudson. Because of the short time, many aspects are not perfect.

Most of the time, a problem occurs first and then a patch is applied, which is similar to legislation.

The only difference is that there is no such thing as letting the past go unpunished. Past offenses can still be dealt with according to current rules.
Chapter 480:
Chapter 160: Cruel Screening

The situation on the mainland has stabilized, and the mountain territory is back on track and operating according to plan. Hudson, who has been idle, stays at home all day with his wife, children and lover.

If we put aside his career achievements, he was obsessed with enjoying life in his twenties and was the negative example of "lack of ambition".

The reality is just the opposite. Hudson, who stays at home, has become a typical good husband. Frankly speaking, the definition of a good husband in Aslant is really low.

Anyway, Hudson didn't dare to claim this title. He kept his lover at home, so he could not be called a good husband.

In this regard, Hudson has to thank his father-in-law. It was his tricks that influenced Melissa's ideas, which led to his current good life.

Out of gratitude to Count Oran, Hudson specially ordered a batch of potions to restore men's physical strength and sent them to him to save the old man from being overwhelmed.

Reality perfectly proves the saying: "When the world is sick and you are the only one who is normal, then it must be you who is sick!"

A soldier academy has been established, and several undeveloped hills near the Black Rock Mountains have become the academy's base.

The school buildings and teaching buildings were all built by the students themselves. It's not that Hudson wanted to save money, but teenagers of this age are already the labor force in the family.

The noble children performed with a little difficulty, but under the supervision of their mentors, they still successfully completed the task.

There is no point in complaining, as the college has adopted a fully closed military management system since its establishment.

If they make trouble, they will be beaten up. From the moment they enter the school, they are part of the reserve force.

Here everyone is a student, all personal files are sealed, and everyone receives the same education regardless of their social status.

Cultural courses: reading and writing, loyalty to the lord; martial arts courses: basic training of knights.

In the early stages, the training of knights and warriors is the same, all of which is physical training. Only when the physical strength reaches a certain level can they enter the next step of training.

Whether they will choose to be knights or warriors in the future depends entirely on their performance in the academy.

Qualifications are an important factor affecting future development, but not the only factor.

Theoretically speaking, if students with inferior qualifications work hard enough, they can also have the opportunity to obtain the "Life Essence" and become a knight.

In the continent of Aslant, most of the noble children entered the threshold of knighthood at the age of fifteen or sixteen, and the period after that marked a watershed.

The genius quickly distanced himself from his peers, and in the following decades, he entered a period of rapid growth in personal strength.

Everyone awakens the seed of life at a certain age. It is not because of the basic training that they are held back, but because the natural growth of the body has not kept up.

If the body does not keep up with the development, awakening the life seed prematurely will affect the future development potential. If the life seed is awakened too late, it will waste the period of rapid growth of strength.

After countless years of exploration, everyone has come to the conclusion: It is best to awaken the seed of life at the age of fifteen or sixteen.

For many people in the academy, the best period for awakening has actually been missed, but this is not important at all.

It's not about training strong men in batches, so the upper limit of their personal potential will not affect their becoming excellent soldiers.

Today is a special day. The first round of assessment since admission is about to begin, which also means the start of the elimination round.

It cannot be said that whether you will become a dragon or a worm depends on this wave, but for those who are eliminated in the first round, their future life will basically be confined to the bottom.

In order to show his importance, Mr. Hudson, the president of the college, came personally to preside over the assessment.

Because of their different positioning, the assessment and elimination standards of the Magic and Martial Arts Academies are completely different.

The Knight Academy nominally trains soldiers, but in reality it trains grassroots officers, and its main focus is "strictness".

Cultural subjects and martial arts subjects account for 20% and 80% respectively, and the comprehensive scores are calculated with a bottom-up elimination system of 10%.

It is different in the magic academy. There are no fixed elimination quotas. As long as you can become a magic worker, you can stay and continue your studies.

As far as Hudson knew, some of the top pharmacy students in the Magic Academy were now able to prepare simple potions.

I estimate that after a few more months of training, he will become a qualified magic apprentice and contribute to the territory's pharmaceutical industry.

Even if you don't have a talent for medicine, as long as your training speed meets the requirements, you can still stay and continue your studies.

It was obvious that everyone had put in a lot of effort. After the first round of assessment, only three people from the Magic Academy were eliminated.

The Knight Academy is very cruel. No matter how hard they work, 10% of the students will leave.

For all the students who enter the academy, this is the place that changes their future destiny.

After finally stepping out of your original circle and seeing a different scenery, who would be willing to leave in such a dejected way?

For more than 99% of the students, this was their only chance. Even if they were children of the nobility, once they were eliminated here, it would be difficult for them to get a second chance in the future.

The world is realistic, and no one will invest limited resources in losers. Unless all the heirs ahead of them die, they will never get any more resources from their family.

Frankly speaking, this kind of assessment is not fair. Everyone has different backgrounds because of their different families of origin. Just because everyone enters school together does not mean that everyone is on the same starting line.

Many noble children completed basic knight training before entering school and joined the Soldier Academy. In addition to being attracted by the name of Hudson, they were mostly attracted by the Essence of Life.

It would be fine if the young noble had only one or two brothers and sisters, but if he had many brothers and sisters like Hudson, he would also have to compete if he wanted to get a share of the life essence.

Baron Redman is considered to be doing well in the area within dozens of miles. The fact that Lai Suer is willing to ask Hudson for a portion of life essence is enough to explain the problem.

It is not uncommon in the aristocratic world for brothers to fall out due to competition for cultivation resources.

One step to heaven, one step to hell. Born in a noble family, no one wants to become a commoner.

The emergence of the Mountain Territory Soldier Academy gave countless small nobles who suffered from a lack of Life Essence an opportunity, and they all used their connections to send their children in.

Although they considered it a very embarrassing thing to compete with the children of serfs, no one thought that their own children would lose.

Since they can win, there is no need to worry about it. Many people even think that Hudson arranged so many people to come in to run with them just to increase pressure on their juniors and stimulate their potential.

Judging from the students' scores, the gap was also very large. The noble children who had the advantage of being first took almost all the top places.

"Everyone performed very well in this assessment. As a reward, I have decided to grant the following to students who are 15 years old or older, ranked in the top 20%, and have completed basic knight training: Life Essence Exchange Eligibility in advance.

Since none of you have any contribution points, as long as you are willing to join the Snow Moon Knights and serve for twenty years, you can get a portion of Life Essence."

Hudson said with a smile.

He knew the nobles' calculations from the first day of school. But if a thug comes to his door, he won't waste it.

Without the contributions of these guys, it is unknown when his knights would be able to gather. If Hudson had not deliberately let them go, there would not be so many noble children.

Nominally, everyone's age is between 12 and 18, but those guys with untidy beards look too old.

Some of these young people are older, not to mention 18, and I'm afraid some of them are even older than 28. Under normal circumstances, they will be like this all their lives.

Joining the Soldier Academy was the last chance for these people. They were able to change their age to get in only because their families were related to the Koslo family.

In this regard, Hudson was very considerate. No matter which branch recommended the person, as long as he had a clean background and no entanglement with the major forces, he would accept him.

Due to limited vision, the value in everyone's eyes is not equal.

In Hudson's view, the essence of life is just an ordinary magic potion, and as long as he is willing, he can achieve small-scale mass production.

In the eyes of the little nobles, the life essence became priceless. Hudson granted this precious strategic resource to this group of over-age children with no development potential because they were relatives.

Distant relatives are also relatives, and the treatment of our own people should be higher than that of outsiders.

Including in the academy, Hudson is also constantly instilling the concept of "one's own people" into the students. The noble students who are related to him are one's own people, and the students who are born as common people are also one's own people.

The effect was very obvious. The young people were stunned by being fooled, and their eyes looking at Master Hudson were full of "admiration".

The older students among the students were more rational, but they still had no resistance in the face of the essence of life.

The favor was sold, and the thugs were also there. Whether they had potential or not was a secondary factor. At least in the short term, Hudson had a group of thugs.

Now it depends on how many of these students who have completed the basic knight training can successfully awaken their seeds of life.

It doesn't matter if you fail, you can still serve Master Hudson as a warrior. With a group of war horses, you can also join the Knights.

Of course, affected by the training system, even a warrior riding a warhorse is far less powerful than a knight.

To distinguish the strength of a knightly order's combat effectiveness, you can get a rough idea by simply looking at the proportion of the knights in it.

Seeing a group of emotional students trying to pretend to be calm in front of him in order to maintain their noble dignity, Hudson smiled even more happily.

Obviously, this investment will not be a loss. The most frightening thing for people is to have no desire. These guys are so obsessed with aristocratic status that they are undoubtedly a group of excellent workers.

If you want to gain noble status without chopping off the heads of a hundred orc soldiers, just dream on!

If he wanted to obtain a fief, Hudson thought he could set the beheading target at 500. The military merit conversion ratio between the orc royal family and ordinary orcs could be set at 1:10.

It can also be further subdivided according to different orc races, identities and strengths. Anyway, the Alpha Kingdom itself is a military merit system, and he just digitized the standards.

These pies are for the knights to eat. Theoretically, as long as the individual is strong and has a little luck, it is possible to achieve the goal.

Specifically, there are expeditionary corps that followed Hudson from the west to the east and killed hundreds of foreign soldiers.

Taking into account the bonus of killing enemy generals, if there is a complete military merit conversion system, there will be many knights who can accumulate 500 beast head merits.

Of course, these people also got what they wanted. Although the location of the fief was not ideal, they still crossed the social class.

The more he thought about it, the more he felt that the Qin Dynasty's 20-level military merit title was powerful. The system clearly defined the reward standards and covered everyone in the army.

Every soldier can see the hope of further progress step by step. In comparison, the military merit system of the Alpha Kingdom is too crude.

If you have made great contributions, you can indeed become a noble. But for most ordinary soldiers, killing hundreds of orc soldiers is simply impossible.

The pie in the sky was prepared entirely for the children of the nobility. When leading a private army to the battlefield, all the combat effectiveness would be recorded on one person, so the probability of standing out was naturally high.

This set of rules that safeguard the interests of the aristocratic group involves the entire aristocratic group. Hudson naturally cannot destroy it, but he still wants to try to make detailed changes within the rule system.

Although Hudson had this idea, he did not act blindly. The Qin Dynasty's military merit system was implemented along with the farming and warfare system.

This is obviously in conflict with the mainstream serfdom system in today's society. Any reform that touches the fundamentals of the social production system cannot be accomplished easily.

If forcing the matter forward doesn't work, then we can only make some adjustments. Hudson had no idea how to do it, anyway, this kind of thing is very troublesome.

"Duke, these are the names of the eliminated students. Do you want to..."

Before Kane could finish his words, Hudson waved his hand and said, "These things are part of daily teaching. You guys can handle them as you see fit.

Well, this is the first assessment, so the standards will be slightly relaxed. After subtracting the number of people who have obtained the original liquid of life from the total number of places, we can eliminate another 10%!"

After all, someone has to be the villain. If it can't be Lord Hudson, then it can only be other high-ranking officials in the academy.

Vice-president, academic director...they are appointed to important positions not to make their students successful all over the world, but to solve problems in a practical way.

But Hudson's grip finally loosened. By kicking out the students who had obtained the life essence and eliminating the bottom 10%, at least 500 students had temporarily escaped.

However, this kind of luck only happens once. If they fail to roll up in the next three months, they will be on the next list of eliminations.

Although they were all eliminated, for the students who came from serf families, every extra period they could hold on was an opportunity.

When they leave the academy, they also take away the fruits of their studies, whether it is cultural knowledge or physical fitness improved in training, which is a valuable asset.

After holding on for a few more periods, even if you are eliminated, the second-tier army will rush to take you back.

Those who have received basic knight training are much stronger than ordinary people in terms of both personal physical strength and combat experience.

The Soldier Academy, of course, trains soldiers. Those who were eliminated were soldiers trained by Hudson, and those who remained at the end were officers.

After the three-year study period is over, after a tour in the Knights Templar and some military achievements, Hudson will look for opportunities to transfer those with development potential to ordinary legions as officers.

Unlike previous officers who only needed to follow orders, they also had to take on the important task of guarding overseas outposts and resisting orc invasions.

...

With Hudson's departure, the campus was filled with a mixture of sadness and joy, with countless people staring at the notice on the wall.

The students who ranked in the top 20% and were eligible to apply for the Life Essence were all full of high spirits and ambitions, as if great achievements were just around the corner.

On the other side, the students who were ranked at the bottom of the rankings all looked pale and stood there in a daze, totally unable to believe that they were eliminated.

"impossible!"

"This is impossible!"

"Wow......"

I don't know who started it, but in a blink of an eye, the whole campus was filled with crying.

Especially those students whose scores were just enough to be eliminated were crying the most sadly. They were just a little bit short of the mark. If they had worked harder, they would be in a different situation now.

However, no matter how sadly you cry, it cannot change the fact that you are eliminated.

The students who were lucky enough to stay in school were close to the passing score and were able to survive, but were also secretly complaining.

There was not much time left for them to work hard. If they did not want to leave in despair, they had to try their best in the next three months.

The problem is that they have to work hard, and others are not idle either. Seeing former classmates being eliminated is a irritation to everyone's nerves.

Even the students who had been full of vigor and vitality just now restrained their smiles under the influence of the sad atmosphere.

Obtaining the essence of life is only the first step. If they cannot awaken the seed of life, their future situation will not be much better.

Theoretically, as long as there are enough resources, even without any qualifications, it is enough to create a knight, but the price to pay is very shocking.

Resource players have nothing to do with them. The only option left for them is success, and failure means the knight's dream is shattered.

Looking at the crying students, the instructors' faces were terribly gloomy. They all came from the bottom of society and knew very well how important this opportunity was to the students in front of them.

But there is no way, the world is cruel, and some students will have to leave here eventually.

"Stop whining!"

"Everyone, cheer up. Even if you want to leave, you must walk out of here with your backs straight.

Life is still a long journey, and I have given you the basic training methods. You can still practice on your own after you go back.

The Duke is going to open up the Snow Moon Territory, so there will definitely be wars to come. As long as you make contributions on the battlefield, there will be no shortage of opportunities!"

Mentor Felix reprimanded earnestly.

He didn't want these students to sink into despair. Even if the road ahead would become more difficult after they left here, as long as they kept going, there would be hope.

The group of tutors in the academy are the best example. Except for a few lucky ones who are of noble birth, the rest have followed Hudson through life and death and fought their way out.

Most of them had never even received formal knight training before becoming knights.

He was trained entirely in the army, and his physical fitness reached the standard of awakening the seed of life. He also happened to have made enough contributions, so he was rewarded with the essence of life.

Compared to simple knight training, the probability of these people who crawled out of the pile of dead bodies awakening the seed of life after taking the essence of life is much higher than that of ordinary people.

"Teacher Felix, can we really do this?"

A boy about thirteen or fourteen asked uncertainly.

"have no idea!"

"According to your current situation, I think you should just go home and farm. The army is really not suitable for you.

If you can remain firm in your beliefs, report to the army immediately after leaving here and continue to train, there will always be hope in the future.

Judging from the proportion, about 2% of the territory's elite troops have awakened their seeds of life without undergoing knight training!"

Felix said in a low voice.

Chapter 161: Imagining the Future

Southeast Province, Governor's Office.

Ever since he learned that the Koslo family's strategic focus had shifted eastward, Governor Pierce felt completely relaxed, and he enjoyed eating and sleeping much better.

The fights between the two families that used to happen every now and then in secret have also stopped recently. When encountering problems, everyone discusses and solves them.

At that time, the law and order in the southeastern provinces was unprecedentedly good. The bandits and robbers who were rampant in the past suddenly disappeared.

"Hudson, what have you been busy with lately?"

Governor Pierce asked as usual.

Paying attention to Hudson's every move has become a part of his life. It's a habit that has lasted for several years and it's obviously impossible to change it in a short time.

"Master, Marshal Hudson has been very idle recently. Apart from attending an examination at the Soldier Academy, he has spent the rest of his time at home with his wife and children.

Perhaps because the Duchess is pregnant again, Marshal Hudson declined all invitations and no longer holds banquets at home. "

The old butler Gadry's words made Governor Pierce look jealous.

It's not that I envy Hudson's family business. When it comes to family business, the ancient Dalton family is far better than the upstart Koslow family.

The key is that Hudson is fertile. He has a second child just a few years after marriage. It is obvious that he has inherited the Koslow family's fertility talent.

Offspring is also an important indicator to measure the strength of a family.

A family with only one descendant lacks a safety factor no matter how powerful it is.

If an accident happens due to carelessness, you will end up making things difficult for others.

The more offspring one has, the more stable the family foundation will be. Even if something happens to the eldest, the younger ones can take over.

But this kind of thing is not something you can envy. With the current medical technology, the number of offspring you have depends entirely on luck.

It is not uncommon in history for great men to have no descendants.

After a slight hesitation, Governor Pierce asked, "Have you figured out the situation at the Soldier Academy? Can we follow suit?"

It's always right to learn military knowledge from your neighbors. This is the life experience he has summed up over the past few years.

Not only the Dalton family was copying Hudson's homework, but all the nobles in the entire Alpha Kingdom were learning from Hudson.

I don't know whether he learned the essence or not, but he just trained his troops the way Hudson did.

Judging from the feedback from the battlefield in Northern Frontier, the combat effectiveness of each family's private army has been greatly improved.

Since it works, then keep copying. Everyone is copying anyway, and no one will laugh at anyone else.

"Master, we have basically figured out the situation of the Mountain Territory Soldier Academy. I'm afraid it will be difficult to imitate it!

The courses for the students are very simple. In addition to daily basic knight training, there are only a few cultural courses.

Perhaps it is because the students' foundation is too weak and they have not yet learned the language of the entire kingdom.

Students with outstanding performance will simply be rewarded with a portion of life essence.

We can replicate all of these, but the trouble is the subsequent impact.

It is easy to train a large number of low-level knights, but the key is how to place these people in the later stage.

The Koslo family wants to expand in the Near East, so they need to form a large army. After graduation, these students can directly join the army and serve."

Gadri said helplessly.

The more talents the better, it is not the case. Cultivating them is just the beginning, we also have to be able to support them.

The Koslow family has a shallow foundation and does not have that much talent pool. In addition, the countless jobs created by the development of the Near East are the reason why Hudson dares to recruit so many students.

Without the creation of new incremental positions, training a large number of low-level knights would be a game of existing resources.

If other nobles copied this model, the first thing they would face would be opposition from internal vested interests.

Unless they also come up with a similar Xueyueling development plan, there will be countless new positions allocated to these newcomers.

"Didn't we also obtain a fiefdom of one and a half counties in the Near East? Can't we station a few hundred knights there?"

Governor Pierce asked doubtfully.

His intuition told him that there must be other deeper meanings behind the soldier academy set up by Hudson.

As an old family, the Dalton family could not, like the Koslow family, bet on the future of the Near East.

If we can't devote all our efforts to it, it's not bad to build a smaller version of the Soldier Academy. If there are other benefits, we can quickly expand it in the future.

"Master, it's not that I can't follow suit, it's mainly because it's not necessary!

There are so many nobles who are dependent on us. As long as we take out a batch of life essence, we can immediately train hundreds of knights.

In the past, when the territory legions suffered heavy losses, we replenished them in this way.

Marshal Hudson dared to train so many knights at one time because the situation in Snow Moon Territory was special and it would definitely become the main battlefield for the battle between the Kingdom and the Orcs in the future.

No matter how many knights are sent to the meat grinder of Snow Moon Territory, they will not be enough for consumption. "

Butler Gadry replied with a smile.

It is easy to train low-level knights, but the hard part is how to support them later. As long as you step into this circle, people will aim for the nobility.

In the early stages, there may be gratitude for their training, but after a long period of hard work, these people will realize that they can't give them what they want, and the situation will change.

When people are desperate, they can do anything.

The core members of many cult organizations on the mainland are mostly children of nobles who have experienced the transition from hope to despair.

If you can't get what you want under the existing order, then break the existing inherent order.

In order to stabilize the ruling group, the vested interests tacitly limit the number of extraordinary people.

"Even though they knew that Xueyue would be a river of blood, so many people still rushed up. It seems that everyone has extraordinary confidence in Hudson!

However, with the completion of Crescent Harbor, supplies can be obtained from the sea. With Hudson's command ability and the presence of 200,000 elite troops from the kingdom, this chess game may really be played out.

Perhaps the family should reconsider its stance towards the Near East!

Is the future of the kingdom really in the East? "

Governor Pierce's sigh resonated with the old butler. The current situation was becoming increasingly difficult for these old guys to understand.

Under normal circumstances, everyone should avoid the Near East. When the fiefdoms were divided up before, everyone took them on out of consideration for the overall situation.

Originally, he just wanted to invest part of his forces and use the Near East as a buffer to increase the kingdom's strategic room for maneuver, but the situation soon got out of control.

With Hudson's strong entry, the topic of Near East strategy has been constantly heatedly discussed in the kingdom.

The enthusiastic young nobles were the first to join the game. Especially those who had obtained fiefs, each of them mobilized their own personal networks and worked hard to prepare for the development of the Near East.

The orders for the family shipyard have been scheduled for two years from now. Everyone is like crazy, constantly preparing for the development of the Near East.

It was Hudson that triggered this wave.

Everyone's idea is very simple: as long as Xueyue Territory can be defended, their own territory behind them will be safe.

There is no such thing as a roundabout attack or a direct advance.

With the territory of Hudson, the kingdom's god of war, ahead, which orc general would dare to take the risk and advance alone?

"Master, there is no need for us to rush about this matter. If the Near East strategy is successful, then the next hunting ground will be the entire Orc Prairie.

Such a big cake cannot be eaten up by one or two noble families, so even the latecomers can arrive first.

Let these fanatical nobles explore the way first, and when the situation becomes clear, it won't be too late for us to join in with the whole clan!"

Butler Gadli's point of view is also the position currently held by a number of great nobles.

Everyone contributed to the Near East strategy, but not their best efforts. With a large family and a large business, they had enough margin for error, and there was no need to gamble with the entire family.

...

Similar scenes were played out in many large families. It was unknown when the Mountain Territory had become the weathervane for the nobles of the kingdom.

No matter how low-key Hudson is when he steps to the front, his every move will still be interpreted from different perspectives by all parties.

There were supporters, followers, and critics. All kinds of disturbances from the outside world did not affect the normal operation of the Soldier Academy.

The students who received the essence of life had no time to pay attention to the envy of their classmates. After adjusting their own conditions, they all started to retreat.

Success and failure happen constantly on campus every day, making the students who are watching the excitement terrified.

It turns out that getting the essence of life is the first step towards success. If you can't awaken the seed of life, you will still be cast down to the mortal world.

For a time, the students of the magic academy became the envy of everyone.

Although the probability of becoming a master wizard is lower, a magic apprentice can still get a good job!

If you become a worker, you are also a worker for the lord. This is a height that countless ordinary people are fighting for and vying for, but it is difficult to reach.

Jamie has been very upset recently. More than 2,000 students were eliminated at one time, and one of his roommates was unlucky and was kicked out of the academy.

He still clearly remembers how helpless he felt when his roommate left. Unfortunately, the college had strict rules and those who ranked last in grades had to leave.

"Dix, do you think we can hold on to the end, obtain the essence of life, and become a noble knight?"

Jamie, who couldn't hold it in any longer, confided in his best friend for the first time.

"have no idea!

Our ranking is just in the middle, and maybe someday the people behind us will catch up and overtake us.

I have heard that those who have the highest scores are all children of nobles. They have been well fed since childhood and are stronger than us. They have all received knight training and are not comparable to us.

Some of the students who received the Life Essence have already become Knights. I heard that they will soon be promoted to the second grade and will no longer have classes with us.

If only we had superior qualifications, we would be able to catch up and surpass these guys!"

Deeks said indignantly.

The college has sealed the students' information and the qualification test results are kept completely confidential. Whether they are of high or low qualifications, they now enjoy the same treatment.

However, many things do not need to be explained, and can be seen from daily training. Students with good talents will obviously progress faster in their training.

However, we are currently in the basic training stage, and the advantage of qualifications is not very obvious. As long as the students with lower qualifications work hard, they still have a chance to win over the students with medium qualifications who don't work hard.

No one dared to take it lightly because the information was not released. According to the information released by the academy, the first batch of students eliminated included not only students with medium qualifications, but also students with superior qualifications.

In fact, this was a white lie from Hudson. Those who were eliminated in the first round were all real academic losers.

Everyone is rolling together, and the lazy ones will be whipped. With such a cultivation atmosphere here, how could there be any students who really give up?

The purpose of the lie is to make everyone believe that the gap in qualifications is not insurmountable and can be bridged as long as enough effort is made.

Unfortunately, while students with average talents are working hard, students with good talents are also not idle, and are struggling in the army of internal competition.

Including those noble students who have completed basic training, they still insist on exercising every day in order to increase the probability of awakening the seed of life a little bit.

Not only did they work hard in cultivation, but they also worked hard in their academic subjects. Especially those who had completed basic training put in extra effort in their academic subjects.

It's not that they are illiterate, but the main reason is that the academy's textbooks are too special. It is the "Military Training Record" written by Master Hudson himself.

It doesn't matter whether you understand it or not, just memorize it word for word. What is recorded here is the training method of the Alpha Kingdom's army.

Whether it is the kingdom's standing army or the private army of the great nobles, they all use this theory to train their troops.

All military-related knowledge was valuable. Even if it was public information at the top level, the lesser nobles still could not access it.

Even if one served in the standing army and was trained personally once, there was no way for him to record the complete training methods.

This knowledge alone was enough to make it worthwhile for them to enter the academy for further study. Moreover, there were instructors with rich combat experience to consult, and smart students would seize the opportunity to learn as much as possible.

Their fathers' experience taught them that improving their personal strength alone would only make them a powerful general. If they wanted to climb higher in the military, the key was to learn how to command a large army.

Hudson was the authority in this regard. No one in the kingdom doubted his military command ability, and many noble students were told by their parents before entering school: they must work hard to become Hudson's disciples.

There is no doubt that they are not qualified now, but it does not prevent everyone from working towards this direction.

It's embarrassing when someone with a better background than you works harder than you.

"Don't daydream. There are only a few students with top-notch qualifications in the entire academy.

In our class, I estimate that only the brothers Luo Li and Luo Yin have the possibility, and their training speed is far ahead of us.

Unless we can awaken the legendary hidden bloodline or special physique, we will have a chance to surpass them!"

Jamie said, shaking his head.

He had heard about the hidden bloodline and special physique from his noble classmates, but he had no idea what they were specifically.

There is no chance to find out even if you want to. He is just bragging in front of everyone about information he heard from somewhere. The noble classmate who said this is just as confused.

The tutors in the academy have never been knowledgeable. In terms of knowledge level, they are not even as good as some noble students.

The library is still under construction, and what books will be put in it depends entirely on Master Hudson's mood.

"Just wait, I will definitely be able to awaken my special physique and become a genius knight like my lord.

At that time, I will lead the kingdom's army to conquer all directions, destroy the orc empire in one fell swoop, and create my own supreme legend..."

The boys' second-year fantasies became a unique landscape on campus. Even if the teachers saw them, they would just laugh it off.

Young people are full of energy and dare to think of anything.

There are many different opinions about Hudson's specific strength, and there has been no unified statement.

Anyway, everyone who had fought for him knew that their commander was very powerful. Many people in the army regarded him as the most talented knight in the kingdom.

This statement did not spread widely, mainly because Hudson's dragon and bear were too eye-catching, causing the outside world to ignore his own strength.

The most important thing is that the other talented knights have basically earned their reputations through challenges along the way, and Hudson has never encountered any challenges.

It has nothing to do with your identity or status. When you challenge someone to a duel on the continent of Aslant, you are allowed to bring a mount to the battle.

To challenge Hudson means to challenge the two most powerful men in the sanctuary.

When fighting with other people, everyone knows how to be careful and stop when the time is right. But if they encounter Warcraft, it's hard to say.

If you are not careful enough and get slapped by the dragon's tail or slapped by the earth bear, it can be fatal.

It would be a waste of death. No major force would be willing to provoke the two sacred beasts for a dead idiot.

Chapter 162: One Copper Coin Tax

Near East, Crescent Harbor.

With the sound of whistles, the ship slowly sailed into the port and thunderous applause broke out on the dock.

To celebrate the official opening of the port, all the major forces in the kingdom sent representatives to attend the celebration ceremony.

As the host, Hudson naturally cannot be absent.

"Everyone, the opening ceremony is over. There will be a celebration banquet later. Now you can move freely!"

The brief speech confused all the guests. Although long speeches were not popular in the Alpha Kingdom, this was too brief.

Hudson simply ignored the surprised expressions of the crowd. It was already a day of forced business, so who had the time to talk nonsense here?

The ceremony is all that matters. It's not easy for the people below to have a chance to take a day off.

In order to meet the construction deadline, the construction of Crescent Port was carried out in three shifts from the beginning to the end, regardless of day or night.

"Prime Minister, what do you think of this?"

An accompanying official asked anxiously.

As no representative of the kingdom appeared on stage, Hudson simply announced the end of the ceremony, which inevitably would be interpreted politically.

Whenever there is a conflict between big shots, the first to suffer are the small ones. If there is a commotion, it is likely that the officials who are responsible for planning it will take the blame.

"What's so good about this? This is Marshal Hudson's usual style. Now that the ceremony is over, go back and rest."

The Prime Minister, the Grand Duke of Newfoundland, said without changing his expression.

There was no reaction on his face, but deep down he knew very well that this was Hudson claiming sovereignty over Crescent Harbor.

As the first large port in the Near East, Crescent Port plays an important role in the Near East development strategy.

Although it was built on Hudson's fiefdom, it was funded by the kingdom. According to the kingdom's tradition, there was precedent for direct management by the central government.

"Whoever controls the Crescent controls the Near East."

From the beginning of construction, there were calls for direct administration within the kingdom.

All major factions in the country, including the royal family, are in a state of conflicting psychology.

Everyone was worried that the Koslow family would take control of Crescent Port and expand in the Near East; they were also worried that after the central government took direct control of Crescent Port, Hudson would not be committed to the Near East strategy.

The contradictory psychology makes everyone very headache when making decisions, but reason prevails in the end.

The Khosrow family grew in power in the Near East, and the kingdom was nothing more than having one more powerful noble family, so everyone could still afford it.

If the orcs become powerful again, the kingdom will be destroyed.

The Grand Duke of Newfoundland restrained his emotions, because the royal family had been in trouble recently. The cake that was eaten at once was too big, which aroused strong dissatisfaction among the great nobles in the country.

Caesar IV was now in a difficult situation. The six newly added provinces were all annexed in the name of the queen's dowry.

The legal problem has been solved, but the possibility of dividing the cake has also been cut off.

Even if he was willing to share them with domestic nobles, he had no legal right to deal with these lands.

Even if they were feudal nobles, they were loyal to the queen, not him, the king.

There is no doubt that even if Caesar IV could tolerate his queen's large-scale enfeoffment, the royal family would not agree to it.

The feudal system of the continent of Aslant adheres to the principle of "the vassal of the vassal is not my vassal."

In the face of power, even a husband and wife cannot stand the test. If the queen is allowed to cultivate a group of her own people, the royal power will be divided.

Although the queen and the king have sons, the neonatal mortality rate remains high. Who can guarantee that they will grow up?

If something unexpected happens, these lands will return to the hands of the Moshi royal family again!

In order to prevent accidents, the Alpha royal family must use only "their own people" to develop these six provinces.

Even if something unexpected happened, they would be able to keep the land in their own hands instead of returning it to the Moshi royal family.

Compared with the royal family's future development strategy, this little thing in Crescent Harbor is not worth mentioning at all.

No matter how powerful Hudson is, under the rule system, he is at most a powerful official.

Compared with the previously arrogant five major families in the North, Hudson is now as obedient as a kitten.

As long as the royal family develops faster, there is no need to worry about the vassals becoming more powerful.

Comparing the actual situations faced by both sides, the royal family clearly has an absolute advantage and naturally does not have too many worries in this regard.

...

At the celebration banquet, Hudson greeted representatives from all parties enthusiastically.

The Near East strategy has taken the first substantive step. If it is to make smooth progress in the future, it is bound to require support from all parties.

For a long time afterwards, it seemed that he was leading the nobles of the Near East to confront the nearby orc tribes, but in fact it was an all-out confrontation between the kingdom and the orc empire.

Although Hudson was commanding the battle, everyone had to contribute money, food, supplies, and manpower.

"Marshal, I heard that there have been internal changes in the Orc Empire. The Behemoths, who have fallen from the royal family, are going to migrate here and become our neighbors. I'm afraid the Near East will not be peaceful in the future!"

The Grand Duke of Newfoundland said with a serious look.

As the prime minister of the kingdom, he had to consider the overall situation. Since the establishment of the Near East strategy, this has been an important link that affects the rise and fall of the kingdom.

Even though the Behemoths have lost their royal status, their military strength is still not bad.

The Orc Empire asked them to migrate here. In addition to the internal power struggle, they also wanted to rely on the Behemoth Cavalry to interfere with the development of the Near East.

Faced with the Behemoth Cavalry that came and went like the wind, the only forces the kingdom could fight against were the Warcraft Legion and the Knights.

Unfortunately, the Warcraft Legion was disbanded after the war, and the Knights were also controlled by various nobles.

As our most core military force, we cannot let Hudson control it for a long time.

"It is true that things are not going to be peaceful anymore, but this also indirectly proves that the Kingdom's intelligence department is doing a great job.

If the internal fighting had not been too intense, the Behemoths would not have run to the front line to take root in order to avoid the limelight.

Next it depends on our speed of building the city. As long as the city is built, there will be no problem in a short time.

After all, Behemoth was reluctant to use cavalry to attack the city!"

As he spoke, Hudson stopped smiling.

He had known that the orcs would not watch them develop, but he had not expected the enemy to react so quickly.

The only thing to be thankful for is that the Behemoths probably didn't want to move here and become our neighbors.

No matter what results can be achieved, war will eventually result in death. Can the Behemoths, who are already sparsely populated, afford to die now?

If all the members of the clan were dead, their glorious military exploits would only hasten their decline. The new royal family that replaced them would not be willing to see them rise again.

Praising the "remarkable work of the intelligence department" naturally does not mean simply collecting intelligence, but rather refers to instigating internal strife among the orcs.

No one can tell exactly how much role the kingdom's intelligence department played in the orcs' internal strife, but the orcs began to kill each other.

Even though Hudson believed that the fighting was mainly caused by insufficient resources and that the tribes needed to store more food for the winter, the war broke out at this moment.

"It's good that the Marshal has it in mind. The main reason is that the Behemoths have cast too big a shadow on everyone. I guess many people will have trouble sleeping after receiving this news!"

The Grand Duke of Newfoundland said with a smile.

Sometimes failure in a test is also a good thing. Hudson did not complain or ask for help, which was the best news for the kingdom.

The war had just ended a few months earlier, and all parts of the kingdom were in a state of disrepair, making it really not suitable for a new round of war to break out.

The little episode passed by in a flash, and no one knew that Hudson was just pretending to be calm on the surface, but deep down he was as anxious as everyone else.

But he had to stay calm now as he was in a high position. If he, as the commander, was unsure, the nobles who had not yet entered the Near East in large numbers might be scared and retreat.
