The situation on the mainland was not friendly to the Orc Empire, and the situation at home was even worse for the Behemoths. Going to the front line at this moment could temporarily avoid internal disputes, but it would also be easy to get caught up in the struggle with the Alpha Kingdom.

In order to avoid suspicion, the vassal races began to distance themselves from the Behemoths since they fell from the imperial court.

When they arrived in the Near East, even if they were not fighting alone, there were only a few races they could command.

...

The departure of the Behemoths did not affect the fight for the throne of the Orc Empire, but instead made the fight even more intense.

The constant instigation of all parties turned the dispute from a political struggle into an armed struggle. The several major clans competing for the throne stabbed each other with the knife without mercy.

The Silver Moon Royal Court sent away the elephant-man chieftain who came to seek support, and the Silver Moon Wolf King smiled coldly.

"Daniel, have you seen the true nature of these guys?"

"They are just a bunch of useless people. If they had been so ruthless during the war on the continent, the fate of the Northern Continent might have been completely different!

But their ability to hide their strength is really admirable. If it weren't for this competition for the throne of the emperor, we wouldn't have known that these guys were able to accumulate such a strong family fortune right under our noses."

Daniel's answer made the Silver Moon Wolf King shake his head.

"You are wrong. There is nothing wrong with what they are doing. From the perspective of each race, preserving their strength is the first priority.

As for the situation on the continent and the future of the empire, these are just talk and there is no need to take them too seriously.

The Behemoths are an example. Their contribution to the empire has always been the greatest among all the tribes. However, once they decline, they will still become lost dogs.

If it weren't for their past friendship, they wouldn't even have a chance to leave alive!"

The cold explanation made Crown Prince Daniel's face change drastically. A military genius is not the same as a political strongman. In the past years, he could not help but think about problems from the perspective of the empire.

However, reality is cruel. The Silver Moon Wolf King broke his inherent cognition: it turns out that the empire belongs to everyone, and the race is his own.

"Father, now that we have treated the Behemoths so badly, who will dare to work for the empire in the future?

Although the previous Behemoth King had serious faults, Alex's performance was very good. It would be inappropriate to exile them to the front line."

Daniel couldn't help but defend himself.

He could understand giving priority to preserving their own strength, but allowing other tribes to challenge the Behemoths, forcing them to give up their royal positions and go into self-exile, was beyond his ability to accept.

"Daniel, you are wrong again this time. We don't owe the Behemoths anything, and we have no obligation to escort them.

They did make great contributions to the empire, but in return, they were also pushed to the high position of the first royal family.

If it weren't for the tacit consent of several of our families, how could the Behemoths, with such a small population, have been able to hold on to their position as the leader?

They took the biggest piece of the pie, so they should be prepared to bear the consequences. Regardless of whether the old Behemoth King had anything to do with it, they could only say that they had brought this upon themselves.

Remember, never sympathize with losers, never!"

Daniel was completely stunned when he heard these words that subverted his cognition coming from the mouth of the Silver Moon Wolf King.

Everything that seemed reasonable had actually been secretly priced. In an instant, he understood why the Behemoths were declining and why the four royal families were so indifferent.

It's not that everyone doesn't have the feeling of grief for the death of a rabbit, it's just that emotions are too much of a luxury for emperors, and rationality is what they should have.

Instead of spending a huge price to save the Behemoths that are destined to decline, it is better to take the opportunity to carry out a major purge internally and ease internal conflicts.

...

The arrival of new neighbors did not affect the development of Xueyue Territory. After the port was completed, coastal strongholds sprang up one after another.

The first batch of immigrants were all young and strong reserve forces. They engaged in production in peacetime and took up arms to fight in wartime.

Small settlements have 100 to 200 people, and large settlements have only 300 to 500 people. It's not that Hudson is reluctant to send immigrants, but the settlements are poor and have no supporting facilities, which are not suitable for large groups of people to live in.

After staying at the port for a month, Hudson clearly felt that the number of ships coming in and out gradually increased. In addition to the ships transporting logistical supplies to the kingdom, the fleets of the nobles also frequently came in and out.

Some nobles in the rear areas of their territories have already plucked up the courage to take the first step in developing their territories - selecting a site to build a castle.

Each of them chose the most conservative strategy of "building high walls and slowly clearing the land", and they were definitely "survival" players. The deterrent power of the orcs was obvious.

In comparison, Hudson was radical. There were double-digit strongholds along the coast, but they had not yet built their own castles.

So many people speculated that he wanted to place his base inside the city.

It just so happens that Snow Moon Territory is the core defense zone of the kingdom. In addition to Crescent Harbor, more than ten fortress cities are planned, and you can settle down anywhere you choose.

Building one less castle would save a lot of money. Most of the nobles in the Near East could only envy Hudson's choice.

Only a few lucky ones, whose territories are near fortress cities, can build their nests inside the city.

However, fortune and disaster are interdependent. Being able to place the territory in the city also means that their territory is on the border line and may be threatened by orcs at any time.

We boarded the pier and walked along the avenue into the city. The shops on both sides of the street had already opened for business and were filled with a wide variety of goods.

The scene before him startled Viscount Kayo. If it weren't for the small number of pedestrians, he would have suspected that he had come to a bustling metropolis.

"Master, we have been drifting on the sea for so many days, and we are all exhausted. Why don't we rest in the city for two days before we set off again?

I have already contacted the city's management. Marshal Hudson has issued an order that all newly arrived immigrants can set up tents in the resettlement area and stay there for three days free of charge."

The housekeeper's words brought Kayo back from his trance.

I have to admit that Hudson was quite considerate in this regard. Not only did it waive the transit tax, it also waived the accommodation fees for immigrants.

Although you have to set up your own tent, these are essential items to carry with you when you are out and about.

Resting here means really resting here. The Crescent Harbor has just been opened up and there are not many nobles living in the city.

The nobles of the same level as Kayo were just passing through, and none of them lived here permanently. If you wanted to go out and socialize, you might not be able to find anyone.

As the host, Hudson is now a wealthy family, and ordinary nobles could never see him in the past.

Although the relationship between the two families has been repaired in recent days, it has only returned to a normal level and is still far from being a long-standing friendship!

Unless Earl Pierce and his son come, it will not be Hudson's turn to personally receive other members of the Dalton family when they arrive here.

"Then find an inn to rest for two days, contact the city management staff, and ask them to designate an area for the immigrants to set up camp.

Knight Xiludi, you have a good relationship with the Koslo family. Ask someone to find out which noble teams have passed by recently."

Viscount Kayo came to his senses and gave orders immediately.

The reason why he brought his team here so early was to seize the first opportunity in the development of the territory. For most nobles, the first-mover advantage was very important.

Establishing a foothold in the local area first means that they can start production first. The noble lords who arrive later are their potential customers.

Except for a few wealthy noble lords, most nobles have to be careful with their budgets when developing their territories.

Although the Dalton family is wealthy, Caill is only the nephew of Governor Pierce. No matter how respected he is, there is still a layer of separation between them, and the resources he can get are naturally not unlimited.

In order not to cause trouble to his uncle and to reduce the resentment of his cousin, Kayo chose to take the risk.

This adventure is relative. The reason why Kayo dared to bring the team here in advance is because he believed that the orcs did not have the courage to cross the Snow Moon Territory and go deep into the rear to cause trouble.

"Okay, Your Excellency!"

Knight Shilodi replied with a slightly sad tone.

He did have a very good relationship with the Koslow family, and some of the core figures were his friends. However, he chose his allegiance in advance and missed out on this wave of development dividends.

Nobles make their livings by reputation. Once they have pledged allegiance to the Dalton family, they naturally cannot change their allegiance midway.

Following the wrong leader inevitably affected his development. Although he followed Earl Pierce in his battles, his hard work outweighed his achievements.

The boss hadn't won any victories, so naturally the younger brother couldn't expect to have any military achievements. As a result, after a few years, he was still a young knight.

Seeing his old friends climbing up the ladder, Xiludi could only envy them. Viscount Kayo brought him to the Near East because he was attracted by his connections.

From a thug to a foreign affairs coordinator, it was a step forward in Xiludi's career. Unfortunately, this step forward was not due to military merit, but to personal connections.

The aristocratic world is also full of human relationships, but unfortunately Xiludi is a traditional aristocrat. Rather than advancing through personal connections, he hopes to rise through military merit.

This is determined by the social atmosphere. Nobles with military merit are more respected than other nobles and they have to speak more confidently.

The more friends you have, the easier your life will be. Although the difference in status has alienated the connection between each other, the feelings deep in the memory still remain.

As long as there is no interest involved, we are all good friends.

...

"Xiludi, welcome to Crescent Harbor. You should have sent someone a message in advance so that I can meet you at the dock!

If His Royal Highness knew you were coming, he would be very happy, but unfortunately the Duke just returned to the Mountain Territory today and you just missed it."

Baron Adrian said generously.

Time flies, and it is not easy for old friends to meet. Not only did the two of them work together under the Dalton family, but Xiludi was also a participant in the initial division of territory.

Occasionally, I would pass on small pieces of information, and I did that quite often.

Although there is an exchange of interests involved, if there is no friendship, money cannot be given away even if there is money.

"Haha, Adrian, you're too polite. I'm lucky to meet an old friend like you.

The Duke is very busy, and all the decisions he makes are important matters concerning the rise and fall of the kingdom. I dare not disturb him rashly."

Xiludi said with a smile.

The favor he had sold to Hudson was the most valuable political investment in his life. He would not use it easily unless it was absolutely necessary.

It was just to get some information and chat with old friends. Anyway, the Dalton family would reimburse the expenses, so there was no need to sacrifice precious favors.

As long as it is not important information, the nobles will give each other convenience. The main reason why Kayo sent Shiludi out was to strengthen the relationship.

If he went there personally, without paying anything, the city officials would tell him the basic information.

"Shiludi, you have become a bad boy. In the past, you would never say such a thing.

Back then, you treated the Duke as your nephew. Now that you have distanced yourself from him, I think the Duke will definitely not be happy."

After hearing what Adrian said, Xiludi rolled her eyes. It wasn't that he had changed, it was just that the gap in status was too big for him to catch up!

"Come on, Adrian. It's as if you haven't changed. Now you always call him Your Highness the Duke or My Lord the Duke. Previously you used to call him by his first name.

If you can do the same as before and not care about the difference in status, then I will admire you as a person!"

Xiludi retorted disdainfully.

There was no way, the status gap was too big. Although he was a knight and Hudson was a baron, they were essentially both members of the petty nobility class.

With their accumulated connections, the two are not much worse than the fledgling Hudson.

Everything is different now. Adults must be bound by rules and regulations. If they act recklessly based on friendship, even if Hudson doesn't say anything, society will teach them a lesson.
Chapter 485:
Chapter 165: Restarting Trade

The little episode did not affect Hudson. As his status and position continued to improve, he inevitably distanced himself from his former friends and relatives.

Not to mention those who are distantly related, even his brothers would feel a little unnatural when they met him and got along with him.

Unless it was a big deal, friends and relatives would not bother Hudson. For the sake of everyone's comfort, Hudson would not take the initiative to get close to them.

Even if there is a wedding or funeral, you can just send someone to deliver a generous gift. If you go there in person, you will not only steal the show, but also bring a lot of unnecessary trouble to others.

After all, the network of relationships in the aristocratic world is like a spider web.

Relatives and friends have relatives and friends. If you act too close, what should you do if the relatives and friends of your relatives come to you for help when they have trouble?

It's not just Hudson who has a headache, his relatives and friends will have a headache even more. Bringing people here to seek help is equivalent to using Hudson's favors to exchange for favors from other relatives and friends.

The value is totally unequal, and it is definitely a loss-making deal. But some people are too close, or they have owed favors in the past, so now there is no way to refuse.

Appropriate distance is good for everyone.

Hudson was very satisfied with the statistics. The increasing flow of people in Crescent Harbor meant that the situation of only people leaving but not coming in was about to change.

Business can only flourish when the flow of people increases. Don't be fooled by the large number of shops outside that have opened for business. In fact, it is a false prosperity created by Hudson.

They are all Mr. Ha's own business. There is no rent and no taxes, but less than 10% of the shops can barely break even.

It can be said that Hudson starts to lose money and gain publicity as soon as it opens every day.

There is no other way. Since we cannot attract enough merchants to come and open up the land, we have to do it ourselves in order to develop the market as quickly as possible.

"Yes, the amount of money paid out this month has decreased by 30% compared to last month.

If this situation continues, I estimate that in a few months, these shops will be able to break even."

After hearing Hudson's words, Rudolph was ashamed. As the new Minister of Commerce of Xueyue Territory, all the industries in his hands were losing money, and he really had no confidence.

You have to know that the Ministry of Commerce still holds the monopoly on salt and iron. It would be a joke if they told others that they were making losses with such a golden bowl in their hands.

"Your Excellency the Duke, please rest assured. The port's passenger flow is increasing rapidly, and our Ministry of Commerce will definitely turn losses into profits as soon as possible.

The short-term deficit was mainly due to the fact that people did not know that they could buy all daily necessities in the port, and most of the noble lords brought large amounts of supplies with them.

The Ministry of Commerce is planning a nationwide promotion. In a few months, all the nobles in the kingdom will know that Crescent Harbor has a rich variety of goods.

Small and medium-sized nobles had to organize transportation capacity and transport supplies from the country. There were many troubles that needed to be solved along the way, and the costs were difficult to control.

Our pricing is still very competitive. When the supplies they have are used up, someone will definitely choose to purchase directly from the port.

We will be able to double the profits next year for the losses we incur this year. As long as we can monopolize the supply of materials needed for the development of the Near East, all the initial investments will be worth it!"

Rudolph's words made Hudson slightly stunned. He had always been the one to make promises to his subordinates, but he never expected that his subordinates would also learn to make promises for him.

To develop the Near East, the materials needed are not just a little bit. If it is really monopolized, the profits will be absolutely terrifying.

Not to mention that it can fill all the financial holes in Xueyue Territory, it can at least solve one-third of the funding gap.

"Ha ha......"

"Don't even think about monopoly. Our cost advantage is only for small and medium-sized nobles.

The great nobles along the coast organize the transportation of supplies themselves, and the cost is almost the same as ours, and the prices of some supplies are even lower.

When participating in this transaction, making money is secondary. The most important thing is to lower the price of materials, so that the small and medium-sized nobles will not be financially weak and affect the development of the territory."

Hudson's explanation made everyone respect him. He was indeed the marshal of the kingdom, and he always considered the interests of the kingdom first.

Compared with the Near East strategy, the little benefits brought by monopoly seem insignificant.

In essence, Crescent Port is a treasure trove. As long as the Near East strategy is successful, it will generate continuous profits.

"Your Excellency the Duke has a far-sighted vision. Now is not the time to consider short-term interests. The threat of orcs is imminent, and our top priority is to promote the development of the Near East as soon as possible.

Due to the increase in traffic, many nobles and business travelers have come to consult about purchasing commercial shops and residences in recent times.

If it is sold to the public, it should be able to recover a lot of funds. The problem now is the pricing issue. With the threat of orcs, it is difficult to sell the property at a good price.

The Ministry of Government Affairs is considering selling one-third of the shops and houses in the city first, which is expected to bring back 200,000 gold coins. The rest will be gradually sold out after the situation stabilizes..."

Before Jacob could finish his words, Hudson interrupted him and said, "No need!

The funds needed for territory development are enormous, and a mere 200,000 gold coins is just our current expenses for one or two months.

If you want to sell real estate at a high price, certainty is an important factor. Everyone knows that if the Near East is developed, a lot of money can be made from it, but no one can guarantee that the Kingdom's Near East strategy will be successful.

Instead of selling assets at a low price, we would take all the risks to put everyone at ease.

The Ministry of Government Affairs has issued an announcement that I will keep all the properties and shops in Xinyue Port myself. I will never sell them to anyone before the Near East strategy is successful.

If you need to use it, you can go to the real estate company to rent it. In order to protect everyone's interests, all contracts are signed for one year, and the price is determined by the market.

The Real Estate Department sets a reference price as the minimum rental price. If a property is sought after by multiple people, the highest bidder will win.

Including the shops operated by the Ministry of Commerce, they will also be acquired through bidding in the later stage. When the number of business travelers increases, some loss-making businesses can be stopped.

The Ministry of Public Security please pay attention to this. I don't want to see forced sales, coercion and inducement happening in the city.

If someone breaks the rules, it means they are against me. No matter how powerful they are, I will catch them first.

Follow the rules, and if you get into trouble, I will take responsibility. No matter who you offend, you will not be blamed! "

"My game, my turf, my rules"!

After working hard for so many years, Hudson finally dared to say this domineering statement to the outside world.

Unfortunately, I am still restricted by the rules and can only let my subordinates arrest people first. I cannot say something more domineering - kill without mercy!

If a group of nobles were really killed, Hudson would not be able to cover it.

Places with vast land and sparse population are not suitable for real estate development. Even in cities where land resources are relatively scarce, it is difficult to sell them at a high price if security is not guaranteed.

In Hudson's opinion, being able to recover 200,000 gold coins was already a very optimistic estimate. If he wanted to sell this amount, he would most likely have to sell off the best properties.

Anyone who dares to buy a property in the city at this time is a gambler. If it weren't for Hudson's reputation, I guess no one would even take the risk.

The most prosperous port in the Near East was only sold for such a small amount of money. It would be better to just let the house go to waste.

Others are making huge profits from real estate speculation, but it doesn't make sense that he can only recover some of the construction costs.

Instead of selling the assets at a low price, it is better to keep them and collect rent. As long as the flow of people at the port increases, there will be no worries about not being able to rent out the houses.

At least the hotels in the city have now achieved a balance between income and expenditure. Several high-end hotels that specialize in serving the nobility have even begun to make a profit.

No matter how much you earn, it's a good start. Almost all cities are important sources of income for the nobles.

The annual taxes and house rents from Hudson's several cities in the southeastern province could bring him hundreds of thousands of gold coins in income.

The development prospects of Xinyue Port are greater than those inland cities. Once it develops, the benefits will only increase faster.

There is no need to worry about competitors. Without the help of the Kingdom's Mage Corps, it is almost impossible to open a large port in the sea full of reefs.

Hudson was able to continuously build bases in coastal areas because he had a working dragon. Maxim could easily deal with ordinary reef obstacles by just rolling over.

In addition, he was the highest commander in the Near East and could use public resources for personal gain. He often mobilized the magician corps accompanying the army to help on the pretext of coastal defense.

Even if ordinary noble lords were willing to spend money to repair the port, it would be impossible for them to mobilize such a strong force to clear the waterway.

Even if a nobleman was willing to invest a huge sum of money to solve these problems, they still had to consider the transportation problem. It was true that the prairie was flat, but that did not mean that all places were flat.

There are also special terrains such as rivers and mountains, but they do not account for a very high proportion.

The Snow Moon Territory itself is large enough that Hudson can make any changes on his own territory. Other noble lords don't have such a large territory, so if they want to follow suit, they need to coordinate many relationships.

In this small piece of land in the Near East, no one dares to compare with Hudson in terms of appeal.

No matter how powerful his family's connections were, they were useless here. If the orcs attacked, he would still need Master Hudson's help to deal with it.

With this core factor as support, and the fact that Hudson paid attention to his table manners and was very caring towards the noble lords, no one had any reason to go against him.

"Your Excellency the Duke, your holding of all the properties can indeed enhance the outside world's confidence in Crescent Harbor.

However, the financial hole in the territory is getting bigger and bigger. Although the kingdom helped us build the main city, we still need to improve some of the auxiliary defense facilities ourselves.

According to the plan submitted by the Military Affairs Department, our investment in infrastructure alone next year will exceed 800,000 gold coins, among which the most important construction projects are the construction of auxiliary ports and buildings within the city.

The cost of immigration is not a small amount. It is estimated to cost 550,000 gold coins, half of which will be used for the resettlement of immigrants.

Compared with the cost, the bigger problem is the severe shortage of labor in Xueyue Territory. The speed of immigration cannot keep up with the growth of our demand for labor.

What's more, the current labor force in the Mountain Territory is merely sufficient and is far from being in surplus.

Judging from the current situation, at most 40,000 young and strong men can be transferred from the Mountain Territory, and 15,000 young and strong men can be transferred from the Burke Territory (formerly the Royal Territory). If there are more, it will affect the development of the two places.

Since the end of the war, we have sent people to purchase slaves from outside, but it is still a drop in the bucket.

Not only was the kingdom short of manpower for its Near East development strategy, the Frankish Kingdom and the Libyan Kingdom in the southern continent were also engaged in large-scale development and construction.

As a result, the price of slaves in the market was no longer affordable. The price of young and strong slaves exceeded that of ordinary war horses, and even the price of women and children doubled.

Up to now, we have purchased a total of 80,000 slaves, with an average purchase cost of 17.6 gold coins per person, of which less than one-third are young and strong.

Prices have lost rationality. If they continue to rise, we will have no choice but to suspend purchases.

This does not include the amortization of military spending, otherwise the expenditure would be even more terrifying.

Currently, the only income generated by Xueyue Territory is fishery, which contributed 3,500 gold coins in profit last month and is expected to reach 4,000 gold coins this month.

Fish products cannot be sold at a high price. We are the ones who provide meat for the kingdom's garrison troops and the labor teams that come to build the city. The market has already been developed.

We can only wait for the noble lords to purchase in the future. Considering the price issue, the market for this area will not be too big.

The livestock industry is in its infancy and cannot generate revenue for the time being. Even if it develops, the revenue will not be optimistic.

If you want to generate your own income, you still have to rely on the Ministry of Commerce. But this is just a drop in the bucket. For at least five years, it will be difficult to control the annual deficit of Xueyue County within one million. "

Jacob said helplessly.

The initial investment for a new territory is a pitfall. The official registered area of ​​Xueyue Territory is more than 400,000 square kilometers, but no one knows the actual controlled area.

Anyway, when setting up a base, everyone only considers whether the natural conditions are suitable, and whether there are borders is never taken into consideration.

It doesn't matter if it's beyond the scope of the Near East. The land outside the kingdom is considered unowned land, and any land that is capable of being occupied is considered the land of Xueyue Territory.

The more fun it is to enclose land, the more difficult it is to invest in construction. Now that the stronghold has been established, is it reasonable not to build a castle to protect the safety of the immigrants?

Expenditure remains high, but income is pitifully low. It's not that fish is not abundant, it's just that purchasing power is limited!

Fish is also meat. No matter how cheap it is, it is still more expensive than grains such as rye and potatoes.

With a limited budget, the nobles were lucky enough to be able to fill the serfs' stomachs, and meat would only appear when the food was improved.

The main consumer group at present is only the Kingdom's garrison. It is also thanks to Hudson's high food standards that he can sell so much fish.

In fact, the soldiers were tired of eating fish every day. It was just that it was difficult to transport cattle and sheep, and the price in the Near East was too high, so the military budget only allowed them to eat a combination meal of "black bread + fish + vegetables".

Snow Moon Territory was in serious deficit and was completely supported by the income from Mountain Territory. Unfortunately, after bearing the huge military expenditure, Mountain Territory had no surplus.

Two standing infantry legions + a knightly regiment + two cavalry regiments + a small magic beast legion, plus a soldier training academy, as well as a large reserve force and a naval force of over ten thousand people, have long exceeded the armed forces that a noble lord should have.

The armed forces of many small countries on the continent cannot match Hudson.

Apart from the royal family, no other noble family in the kingdom dares to say that their military strength can surpass Hudson's.

The war was over, but Hudson did not reduce the army. It was not because he wanted to be aggressive, but because he was forced to do so.

Being neighbors with orcs, it is not enough to intimidate them with just a name to make them retreat, armed forces are also needed as a guarantee.

The kingdom's garrison can indeed play a role, but if you want to mobilize troops on a large scale, you need to report to the royal capital.

As the commander of the frontier, Hudson also needs to avoid suspicion. It is natural to command the entire army during wartime, but in normal times, to mobilize the army, he still has to follow the formal procedures.

In an emergency, it was fine to break the rules once in a while, but if the garrison was mobilized every now and then, I guess Caesar IV would have trouble sleeping.

Choosing to go all out with military spending, the territory's fiscal revenue was naturally insufficient. The shortfall was now entirely supported by the profits from Ha's magic potion.

No one knows the exact amount of profit except Hudson himself.

The outside world can only calculate the cost and profit according to normal magic potions. Due to limited sales, the total monthly shipment price is only more than 300,000 gold coins.

According to the gross profit of ordinary magic potion wholesale, the final profit is at most 100,000 gold coins. After all, not only magic materials cost money, but the salary of the alchemy masters is not cheap either.

Everyone simply ignored the fact that Hudson used a large number of magic apprentices. Countless alchemy masters personally confirmed that all of Hudson's high-quality potions were made by masters.

In the eyes of many people, Hudson's territory is now in financial deficit. A few days ago, he applied for a subsidy for frontline lords from the kingdom.

The benefits that originally belonged to the nobles of the North have now become exclusive to the nobles of the Near East. Hudson was the first to come here to establish a business, and he also became the first lord to enjoy the kingdom's subsidies.

Unfortunately, the kingdom's finances are in serious deficit. The Ministry of Finance cannot come up with enough cash for this year's subsidy of 300,000 gold coins, and can only use strategic materials to make up for it.

Hudson certainly didn't believe this. The real reason was that once the cash was paid, there would be a large number of nobles who would ask for subsidies from the kingdom under the pretext of developing the fiefdom.

Directly distributing subsidies in kind may seem to make little difference, but it eliminates the possibility of fraudulently taking subsidies.

If the kingdom delivered the subsidized materials to the destination but did not see the people, it would be hard to explain.

"The fiscal deficit problem may be solved together with the problem of expensive labor.

Trade has been interrupted for so long that the smugglers and slave traders who were active between the Kingdom and the Orc Empire must have been unable to hold back any longer.

Let Kate contact them. As long as they pay the smuggling tax, we can secretly issue them customs passes.

All smuggled goods must be approved by us. The Near East is much closer to the orcs than the North, so the tax is increased by 100%.

There is no need to restrict slave traders. They can do whatever they want. Whether they capture slaves themselves or purchase them from the orc tribes, we don't care.

We will buy slaves who are suitable for coolie work directly and the price will be determined by the market. As for other slaves, they can deal with them as they wish, but a tax of one-fifth of the market price will be levied.

Every time you sell a certain number of slaves to Xueyue, you can be exempted from the tax of one special slave and also get corresponding points.

With the points, they can purchase weapons and equipment in the territory. As long as the points are enough, magic equipment can also be purchased.

You can discuss and formulate the specific standards.

But we must make it clear in advance that the slave trade has nothing to do with us. If they are caught by the orcs, it is just their bad luck. The Snow Moon Territory will not stand up for them. "

Hudson said unscrupulously.

It's not easy to make money. The profits from magic potions seem lucrative, but who knows how long they can last?

After all, the ones who are taken advantage of are a minority.

Even if you deliberately use hunger marketing, after using it for a period of time, people will slowly return to rationality.

No matter how fast your cultivation speed is, you will still get stuck when you encounter a bottleneck.

Except for a few wealthy lazy people, I'm afraid most nobles will rationally calculate the cost. Hudson didn't know how long it would last.

Reason forced him to plan ahead. If the source of money dried up, it would not be so easy to find a solution.

The best solution is to restart trade with the Orc Empire. The reason why the Northern nobles were able to survive in the harsh environment of the constant invasion of Orcs was because of the smuggling trade.

The only difference is that during the continental war, the orcs were unable to seize enough wealth, and there was not much money to be made from simple commercial trade.

But it doesn't matter, if you don't have money, you can sell slaves. Anyway, the orc tribe is killing happily, so selling the enemies as slaves in exchange for the supplies they need is not a problem.
Chapter 486:
Chapter 166: Ten Deadly Sins (asking for monthly ticket)

As soon as the news of opening up the smuggling trade was released, the northern noble circle was in an uproar.

The biggest dealer in the smuggling trade in the Alpha Kingdom is the Northern noble group headed by the five major families.

Smugglers and slave traders all depend on this group.

Since the outbreak of the continental war, the smuggling trade has been completely cut off. In order to restore the trade line, the northern nobles have been running around in the kingdom.

Unfortunately, the five major families are not popular, and the harder they lobby, the tighter the blockade on the border becomes.

In the past, the supplies of the nobles in the northern border had to pass through the north. They were inherently subject to the control of others and had no choice but to compromise.

However, the current border is the Near East, and with the convenience of port and sea transportation, Hudson does not need to consider the opinions of the northern nobles.

Under Hudson's leadership, the Kingdom's standing army often launched attacks to crack down on smuggling trade. Smugglers who dared to show up were basically killed.

No matter who they came from, their death was in vain. No one dared to come forward and claim the "crime of colluding with alien races."

Accidents occurred in seven or eight out of ten smuggling operations, so much so that in recent months, many children of northern nobles have died suddenly in accidents.

No matter how lucrative a business is, it can't withstand such a disaster. The Northern noble group, which suffered heavy losses, hated Hudson bitterly, but was powerless to do anything.

After all, it is a business that cannot be brought to the table. There is nothing wrong with doing it secretly, but it cannot be brought to the table for discussion.

The loss of profitable business was secondary. The politically embarrassing situation made things even worse for the northern nobles.

Not to mention looking for trouble with Hudson, their political power in the court is now difficult to protect themselves. Many officials from the North were imprisoned by Caesar IV, and their lives are now unknown.

At one point, these five major families all wanted to develop the navy and open up a trade route to the Orc Empire from the sea.

Unfortunately, the idea is beautiful, but the reality is very bleak. It is true that the North has a port, but they don't have a shipyard!

The port was opened during the reign of Caesar III, and has only been in operation for a few years, so it has not had time to accumulate naval foundation.

In this respect, they were even worse off than Hudson. At least Hudson was able to buy the shipyard from the royal family through political deals.

The current situation of the five major families in the North is that they can't spend money even if they have it. Moreover, they don't have much money and can't use money to stun the sellers.

No one would risk falling out with the royal family to help someone who has a grudge against their family.

The five dukes saw the country being forced into a vicious cycle of militarism and self-consumption and were anxious.

No one was sure whether the king wanted to attack them or was deliberately playing psychological tactics.

Now Caesar IV's actions against them are all naked conspiracies.

If we disband the troops now, the king might one day take their crimes as evidence and mobilize the standing army to wipe out the rebellion.

As long as the procedures are legal and the benefits are in place, the great nobles in the kingdom will not mind removing these annoying guys from the chessboard.

"The news has been confirmed. Hudson does intend to open up the smuggling trade, but he will impose heavy taxes and restrict trade commodities.

It can be preliminarily determined that there is a problem with Xueyueling's finances.

Although Hudson swept across the country during the Continental War, he did not actually gain much spoils due to the inconvenience of carrying them.

It is already difficult to maintain a huge military arsenal relying solely on the income from the Mountain Territory and magic potions, not to mention the expenses for the development of the Snow Moon Territory.

But Hudson was still fond of seeking fame and reputation, and he refused to collect even the transit tax that was offered to him. He had no choice but to open the smuggling channel.

It shouldn't be a conspiracy against us!"

Duke Rodriguez analyzed rationally.

Life is hard and people are in panic, so much so that now everyone they see is a threat.

No matter what happens, first analyze whether it is a conspiracy against you.

This overly cautious nature allowed them to avoid many risks, but the price was that they began to lose their hair at a young age.

"Just because it's not a conspiracy against us doesn't mean we can profit from it.

Hudson is now in power, and it would be too easy for him to target us."

While speaking, Duke Angel also glanced at Duke Thorsten.

I don't know if there will be any accidents in other people's businesses, but the Locknard family's business in the Near East will definitely not be able to continue.

If they were not concerned about the political impact and the fear of triggering a chain reaction, they would all want Duke Thorsten to return the ancestral land of the Koslo family to them.

These are all grudges from a hundred years ago. All the original direct descendants of the Koslow family have died, and Hudson is just a rising branch. It is nonsense to say that the hatred is deep-rooted.

The two sides have been stubbornly opposing each other, mostly for the sake of the nobles' face.

The newer the nobles were, the more they valued the family's reputation. The loss of the ancestral property was a shame for all members of the Koslo family.

Unfortunately, there is no way to retreat from this step. The worse the situation is, the stronger you have to be.

If they show timidity when facing the outside world, and the outside world mistakenly believes that they are in decline, it will easily lead to public attacks.

"The situation is not that bad. As a new noble, Hudson is very careful about his reputation and will not mess with his reputation.

Hudson was able to rise to a high position not only because of his ability to fight, but also because of his reputation for distinguishing between public and private affairs and being principled.

After so many years of fighting in the south and the north, have you ever heard of him deliberately cheating others or settling personal grudges?

The whole kingdom believed that he could handle issues objectively and fairly, which was why all parties ignored his background and pushed him to the position as an exception.

So business can still be done, but within the rules he sets, the profits may not be as high as before.

Another detail is that Hudson likes orc slaves. It can be seen from the decrees he made that he encourages everyone to trade slaves from the orc empire.

If there were enough slaves, they could even offset taxes and purchase the most advanced weapons.

With such clauses in place, it is estimated that all smugglers will become part-time slave traders.

We still have an advantage in this regard. If we find cooperation with those large tribes, it will not be a problem to get tens of thousands of slaves a year.

If the interests are right, we may even become the best partner for Hudson."

Duke Rodriguez said with a smile.

As a core member of the Northern nobility, who had not participated in the slave trade during the smuggling process?

These are all old-line businesses. With the connections they have accumulated from long-term smuggling trade, they are inherently more advantageous than newcomers.

"Why does Hudson need so many orc slaves? Is he really trying to weaken the orc empire as much as possible as he said?"

Duke Hiro said with a hint of doubt.

To weaken the Orc Empire, we just need to purchase slaves from powerful races. Ordinary Orcs not only have low combat power, but also reproduce very quickly.

"Maybe it's just a lack of people!

The Xueyue Territory is so large that there are not enough people to fill it.

Especially in the early stages of defense construction, more labor is needed. If there is not enough manpower, then orcs can be used to make up the numbers.

These orcs could still make do with simple labor. Moreover, he had used a large number of orc slaves in the early days of his business, so he probably had accumulated a lot of experience.

But he overlooked the fact that the Near East and the Mountain Territory were different. Using orc slaves on a large scale right under the orcs' noses was a stimulus that few orc tribes could bear.

Let's wait and see, maybe we can see an orc riot with internal and external cooperation.

Of course, it is also possible that our Marshal Hudson was well prepared and deliberately set a trap for the orcs to fall into.

When it comes to using troops and fighting wars, our Marshal Hudson is still very reassuring."

Duke Rodriguez replied with a half-smile.

No matter what the other companies choose, he has decided to get involved in this deal.

No matter how big the risk is, it is better than going bankrupt where you are.

In order to raise funds, their exploitation of the territory has reached its limit.

Not only did the serfs have a hard time, but the passing caravans were also squeezed dry and were suffering terribly.

Today, those simple grassroots merchants have almost disappeared from the North. Those who still persist basically have aristocratic backgrounds.

Not only did he offend the outsiders, but his subordinates also complained bitterly. They were forced to follow the army expansion and could not even stop to take a breath and rest.

As an insightful nobleman, Rodriguez knew very well that this situation could not continue, otherwise it would inevitably collapse.

However, the cruel reality forced him to grit his teeth and persevere.

Time is what they need most. The king cannot keep his eyes on them and wait for the situation to change. Everything will be different.

The counterattack has begun, and the large tracts of territory newly acquired by the royal family are the source of the trouble.

However, in order to hide themselves, they could only wait for the incident to slowly ferment and did not dare to jump out and confront the royal family directly.

...

The arrival of a large number of smugglers brought prosperity to Xueyue Territory.

The most direct beneficiaries were the hotels and taverns in the city. Many shops put up "full house" signs for the first time.

Influenced by this, some visionary businessmen have taken the lead in taking root and developing characteristic tertiary industries.

All shops can be sublet as long as enough money is paid.

Mr. Hudson started a bunch of businesses mainly to attract traffic, but he was not prepared to develop all industries.

Compared to taking risks in business, it is more convenient to collect rent and taxes directly.

Crescent Port, with its high population mobility, needs economic vitality, and the planned economy obviously cannot meet the demand.

How can those shop assistants who are forced to do things without any real effort and can only mechanically follow orders to sell goods compete with the merchants?

Hudson was willing to lose money in the short term to attract customers, but he was not prepared to persist in a business that would result in long-term losses.

The number of shops operating at a loss is decreasing, rental income is increasing, and it is only a matter of time before they turn losses into profits.

Especially with the emergence of bulk commodity purchases, Hudson finally received the first "smuggling tax", changing the embarrassing situation of the territory only exporting but not importing.

Everything was going well, but trouble also came knocking.

Capturing slaves from the Orc Empire was fine, and although it did not conform to mainstream moral standards, there was no law in the kingdom prohibiting it.

Even if there are saints, they will at most say a few words in secret, and no one will sympathize with the orcs openly.

The problem is the smuggling trade. In the past, the Ten Thousand Kingdoms had condoned its existence, but it was ultimately shady.

Smuggling supplies to the Orc Empire is a serious crime that will lead to the extermination of the entire family. Once you are caught and the evidence is exposed, you will be killed.

The trade route had just been opened, and Hudson felt the pressure. The ministers in the kingdom who opposed the smuggling trade directly challenged him in the court.

Some nobles who disliked Hudson also added fuel to the fire.

Hudson didn't know how the northern nobles handled these matters back then, but he knew that this matter was very difficult to handle.

"Baron José, write back to His Majesty the King for me.

Tell His Majesty that we were conducting a training camp, which allowed the smugglers to take advantage of the situation.

Once the army is trained, we will arrest the smugglers as soon as possible and will never let these kingdom parasites go!"

It was impossible to admit it. As the highest military commander in the Middle East, how could he be associated with smugglers?

It was all because the smugglers were too cunning and took advantage of the military training.

Anyway, in order to ensure the combat effectiveness of the front-line troops, training cannot be stopped. The problem of combating smuggling can only be dealt with after the work is done.

Being perfunctory won't solve the problem, but Hudson has no choice.

Under the guidance of political correctness, it is impossible for him to defend the smugglers.

Even if we are investigating the intelligence of the Orc Empire, it is impossible to say that all smugglers go there with a mission.

"My Lord Duke, I'm afraid this explanation won't work. Under pressure from all sides, the kingdom is likely to send out an investigation team, or even directly form an anti-smuggling team.

There are precedents for all this. When the Northern nobles were at their most rampant, they dared to sell everything to the Orc Empire. In order to combat smuggling, the kingdom formed an anti-smuggling team, which temporarily interrupted the smuggling trade.

Later, due to financial pressure and with the help of the northern nobles, the kingdom acquiesced to the existence of smuggling trade, but its behavior was restricted.

The smuggling trade in the Near East has just begun, and among the goods we sell, there are no weapons or equipment. In principle, it is within the tolerance range of the kingdom.

However, many powerful people in the kingdom benefited from the smuggling trade back then. We have just started here and have not had time to build a community of interests.

so......"

After listening to Jose's analysis, Hudson instantly understood what was going on. No wonder he was being targeted, because he had touched someone's cheese!

Under normal circumstances, given his popularity in the kingdom, even if he was hated, it wouldn't cause such a big storm.

Apart from the Northern Aristocratic Group, all other powerful groups in the kingdom have several younger generations promoted by Master Hudson.

Maybe these people don't have the right to speak, but they are still somewhat loyal to each other. If there were no conflict of interest, there would never be so many people making trouble.

Thinking about it carefully, everyone was still holding back. All the impeachments were only aimed at the smuggling trade, and Hudson himself was not implicated.

It is easy to understand the problem, but it is difficult to solve it. Hudson cannot divide the cake just because he wants to.

Every major distribution of interests requires a long period of bargaining and reaching a new balance before a community of interests can be formed.

"Send the letter first and delay for a while. Even if the kingdom wants to set up an anti-smuggling team, it won't be possible to make a decision in one or two days.

Let's give them some information secretly. If they want to join, then come! Anyway, the area bordering the orcs is not just our Snow Moon Territory. If they want to join, it's not convenient to stop them.

Later on, we will let them compete. Who gets more and who gets less will ultimately be determined by their strength!"

Hudson said with an annoyed look on his face.

The distribution of benefits is always the most troublesome thing. He can't even avoid such things, let alone actively participate in them.

In the past, when the war blocked trade routes, everyone went hungry together and no one had any objections. But now when I see someone eating meat, I instantly become unbalanced.

What is worrying is not the scarcity but the inequality.

The current Orc Empire is definitely not as prosperous as it was in the past. Even if the smuggling trade is liberalized, the profits will not be as high as before.

The Alpha Kingdom can import a series of daily necessities such as tea, cloth, salt, pots and pans, spices, etc. to the Orc Empire.

The only commodities the Orc Empire could offer were slaves and furs.

Livestock are hard to sell. Transporting a large number of livestock makes too much noise. Everyone is engaged in smuggling and cannot pass through the open road.

Any noble officer who caught the smuggler and investigated the case could kill the smuggler.

It's useless to have a backer. Once the truth is revealed, even the king can't hide it for the sake of saving his face.

Similar things have happened from time to time in the past. Even if an agreement is reached above to condone the existence of smuggling trade, the laws of the kingdom cannot be ignored.

This kind of thing is very common when you encounter a noble officer with whom you have a personal grudge.

Even if the elders retaliated afterwards, the person involved would not be able to see it. It would be difficult to avoid death if he was charged with colluding with alien races.

Smart smugglers try to keep a low profile as much as possible. Especially when transporting goods whose origins cannot be explained, they must be very careful and try not to alert the nearby garrisons.

There were few goods to sell, so they could only make up for it with hard currency. The Orc Empire had few magic crystal mines, gold and silver mines, and the rich mines were monopolized by a few royal families. Most of the Orc tribes were very poor.

Apart from raising livestock, they could only hunt wild beasts, or go deep into the Ula Mountains to hunt magical beasts and collect magical materials.

These trades are definitely not equal. No matter how valuable they are in the human world, they cannot be sold at a high price in the orc prairie.

Many small and medium-sized tribes rarely encounter a caravan in a year and have no bargaining power at all.

If you are being exploited too much, you can find an opportunity to do some free trade. But this is also risky. Merchants who can open up trade routes are not easy to deal with.

There are also umbrellas for these guys within the Orc Empire. Compared with the restraint of the nobles in the Alpha Kingdom, the Orc Empire is more naked.

Who is protecting which caravan is open to the public. If there is a problem, they dare to come out and support it at the first time.

...

The turmoil in the Near East did not cause any waves in the international arena. The most people could say was: The Alpha Kingdom has made progress!

Now everyone's attention is focused on the Frankish Kingdom. Just five days ago, under the auspices of the Frankish Church, representatives of churches from various countries launched a crazy accusation against the Holy See.

The Dawn Church was directly charged with ten major crimes:

1. Forging oracles;

2. Impure faith;

3. Blasphemy;

4. Collusion with heretics;

5. Regicide;

6. Corruption is rampant;

7. Insatiable greed;

8. The Holy Mountain of Fornication;

9. Hereditary priesthood;

10. Persecution of the nobles.

Any one of them could bring down the Holy See, and now there were ten of them, and evidence could be found for all of them. Everyone knew that the Franks were serious this time.

As a sacred and inviolable church, it should be flawless. Everyone has very high expectations for them, and no stain is allowed.

The behavior of clergy is also under the microscope.

The matter that was originally covered up was suddenly exposed to the sun, and the impact it caused can be imagined.

However, governments of various countries were still fanning the flames from behind, spreading the evidence across the continent, and almost everyone knew about the crimes of the Vatican overnight.

The mentality of countless fanatics collapsed. It was really hard to accept that the sacred church in their minds was such a mess.

Pope Pius VII was very embarrassed. He had just threatened to excommunicate Charles III, but then the Frankish Church gave Charles III the title of saint.

This action was also recognized by representatives of churches in many countries. The reason was that Charles III exposed the dark secrets of the Vatican and laid the foundation for the purge of the Vatican.

He suddenly became the villain, and the countries that originally supported the Holy See actually played deaf and dumb, as if they were waiting to see a joke.

Everyone knew that all parties wanted to weaken the influence of the Holy See in the country. Since the Frankish Kingdom took the lead, let them do it.

What left the believers speechless the most was that even with such a big event happening, the great Lord of the Dawn did not show up.

Bringing down "divine punishment" and eradicating heresy in the Church has become a beautiful dream in the minds of countless believers.

The Vatican was also disappointed. The storm had affected their faith, and the gods had not yet come out to take sides, which made them very passive.

The gods didn't say anything, and many people thought that was their tacit agreement. Some arcanists even openly shouted: The gods are dead!

The two major camps were busy fighting among themselves, and no one paid attention to the blatant blasphemous remarks for a while, which made Hudson very troubled.

There was no way, the blasphemous remarks came from the Arcane Academy where he was the honorary principal. If he said there was no connection, no one would believe him!
Chapter 487:
Chapter 167: Bluff

At the Royal Capital Arcane Academy, a dragon roar broke through the air, and everyone knew that Dean Hudson had come to the academy in person.

There was no prior notice, so naturally there would be no welcome. The furious Hudson didn't care about any rules and went straight into the principal's office with his two bodyguards, Long Xiong.

Unfortunately, the cunning Robert had long since disappeared. After his vain attempt, Hudson went to look for trouble with other high-ranking officials in the academy.

And then nothing happened. All the big shots in the academy were nowhere to be seen, and only ordinary lecturers were left.

Knowing that these guys were deliberately avoiding him and not wanting to get angry with a small fry, Hudson headed straight for the palace with a rage in his heart.

You can hide for a while, but you can't hide forever. Hudson didn't believe that there was no shadow of the royal family in such a big news.

No matter how independent the Arcane Academy is, its students and instructors are all inextricably linked to the kingdom and cannot be free from its constraints.

In normal times, when the arcanists cause trouble, they always speak under their personal aliases. No matter how big the disturbance is, the kingdom can never find such a person!

This time it's different. I don't know what's wrong with these guys, but they actually spoke on behalf of the academy.

It's obvious that this is a scam. If the gods get angry and punish us, we'll all be doomed.

Perhaps in the eyes of the great Lord of Dawn, such a small matter is not worth lowering one's status to care about. After all, no one has the time to care about the thoughts of ants.

But the political impact caused by this is really too bad. Suppressing theocracy and opposing theocracy are two completely different concepts.

The former is nothing more than a power struggle between two groups of believers. Neither the gods nor the countless believers of the gods can tolerate this situation.

The latter stood in opposition to the majority of people. Looking at the magic circle opened at the entrance of the Arcane Academy, it was clear that the believers had come to cause trouble a lot in recent days.

"Your Majesty, I need an explanation. Why did this happen to the Arcane Academy? Where is the kingdom's control over the academy?"

Hudson's question embarrassed Caesar IV. Since the consolidation of his royal power, no one dared to question him like this.

Just as he was about to lose his temper, he swallowed the words back. It wasn't because he was afraid of Hudson, it was mainly because he was in the wrong now!

The Arcane Academy was established under the leadership of the royal family, and most of the people in power have close ties with the royal family, and some of them are even the ancestors of the royal family.

But this time, it was his ancestors, whom he had always trusted, who caused this incident. After the incident, Caesar IV was also frightened.

Fortunately, he did not hold a position in the academy, so Hudson, who was the most famous, helped to take the blame. Now the outside world is criticizing the Arcane Academy.

Even Hudson, who has always had a good reputation and is known as the "protector of the kingdom", is now being criticized by the public.

An unexpected result leads to a great harvest.

They had always wanted to suppress Hudson's reputation but never had the chance. They never expected that a series of outrageous actions by the Arcane Academy would make Hudson infamous.

Facts have proven that being a nominal principal is not easy. If something goes wrong at school, you can't escape responsibility.

"Marshal, I didn't know about this! Who knew those bastards would be so bold.

But you can rest assured that the government has issued an announcement to officially refute the rumors. I believe these rumors will soon disappear."

Caesar IV explained patiently.

It would be enough to suppress Hudson's reputation a little bit. He was not going to take the opportunity to beat him to death with a stick.

Although it is possible to take advantage of this issue and label Hudson a heretic, how can we demolish the bridge when we haven't even crossed the river yet?

The way to dispel the rumor is very simple, just deny it directly. The "death of the gods" statement was made by cultists in the name of the Arcane Academy, and has nothing to do with the Academy.

Regardless of whether the outside world believes it or not, the Alpha Kingdom officials firmly believe it. Anyone who dares to talk nonsense is the enemy of the kingdom.

Fortunately, the Holy See was too busy to come and cause trouble. Otherwise, if they took advantage of this incident to cause trouble, the Alpha Kingdom would definitely cry.

Although Hudson was the one who took the blame, he was not the only one affected. All the teachers and students in the college were labeled as "heretics".

According to the policy of punishing the entire family if one person is a "heretic", countless nobles throughout the kingdom were implicated.

If too many people are charged with the same crime, it no longer counts as a crime.

"Your Majesty, when something like this happens, it's not enough to just dispel the rumor or eliminate the impact.

At the very least, we need to find out the people involved and deal with them seriously. Otherwise, these daring guys will have no scruples and we don't know what stupid things they will do!"

Hudson said solemnly.

Some things can just be done secretly, why bother to say them out loud?

Even if you suspect that the gods are dead, you can verify it privately! If you make a mistake in your guess, at worst you will be killed and a few unlucky people will be implicated.

Once the news was made public, countless believers in the gods were pushed to the opposite side, and they were suddenly plunged into a state of confusion.

"Marshal, it's not that I don't want to deal with it, I just can't find anyone!

To be honest with you, I sent people to look for them as soon as the incident happened, but they came up empty-handed.

I just found a letter, take a look for yourself!"

As he spoke, Caesar IV handed the letter directly to Hudson.

The pranks of a group of old children confused the two most powerful people in the kingdom.

After glancing at the contents of the letter, Hudson suddenly felt embarrassed, as if it was his own fault.

It's all caused by overtime work.

The top leaders of the Arcane Academy are also the core of the Kingdom's Magician Corps. A few days ago, these people were doing hard labor in the Near East.

Encountering Hudson, the unscrupulous commander, the workload of everyone inevitably increased. With the righteous cause of fighting against the orcs, no one could refuse.

After returning to the royal capital, some people felt uncomfortable and prepared to do something.

It's a pity that these masters in cultivation are not strong in politics. I just wanted to yell and find something for Hudson to do, but I never expected that the political impact would be so great.

According to the letter, this action was carried out by a few strong and foolish men who were drunk, and the top leaders of other colleges were unaware of it.

After receiving the news, the academy's top management realized that they were in big trouble and chose to leave immediately, leaving the mess to Caesar IV.

After closing the letter, Hudson looked at his king with sympathy. As expected, everything has two sides. When enjoying the benefits of a deep foundation, one must also be prepared to clean up the mess.

Even though most of the old antiques are rational, there are inevitably a few old children. The destructive power of these violent guys is much greater than that of naughty children.

"Your Majesty, these are just excuses they made up just to shirk their responsibilities.

If it was just a few drunkards who did it, they could just hand them over. Would it be necessary for the college's top leaders to flee together?

Given their identities, even if they really did it, the kingdom can only handle it internally, and find ways to cover it up for them externally!"

Hudson's righteous criticism resonated with Caesar IV. This kind of thing really had to be covered up.

Almost all the people involved are ancestors of the kingdom's great families, and if the matter were handled impartially, many great nobles, including the royal family, would be implicated.

Not to mention that the Holy See has no time to care about it now, even if the Holy See was at its peak, the kingdom would have no choice but to grit its teeth and refuse to recognize it.

"Marshal, they are afraid of being beaten!"

The Queen's supplement directly restored the truth of the incident. It was indeed difficult for Hudson to touch these old guys, but it was not a big problem to beat them up.

It turns out that these old guys are really smart. Given Hudson's anger at the time, if he found someone, he would definitely beat him up first.

Hudson was speechless after learning the truth. After all this trouble, he was the one who took the blame and couldn't even take revenge.

Since we can't find the person involved, we can't beat up these juniors, right?

If that were to happen, the first person to be beaten would be King Caesar IV. It's exciting just to think about it, but I'd better not take action.

Only the old antiques in the royal family could do such a heretical thing as beating the king. Others should save their energy! The crime of being a traitor is also very terrible.

"Your Majesty, have someone tell them that the matter is not over yet. If they don't give me an explanation, don't let me run into them again, or they will definitely not be able to get out of bed.

Don't worry, I won't kill them. At most I'll break their legs, no one will die!"

Hudson said angrily.

The lost reputation could never be regained. No matter how the kingdom tried to cover it up, the political impact was still there.

Now we just need to find a way to stop the loss. We will try to recover as much loss as possible. Beating people is just a scare tactic.

The continent of Aslant is so big that it would be strange if Hudson could find an eighth-level strongman as long as he wanted to hide.

"Marshal, there's no need to do anything! They are all elderly people. If something unexpected happens and they can't catch their breath, it will be troublesome.

I think we should just ask them to apologize and restore your reputation!"

Caesar IV persuaded.

The kingdom is not suitable for a big mess right now. If someone dies due to the conflict and the unity of the kingdom is affected, it will be a big trouble.

In order to consider the overall situation, he even tolerated the "super high transit tax" of the northern nobles.

It's not that the lord cannot levy taxes, but under normal circumstances, no one would impose such a high tax rate!

Depending on the size of the territory and the geographical location, the transit taxes of local lords basically hovered between 1% and 15%, and 30% was a complete rip-off.

Transactions often happen without words, and Hudson immediately understood Caesar IV's hint.

The reputation cannot be restored, but there can be compensation for the benefits. I was originally worried about the distribution of benefits from the smuggling trade, but I don't need to worry about it for the time being.

At least in the next few years, these related families will not be able to make trouble on this issue. They can only blame their ancestors for causing such a big storm.

Without the participation of these people, Hudson would be able to withstand the pressure from the remaining nobles of the kingdom.

It is enough to be able to make money without doing anything for a few years. As long as the development of Xueyue Territory is completed, Hudson will not care about the subsequent profits from smuggling trade.

As a great lord, the development of the territory is the core, and money is a small matter.

"Your Majesty, you must take good care of the Arcane Academy from now on. If they continue to act like this, we will have no choice but to close them down.

Now, I think it would be better to leak the news of the loss of the Vatican's artifact to add fuel to this farce."

Hudson suggested with a half-smile.

Managing the Arcane Academy is not an easy job. Even the king doesn't have much face in front of those old immortals.

Not only does he have a powerful identity, but he is also extraordinarily strong.

The strongest people in the kingdom who are most likely to break through to the Sanctuary are all in the Arcane Academy.

A large group of strong people gathered together. Teaching students was just a side job, and more importantly, it was for the convenience of communication, in order to break through the bottleneck as soon as possible.

"Marshal, if the news about the artifact is leaked, what if the Church finds out about us..."

Caesar IV said with a little hesitation.

He had finally obtained the Vatican's inherited artifact, and he was unwilling to hand it over.

the fourth step:......

Chapter 169: Near East War Smoke

The curtain opened, and Hudson quietly returned to the Snow Moon Territory. The "loss of the inherited artifact" and the "establishment of a new church" shocked the entire continent.

The "blasphemy storm" that had been making so much noise was suppressed in an instant. Compared with the previous two major events that affected the future of the human race, the blasphemy remarks were not worth mentioning.

Similar remarks happen almost every year. The main reason why the harmless arcanists who are devoted to the study of truth become heretics is because of their bad mouths.

In fact, this is the key difference between an arcanist and a magician. They are all pursuing the truth, but the arcanists are more radical.

Not only do they dare to think, but they also dare to put it into practice. What's worse is that they often can't control their mouths.

In terms of practice, arcane and magic are very similar. At least in Hudson's opinion, these two seemingly different professions have the same core essence.

The constant supply of tap water is the reason why the arcanists have been able to survive despite the suppression of the Vatican.

In contrast, other "heretical professionals" have all declined over the years.

A big part of the reason why the Frankish Kingdom and the Alpha Kingdom supported the Arcane Academy was that these wild arcane masters were all high-ranking officials of major domestic forces.

After all, apart from occasionally talking big, arcanists spend most of their time doing research and rarely have time to do anything else.

This is unmatched by other heretic professions.

Except for a small number of heretical professions that were labeled as such by the Holy See in order to spread the faith, most of the heretical professions are true heretics.

If we want to support new forces to oppose the Vatican, we naturally have to choose those that are strong and have little social harm.

"Tom, send someone to pass the message and summon the generals at the front to come for a meeting in three days."

Hudson, who had barely even sat down in his territory, gave the order immediately.

All major forces are trying to find ways to compete for the inherited artifact, and the already tense international relations have become even worse.

If it weren't for the foreign alliance that eased the internal strife among humans to a certain extent, the Holy See would probably have already started fighting with the Frankish Kingdom by now.

What the two sides are fighting for now is no longer simple interests, but the "divine authority" that is vital to the life and death of the Holy See. The Holy See has absolutely no way out.

As the initiator, the Alpha Kingdom followed suit and pretended to be ignorant and sent out a treasure hunting team to search for the inherited artifact.

The entire human world can be summed up in one word - chaos.

Hudson of the alien alliance is not worried. If this big guy starts moving, the infighting among the human race can be paused immediately.

No matter how noisy it is, the top leaders of the major forces are not stupid. They are all big families and businesses, so they have to weigh the pros and cons.

Robert, the leader, stared at Caesar IV with a livid face. He finally broke through the bottleneck of the Holy Land and was preparing to make a big move, but he was unexpectedly declared "dead" by the kingdom.

If you're dead, you're dead. There's no need to make things complicated or try to revive you.

Everyone should change their identities and go to the academy to teach. Let the younger generation take care of the kingdom's affairs!"

After saying that, Robert turned around and left with everyone.

He originally wanted to beat Caesar IV to vent his anger, but when the time came, he suddenly realized that it was meaningless.

If you have this free time, you might as well go back to explore the true meaning of the world and pursue the path to the top.

Of course, in a sense, this also means that Caesar IV has passed everyone's test.

If the king is really incompetent, no one dares to let him go. An unrestrained prodigal son can cause terrible damage.

The Alpha Kingdom is in such a bad strategic location that it only takes one prodigal son to lose all the ancestral heritage.

After escaping a beating and watching everyone leave, Caesar IV somehow only felt a sense of loss, without any joy of a winner.

It's lonely at the top!

Being a king is destined to be lonely. Dealing with politics all day long, mixed with too many interests, emotions become redundant.

"Is this the path my father took?

Now I have also started, but I don't know how far I can go!

..."
