Although the kingdom suffered heavy losses among the middle-aged generation, the younger generation was full of talented people. There were so many talented people under him, and as long as he, the king, did not mess around, the situation would not deteriorate too much.

If Caesar hadn't died so early, we old guys wouldn't have to work so hard. Let's give up power as soon as possible to avoid mutual dislike.

If you want to care about these things, you should seize the time to comprehend them and strive to break through the holy realm as soon as possible!

Some of you don't have much time left to live. The ones in the kingdom most likely to break through to the holy realm are us old guys.

Every additional Saint Domain member will increase the kingdom's foundation.

But we can't just let those two idiots, Brian and Gallows, off like that. When they come out, I'll make sure they know what it means to be responsible for what they did wrong!"

Robert's words made everyone roll their eyes. With their strength at this level, if hard work was useful, the Holy Land would have been flooded long ago.

Morrison had the biggest reaction. "Some people" referred to him. He was the oldest among the people present.

More than a hundred people, even those who were eighth-level warriors, had reached the time to meet the Lord of Dawn.

However, given his devout faith, he most likely won't have the chance to enter the Kingdom of the Lord of Dawn.

No one would be willing to see a hundred years of hard work turned into dust. Unfortunately, human power is limited and it is impossible to have everything go as planned.

...

Looking at the Snow Moon Lake in the distance, Chief Butzweig sighed deeply. This land of the Orc Empire has now fallen into the hands of the human race.

According to the mission issued by the empire, their migration westward this time was to recover the Near East.

Without a doubt, this is a tough job. Without the full strength of the country, relying solely on the power of the Behemoths, it is simply a "good dream" to want to take the Near East from the Alpha Kingdom.

After painstaking planning, he finally got rid of his former rival and successfully took over the power of the clan. However, after taking over, he realized what a mess it was.

The Behemoth clan had indeed declined, but the clan members below still inherited the Behemoth clan's pride.

This kind of scar, which has accompanied them for the first half of their lives and is deeply rooted in their bones, cannot be changed by a few words.

So Alex is dead!

It had nothing to do with his personal ability, nor how well he did. It was only because he was unable to satisfy the illusory "dream of a strong tribe" in the minds of his tribe members that this tragic tribe leader was doomed.

It is death, the end, and also liberation!

Butzweig, who was to shoulder the heavy responsibility, knew very well that he could hardly guarantee to do better than Alex. If he failed to satisfy the dream of the tribe to become a strong one, he would most likely be the next to go.

However, Behemoths are not born in one day. The number of tribe members determines the upper limit of their strength. If they want to be strong, they must first have a sufficient number of Behemoths.

At a time like this, if you go to the battlefield to make achievements, you will feel that you are not declining fast enough.

Unfortunately, only a few people can realize this. Many Behemoths still hold on to the old idea that "Behemoth cavalry is invincible in the world" and think that they can sweep across the world as long as they start a war.

If they lose the battle, it is all because of the incompetence of the top leaders, and definitely not because the Behemoth soldiers are incapable of fighting.

"Have you located Hudson?"

Butzweig asked with concern.

While the Alpha Kingdom was busy with the internal affairs of the human race, he also wanted to do something to give his fellow tribesmen hope.

If we do not have sufficient financial resources and want to take military action, we must first understand the situation we are about to face.

The best option would naturally be to take sudden military action while Hudson is away and catch the enemy off guard.

Don't expect a glorious victory, just grab some things to appease the restless hearts of the tribesmen and fill the tribe's storehouse.

The best way to consolidate power is to lead everyone to victory. It doesn't have to be glorious, but it must be a victory without too much loss.

"Chief, the situation is not good. According to past merchants and travelers, Hudson showed up in Crescent Harbor two days ago.

The internal disputes of the human race did not seem to involve him. It was only two days since he left Xueyue Territory.

As a dragon knight, he moves very fast. He can go back and forth to the capital within a day. It would be difficult to take action when he is away!"

Clark explained with an embarrassed look on his face.

No matter how good a plan is, it must be backed up by strength. The Orc Empire has a broken heritage and is seriously lacking in top powerhouses.

The strongest members of the Behemoth tribe who had the greatest hope of breaking through to the Holy Land are now almost dead, and the personal accumulation of the new generation of strong members is not enough.

If you want to plan against Hudson, you must have the participation of several powerful Sanctuary Realm warriors to have a chance of success.

At this moment, even if all the masters of the Behemoth clan were sent out and an ambush was set up, they would not be able to stop him.

"It is indeed so! All the original plans have been cancelled. Let our people take a detour to avoid the enemy's front and just make a symbolic invasion in a remote area!

All troops are ordered not to engage in decisive battles with the enemy without authorization. In particular, if you see the dragon and bear battle flag, you must immediately move away. "

Butzweig said calmly.

If inspiring people is impossible, then we have to settle for the next best thing: making some noise and giving an explanation to the country.

As for Hudson's tough nut, whoever wants to chew it can do it by themselves. Anyway, he doesn't want to start a big fight now.
Chapter 490:
Chapter 170: Before the war breaks out, the wave of migrant workers begins

In Crescent Harbor, the military meeting had just begun when the "Near East Defense Plan" was put on the agenda.

The embarrassing thing is that the border between the Near East and the orcs is too long, and the number of garrisons is too small to take care of both.

Looking at the worried generals, Hudson said unhappily, "Why are you all so sad?

No matter how many difficulties there are, we can always find a way out. In the Near East now, except for a few areas, is there anything else that can be robbed by orcs?

Unless they dare to march alone all the way to the seven provinces of northern Xinjiang. If there really is such a stupid enemy, they are just sending us military merits!"

The train of thought opened up, and everyone suddenly understood. If comprehensive defense is not possible, then focus on defense.

The Near East is now a large construction site. Except for a few pastures and vegetable plots near Crescent Harbor, the rest of the area is undeveloped.

Orcs also have the word "human" in their name, and human nature tends to favor advantages and disadvantages. People rush to do profitable business, but no one wants to do things that will lead to death.

"Marshal, urgent military information from the front line!"

As he spoke, Tom handed the sealed letter to Hudson.

After opening it and looking at the contents, there was no reaction on his face, but Hudson's mood suddenly became bad. He had just finished analyzing the enemy, and the slap in the face came too quickly.

The Air Force detected a large group of Behemoth cavalry moving toward the northwest, obviously intending to cross their key defense area and invade from the no-man's land.

The enemy is no longer playing by logic, and it becomes an unknown whether they will make a full advance.

After all, the military is always full of unknowns and coincidences. No matter how good you are at calculating, you can't stop a few stupid generals from popping up occasionally.

They dare to take the route that others dare not take; they dare to fight the battles that others dare not fight.

The whole process can be summed up in one word - reckless.

Although most of these guys died quickly, there is always a chance that a blind cat will catch a dead mouse.

At the critical moment of breaking the deadlock, suddenly doing something illogical and random can often be the most effective way to break the deadlock.

"It looks like you'll have work to do soon, as our neighbors are beginning to make moves and appear to be planning an invasion.

They have not even gained a firm foothold yet, but they have hastily launched an invasion. It seems that the Behemoths will not have an easy time in the Orc Empire!"

Hudson sighed, pretending to be calm.

As long as you have a thick skin, nothing will be a problem. Misjudgment is inevitable.

It's all the fault of the internal strife among the Behemoths. If it weren't for the coup that led to the replacement of the Behemoth top leaders, this kind of mistake would never have happened!

This was not self-consolation, but a political necessity. As the Kingdom's God of War, Hudson's sacred aura could not be shaken, at least not before the destruction of the Orc Empire.

"Marshal, the invasion direction chosen by the enemy is currently still an uninhabited area.

Although we have planned a city fortress there, it has not yet been extended there, and there is no strategic location to defend there.

If we want to stop the Behemoth Cavalry, we can only mobilize our elite troops and fight the enemy on the prairie!"

Count Ebert suggested with a little worry.

Elite cavalry duels often mean "cruelness". It is not easy for a kingdom to train elite cavalry, and it is inevitable that people will feel pain when they are wasted on the battlefield.

After all, the current Behemoths are no longer the royal family of orcs, but just an ordinary race with strong combat power, and their value has shrunk significantly.

"Don't worry, in this undeveloped, uninhabited area, we can't stop the enemy, but it's also hard for them to gain anything.

In those places, apart from the grasslands, there were only the occasional prey on the prairie. The grasslands could not be taken away, and in the past they could only steal some prey.

It's okay to give them some fur and meat. If the enemy dares to go deeper, we can just shut the door and beat the dog!

Let's first figure out the enemy's purpose."

Hudson said calmly.

If the enemy invaded the kingdom, it would be a major accident. However, the Near East was an exception, as it was located on the front line and could not be defended at all.

From the very beginning, Hudson never thought about defense. The construction of city walls and establishment of defense lines were mainly to appease people's hearts.

The greatest significance of these city defense fortifications is to make everyone feel safe, but it does not mean that they can really defend against orc invasions.

The best defense is always offense. The orcs can attack, and the defenders can also fight back.

Instead of stopping to fight and attrition, it is better to move and fight the enemy. In a large-scale mobile decisive battle, a kingdom of a single race is definitely more efficient than a multi-race orc.

The co-governance system of the five royal families did create the glory of the Orc Empire, but it also limited their possibility of further progress.

The internal management was in chaos, and the situation of "multiple orders" did not change. In the decisive battle between the large troops, he was inherently at a disadvantage.

In fact, having problems is not a big deal. In the extraordinary world, as long as the strength is strong enough, no matter how big the flaw is, it can be made up.

If they were to encounter the Orc Empire in its heyday, they would be easily defeated by its sheer force, and no matter what tactics Hudson used, they would be meaningless.

For a moment, Hudson felt that the kingdom's Warcraft army was too small and needed to be expanded again.

It took the whole country's efforts to gather 5,000 Warcraft Knights. Such a small number is seriously inconsistent with the kingdom's international status.

Compared with the Holy See and the Frankish Kingdom, the top forces on the continent that have tens of thousands of Warcraft knights and countless backup forces, the gap is really huge.

Even the three kingdoms in the Central Continent have more Warcraft Knights than the Alpha Kingdom. Even the few declining kingdoms have as many Warcraft Knights as the Kingdom.

Of course, this is due to historical factors. It takes time to accumulate foundation. The kingdom has been fighting a life-and-death match with the Orc Empire for many years, and losses are inevitable.

The growth rate of Warcraft is too slow if it relies solely on natural reproduction. After all, the probability of catching a pair of male and female Warcraft at the same time is too low.

Maybe it's time to consider letting Maxim have another wave of passion. The strong genes of the dragon race allow them to reproduce across races, which other monsters do not have.

When ordinary low-level magical beasts are hybridized across species, there is only a very low probability of producing offspring with higher talents. The greater possibility is that a bunch of freaks that are insulated from magic will be born.

It is said that racial segregation stems from blood conflict.

When low-level magical beasts and high-level magical beasts are hybridized, the blood of the high-level magical beasts can suppress the blood of the low-level magical beasts, and blood conflicts rarely occur.

There is no doubt that except for the giant dragons in estrus whose aesthetic taste transcends race, the sexual orientation of other high-level monsters is normal.

Except for a few odd ones, most high-level monsters have racial cleanliness. If they are allowed to interbreed with low-level monsters, it will be fatal.

If you look at the composition of the magic beasts in each country, you will know that they are basically dominated by sub-dragon beasts. Even if they don't have giant dragons, they will send people to the wild to capture sub-dragon beasts.

In this regard, the great nobles of the kingdom were not idle either. However, due to various special reasons in the past few years, the investment was not that great.

...

On the prairie, a large group of Behemoth cavalry marched leisurely, without any sense of urgency of war.

"Captain, we haven't found any trace of the enemy. We have been hanging around here. I'm afraid it will be difficult to explain if we go back."

A younger Mongolian officer asked.

You have to know that they had been wandering above Xueyue Lake for three days and hadn't seen even the shadow of the enemy, but their own legion commander still asked them to search everywhere.

"Nancy, things are not as simple as you think. Everyone knows that the enemy is below Snow Moon Lake, but why did the patriarch want to attack us from above?"

Ulanqimeng said with a smile.

This good mood came from within, and anyone could see at a glance the joy that emanated from his entire body.

It was just right that they didn't encounter any enemies. The original mission was not to fight the enemy. Going deep into the Xueyue Lake area was just an action to complete the domestic mission, and it did not bring any benefit to the Beamon tribe.

If a foolish invasion really started a full-scale war, the Behemoths, with their strength severely damaged, would not be able to withstand the counterattack of the Alpha Kingdom.

Even if the Orc Empire can provide a guarantee, the Behemoths, as a race on the front line, will suffer heavy losses.

"Commander, you mean..."

Nancy stopped talking halfway through her words. Some things are better to know than to speak them out.

As the new patriarch, Butzweig has painted a big pie for them to regain their royal status, and his prestige is very high!

The Behemoth clan had an unprecedentedly unified idea. Everyone was waiting for the various clans in the country to kill each other, hoping to wait until they had killed most of them before going back to pick peaches.

Strength is indispensable to the armed seizure of power. Without Butzweig's deliberate instructions, smart people realized the importance of retaining strength.

When it comes to the future destiny of the race, even the most radical war advocates have become conservative at this moment.

"Pass the order down, send out spies a hundred miles away, and send a signal immediately if you find any trace of the enemy!"

Ulanqi said with his face covered but without changing expression.

If there is no combat mission, then just treat it as an outing. You can just write a casual battle report when you go back, no one will take it seriously at this time anyway.

It was their competitors who were making things difficult for them at home, not the other four royal families. Now the royal families were busy licking their wounds and recuperating, and had no intention of starting a war.

Forcing them to send troops to provoke a war would do no good to the four royal families.

...

"The enemy is coming!"

"The enemy is gone!"

"The enemy is coming again!"

"The enemy is leaving again!"

Looking at the intelligence gathered by the Air Force, Hudson was speechless. This was the beginning of an infinite loop - monkey walking!

The Behemoth Cavalry would come over and hang around each time, without waiting for the kingdom's army to arrive, and then slip away as quickly as possible, leaving no chance for contact at all.

This left all the officers in the command center confused and they didn't know whether they should continue to mobilize troops.

The idea of ​​"sending troops to counterattack" was dismissed by Hudson as soon as it came to mind.

It is easy to start a war, but it is difficult to deal with it afterwards. Wars are not only fought for military strength, but also for money and food.

The kingdom had just managed to catch its breath, but was dragged into war again. The small and medium-sized nobles below were driven crazy.

As far as Hudson knew, even in wealthy areas like the Southeast Province, many small nobles were in financial crisis, not to mention other areas.

It is not known whether the Orc Empire could be defeated if another national war broke out, but the foundation of the kingdom's rule would definitely be in trouble.

Especially the noble lords in the seven provinces of the northern border, all of them were miserable. I thought this was a big market, but after really getting in touch with it, Hudson found that this was a concentration camp for poor people.

The rich have their own way of living, and the poor have their own way of living.

In order to save on transit taxes, many small nobles have recently traveled long distances to Crescent Port to purchase supplies.

The cheapest grain was purchased, the most durable cloth was purchased, the cheapest coarse salt was purchased, and all meat was obtained by hunting. Even the nobles could not guarantee that they would have meat every day.

Many nobles, unable to come up with cash, used animal fur and magical materials as payment for goods.

Those who could pay in kind were considered lucky. The territory was rich in resources, and life was manageable.

The guys who were in the worst situation had now taken their subjects to the construction sites, working for Master Hudson to earn money, including the lords of the Koslo family's branches in the northern border.

The sudden explosion of the family was actually Hudson's own explosion. The family members gained a lot of benefits, but it still couldn't change the reality that the family was not rich.

It takes time to accumulate wealth. Whether it is the family or the major branches below, the financial assistance they can provide to their children is very limited.

After being ravaged by the orc army, the startup fund provided by the family was completely gone, and now they can only struggle to make ends meet.

Asking the family for help again would be like borrowing money. After all, the family business is not much and belongs to all members. It is impossible to give unlimited money to a few individuals.

Unless they have made special contributions to the family, what the family provides to their children is more of an opportunity and the necessary resources for their growth.

Once they are used up, they are gone. Whether it is bad luck or lack of ability, once the resources provided by the family are exhausted, they will leave the training list.

There is no way, because the Koslo family has nothing much but a large population.

After Hudson came to power, he conducted a census, and found that there were thousands of people in the dozens of well-developed branches.

The number of declining distant branches is even greater. After all, the number of children who fail in starting a business is far greater than the number of successful ones.

It is impossible to make a complete count of the exact number, but the number of tribesmen whose identities can be confirmed is tens of thousands.

This is only the case within China. Due to the inconvenience of communication abroad, many branches are unaware that they have prospered and very few can be contacted.

Only Hudson could do this kind of work. In the eyes of most nobles, these were meaningless things.

After thousands of years, the blood relationship has faded. Apart from the common surname, there is no connection between them.

Even some declining branches have forgotten that their ancestors were also nobles, and are now no different from commoners. The most tragic ones have even become serfs.

Bringing declining members into the clan has no real meaning other than increasing family expenses.

Aristocrats have to maintain their reputation. Since their status as members of the clan has been acknowledged, they must receive the proper aristocratic education.

As the number of clan members increases, the resources allocated to each person will naturally be less. Even if you borrow from the clan, there is a limit.

There is really no other way, bringing people to work and earn money becomes the only option.

The difference is that working for the kingdom, the compensation you can earn is too little, while working for the head of your own family, the salary will be higher.

In this regard, Hudson still has a good reputation. Not only is the salary standard higher than that of the Royal Government, but it also never delays the payment of wages, and the food supply standard is also first-class.

Of course, this high standard is only relative to serfs. To sum it up in two simple words: full!

Hudson believes that only when you are full can you have the energy to work. While ensuring that everyone is full, everyone's workload has also increased a little.

The nobles would not care about these minor changes. Now everyone is a contractor and the remuneration is calculated according to the amount of work done.

The more work their subordinates do, the higher the reward they can get. They are so happy to be able to increase the amount of work!

Work at sunrise and rest at sunset.

There is no condition to work overtime, and if there is bad weather, you have to take a break.

Perhaps it was because there was too much supply of fish and meat. After several months of hard labor, the serfs' bodies not only did not break down, but became much stronger.

As a result, working in Xueyue Territory has become a popular job for the minor nobles. No nobles without any connections can now not get in.
Chapter 491:
Chapter 171: Preparing for a Bank

The influx of a large number of foreign population not only solved the problem of expensive and scarce labor in Xueyue Port, but also promoted the economic development of Xinyue Port.

The workers who are provided with food and accommodation by Mr. Hudson do not have much purchasing power, but they bring a sense of home.

With people coming and going every day, the streets became prosperous. False prosperity is still prosperity, at least the shops in the city are much easier to rent.

Taking advantage of this opportunity, the Ministry of Commerce ended most of its loss-making businesses and only retained a few profitable industries to continue operating.

The Ministry of Commerce only provides wholesale services for bulk commodities such as grain and cloth, while the sales side that requires direct contact with customers is left to private businessmen.

With one increase and one decrease, the territory's financial data looked much better. Although the deficit was still high, the income column was increasing.

Putting down the official document in his hand, Hudson asked with concern: "How is the discussion on inviting the big chamber of commerce to move in going?"

In a closed world like the Aslant continent, economic development cannot be driven by small and medium-sized merchants alone, and large chambers of commerce with monopoly resources must also join.

As a great nobleman, Hudson could engage in many industries, but there were even more industries that he could not get involved in.

For example: tea, spices, monster meat, high-end weapons manufacturing, financial exchange, magic industry...

It is not easy to get involved in any industry where resources are monopolized by others and the technical threshold is high. Instead of blindly spending money to pay tuition, it is better to find someone to cooperate with directly.

It just so happens that Hudson has connections in this area, and most of the mainstream chambers of commerce on the mainland have dealt with him, so everyone has a basis for cooperation.

"Duke, the cooperation has been discussed almost completely, and most of the chambers of commerce are willing to establish branches in Xueyue Territory.

The only problem we encountered was financial cooperation. The Chamber of Commerce representatives were skeptical about the security of the territories of the Near Eastern nobles and worried that if they granted them loans, there would be a large amount of bad debts in the future.

Rudolph's explanation made Hudson frown.

The development of the Near East requires a huge investment of manpower, material resources and financial resources. The first two can be solved, but financial resources are the biggest headache for the small and medium-sized nobles.

If they just rely on their own efforts to slowly accumulate, I am afraid that they may not be able to develop the territory in fifty years. At this time, financial financing is very necessary.

The banking industry in the continent of Aslant is underdeveloped, and the lucrative financial loan business is handled by major chambers of commerce.

Generally speaking, noble lords are the best customers. With the income from their territories as collateral, there is basically no risk of default.

Unfortunately, these clients are basically not short of money. Even if they are short of money, they will find ways to raise money from the circle, and few will borrow money from the Chamber of Commerce.

"If we can't reach an agreement on financial cooperation, then let's put the matter aside for now. It's human nature to seek benefits and avoid harm.

The situation in the Middle East is still unclear, so it is understandable that these people are unwilling to make a big bet! "

As he spoke, Hudson sighed to himself.

Capital is still in its infancy in the continent of Aslant. Under the control of the great nobles behind the scenes, these guys hate all uncontrollable risks.

The success rate of expecting them to risk losing all their money and put out large sums of money to support the development of the Middle East is not high.

Hudson had no choice but to contact these guys. The Alpha Kingdom was too poor, not only the government, but also the nobles in the country were poor.

The war consumed too much wealth, and even the great nobles of the kingdom did not have much surplus food.

Hudson's reference model is the royal family. After acquiring a large piece of land, the usual choice is to concentrate power and carry out comprehensive development.

However, the royal family's development progress of the newly added territory was far behind Hudson's expectations.

You have to know that in order to develop new territories, Caesar IV spent most of his time touring various places, and countless royal children fought on the front line of development. You can imagine how much importance he attached to it.

With sufficient talent reserves and a kingdom in hand, they were still able to slow down the development progress. There is no better explanation than lack of financial resources.

The royal family, which has the deepest heritage, has encountered financial difficulties, so one can imagine the situation of other nobles in the kingdom.

Even if there was some savings in the past, how rich can a country that has been engaged in war for years be?

It was good enough that they could take care of their own new territory. How could they have the spare energy to take out large sums of money to lend to the small and medium-sized nobles in the Near East!

If the funding problem could be solved internally, Hudson would have proposed it to the kingdom long ago. Why would he introduce these uncontrollable large chambers of commerce?

Now that the attempt has failed, Hudson doesn't need to worry about it. The plan of using chickens and eggs has failed, and there is no hope of rapidly developing the Near East, so he can only change his strategy.

It is impossible to build a bank on one's own to solve the financial problems of the nobles in the Near East during their development.

The core problem is still - lack of money!

Hudson didn't know who to turn to in order to attract deposits. In the kingdom, the only customers who could be considered clients were some wealthy nobles and a few businessmen with considerable assets.

Serfs, ordinary civilians, artisans, and even some small merchants were not qualified to become customers.

It's not that Hudson discriminates against others because of their identity. It's just that with the current technology, the cost of playing with finance is ridiculously high.

A small magic crystal card costs dozens of gold coins. If the demand is huge, perhaps the production cost can be reduced.

In the era of pure handmade products, only magicians can make products, no matter how much they cut costs, the price cannot be low.

How many transactions are needed to earn back the investment by acquiring users at such a high cost?

If Magic Crystal Cards are not used and more primitive accounting methods are used, anti-counterfeiting will be the most difficult problem.

If we want to imitate the magic anti-counterfeiting technology used in bonds, all tellers must be replaced by magicians. How many magicians would be needed?

Even if you spend money at all costs to solve the cost problem of acquiring customers, it does not mean that customers will come to you.

No matter how good Hudson's reputation is, banks are still a new thing. Unless they offer high interest rates, it will be difficult to attract enough deposits.

In contrast, the situation with loans is exactly the opposite. A large number of nobles are waiting for money to come in, and as soon as the news is released, a large number of customers will immediately pour in, and the bank will be emptied in a few days.

"Duke, should we put the development bank project you planned on hold for now?"

Rudolph asked hesitantly.

Hudson had been preparing for this project for a long time. He had already started preparations since the fiefdom of Xueyue Territory was determined.

The training of employees started two months ago, and even the store location has been specifically planned.

"The development bank is open for business as usual, but circumstances have changed and our plans have to be adjusted.

The original plan was to cover all the nobles in the Near East and Northern Frontier, but now we are the only one investing, so the scope must be narrowed down.

In the first round of loan issuance, we only target descendants of branch families and close nobles.

The loan amount must also be limited, based on a comprehensive assessment of the value of the collateral and the security of the funds.

The higher the risk, the lower the discount on the collateral and the higher the loan interest rate.

However, considering that most of the early customers are family members, the loan interest rate is temporarily set at 15%, and will fluctuate up and down according to actual conditions.

The total amount of the first batch of loans is tentatively set at less than one million gold coins. Considering the difficulty of attracting deposits, no goal of attracting funds will be set in the short term.

In the early stage, we will open outlets in Mountain Territory, Snow Moon Territory and King's Capital. Funds deposited in any store can be withdrawn in other branches without charging management fees.

If you deposit more than 2,000 gold coins, you will be given a Magic Crystal Card. If your deposit is less than this amount, you will be responsible for the card application fee. "

Hudson said without changing his expression.

There is no way there will be any interest, and he has a conscience by not charging any management fee.

As a newly-born bank, operating costs remain high, and it is not yet time for it to attract deposits with high interest rates.

Anyway, there is no competitor, so if you need to exchange foreign exchange, the Near East Development Bank is the first choice.

Of course, the most important thing is that credibility has not been established, and the nobles of the kingdom are too poor. Even if interest is paid, they cannot attract much funds.

The real attraction of the Near East Development Bank is the ability to withdraw funds freely at various branches, which saves customers a lot of trouble.

After all, carrying a large amount of cash on the road is also a risky and arduous task. Being able to avoid the pain of transportation is something that businessmen would love to have.

It's just a trial operation now. If the results are good, Hudson doesn't mind setting up outlets in major cities across the country.

If money can be transferred across the country, the liquid funds of merchants will most likely be deposited in the accounts of the Near East Development Bank, thus starting an infinite circulation mode.

When the snowball is big enough, the idle funds on the books can be appropriately distributed in the form of loans, and wealth will naturally roll in.

As long as the credibility does not collapse and the speed of capital flow is efficient enough, it is possible to leverage tens of millions of funds with a principal of one million gold coins.

However, in order to achieve this, it is necessary to cooperate with the local tyrants and share this big cake together.

...

At the Royal Capital Arcane Academy, Hudson was staring at Robert who had just broken through to the Holy Realm.

You can hide for a while, but you can't hide forever.

The debt you owe must be repaid eventually!

Although their descendants have made concessions in the smuggling trade, it does not affect Hudson's settlement with them.

The cards of the strong men in the Holy Land are only effective in the outside world. When meeting Hudson, it doesn't matter whether Robert breaks through or not.

"Marshal Hudson, don't go too far!

Because of this incident, we are all dead, what else do you want? "

Robert said with a lack of confidence.

The "blasphemy" scandal was not caused by him, but the fact that the news spread so quickly was also related to their deliberate indulgence.

If measures are taken immediately, the impact can be suppressed.

But everyone is selfish, and the top executives of the Arcane Academy are no exception.

As the group with the greatest hope of breaking through the Holy Land, they had no idea how many eyes were watching them secretly. It was extremely difficult to break through the Holy Land while avoiding the sight of the outside world.

The emergence of the "blasphemy" incident was undoubtedly a good opportunity to divert the spies' attention. Everyone was busy passing the news back, and even their sudden disappearance had a reasonable explanation.

The birth of every powerful Saint Domain person will quickly cause a sensation on the continent, and Robert is undoubtedly an exception.

If Hudson hadn't seen it with his own eyes, he wouldn't have known he had made a breakthrough.

Maybe Caesar IV was kept in the dark, otherwise he would not have buried Robert so promptly.

After all, the greatest value of a strong man in the Holy Land is deterrence. How can he scare people if he doesn't show it?

Hiding and attacking people is indeed possible, but it is not suitable for the current Alpha Kingdom. Surrounded by alien races, the kingdom needs to be strong, strong, and strong again.

"Venerable Robert, this is an excessive statement.

As an old friend, I just came over to visit, but you make me look like I'm going to eat you.

What the hell is going on? How unlucky!

Could it be that after breaking through the Saint Realm, you changed into a new identity and you don't even recognize your old friend?"

Hudson said with a half-smile.

He came here today to cause trouble and also to find someone to do him a favor.

Although the manufacturing process of magic crystal cards has not been monopolized by anyone, those who can make them are all the top forces in the continent.

As the third ranked kingdom, the Alpha Kingdom had naturally conducted research in this area, and the technology had appeared decades ago.

Like other major powers, this technology was not promoted and was only used by several major chambers of commerce in the kingdom.

With Hudson's status and position, it is not difficult for him to obtain technology after paying a certain price.

The trouble is, he doesn't have that many workers!

The magicians in the territory already live a 996 life just making magic potions, and if the workload increases any more, something bad will happen.

Considering the demand for magic crystal cards, Hudson urgently needs a group of cheap workers.

"Hudson, stop it!

If you really want to visit a friend, you can let..."

After being tossed around like this, Robert lost his temper instantly. He originally wanted to ask the two to leave, but now he swallowed his words back.

Being approached by a sanctuary monster is much more dangerous than having a knife at your neck.

Hudson scolded in mock annoyance.

"Hudson, that's enough!

Anyway, it has already happened, and I have compensated you. I will never agree to any excessive request!"

Seeing Robert swearing directly, Hudson's anger almost dissipated.

"Robert, am I that kind of petty person?

You just need to let the instructors in the academy control the key processes, and the rest can be done by the students.

After hearing Hudson's words, Robert breathed a sigh of relief, then rolled his eyes.

It's just a batch of magic crystal cards, is it necessary to make such a big fuss?

But after seeing the list of supplies, Robert suddenly stood up from his seat, staring at Hudson with an expression as if he was looking at a fool.

"Marshal Hudson, the items on the list are enough to make 50,000 magic crystal cards.

Magic crystal cards are different from ordinary commodities, all of them are custom-made products. Once they are made, no matter whether you need so many or not, you have to consume them yourself.

"Robert, just arrange for someone to make it. Even if it fails, I won't bother you.

Don't worry, this is only 50,000 tickets. Once my business opens, I can use 500,000 tickets!"

Hudson said with a smile.

He knows the market potential of this thing better than anyone else.

Not to mention that everyone holds a card, even if every thousand people hold one magic crystal card, the kingdom can digest tens of thousands of magic crystal cards.

The actual card holding ratio will only be higher. Once the Near East Development Bank becomes popular, if you don't have a magic crystal card, you will be embarrassed to call yourself a noble.

Together with private merchants, the entire Northern Continent digested 500,000 magic crystal cards, which is not an exaggeration.

As for expanding it to the entire continent, Hudson doesn't have that big an appetite yet.

All personal connections are concentrated in the Northern Continent, and banks are places where personal connections are competed for, which means that the market is destined to be limited to the Northern Continent.

"impossible!"

"Your Excellency Marshal, there are only 800 students in the academy. Even if everyone makes magic crystal cards for you, it will take two months, which will greatly affect the teaching progress.

If you really force this arrangement, I'm afraid it will damage your reputation!"

Robert refused decisively.

Social practice classes are not practiced in this way.

If it would only take a few days, he wouldn't mind giving Hudson some face, but this would take too long.

The reasons are ready.

The reputation of aristocrats is more important than anything else, and he didn't believe that Hudson would sacrifice his reputation for an unreliable business plan.

"If the Arcane Academy doesn't have enough students, we still have the Magic Academy!

Bring the two academies together and organize a magic skills competition. I will sponsor the prizes.

There are one hundred bottles of magic potions to assist in cultivation. You can make up the rules for how to distribute them.

They are all high-end medicines with no side effects. According to the market price, they are enough to cover the labor costs of making magic crystal cards.

If anyone still scolds me, that's your problem!"

Hudson said calmly.

High-end medicines are essentially used to cheat the rich, and their main feature is that they are expensive!

Ten thousand gold coins per bottle is equivalent to a year of self-cultivation for a low-level magician, but it is useless when encountering a bottleneck.

It is also effective for high-level magicians, but the higher the level, the smaller the increase.

There is no way, the energy in the potion is constant.

The price-performance ratio is not good, but this does not affect everyone's yearning. After all, the growth of cultivation is real.

Ordinary noble children certainly cannot afford it. Even among the children of great nobles, only a very small number of direct descendants have the opportunity to use it.

For students who are in their growth stage, this will be the best opportunity for them to distance themselves from their peers.

The prize worth a million gold coins made Robert, who wanted to object, swallow his words.

There is no way, it's just too much.

If these resources were concentrated on a few people, several geniuses could be created quickly.

The road to becoming strong is always about striving to be the first at every step.

Chapter 172: Crossroads

Hudson was gone, but the Arcane Academy was in an uproar. No matter how prominent the students' backgrounds were, their first reaction to the news was - Impossible!

The Arcane Academy had many sponsors, and all the wealthy nobles in the kingdom had provided sponsorship to them, but no one was generous enough to spend millions of gold coins.

Karim urged.

The appearance of Hudson broke this record.

Anyway, everyone who bought it said it was good, and the pre-orders had accumulated to three years later, and the price on the black market had already doubled.

The sellers on the black market are all Hudson's aliases.

"What, the news is true!

Hiding one's abilities is not suitable for the Arcane Academy. From the moment you enter here, you need to show your talents.

As long as you don't have the attribute of attracting hatred, you will be safer when exposed under the noses of the big bosses.

Suppression and fear are just overthinking.

The kingdom is in need of thugs, and the more talented they are, the more popular they are. The Orc Prairie is vast, and everyone doesn't mind adding a group of new nobles to the prairie.

When the incremental growth is lost and the game of stock begins, the internal circulation begins at all costs.

In the foggy sea, a man, a bear and a dragon were looking down from the clouds. Suddenly, three auras rushed up into the sky, followed by a surge of wind and clouds.

"Maxim, stay away and don't get affected!"

Hudson ordered hurriedly.

There was a thunder disaster on the continent of Aslant. He didn't know how to complain about it. The only thing he could do was to stay away from it.

If they were accidentally affected, the thick-skinned dragons and bears might not be seriously injured, but he, the poor master, might become ashes.

After retreating twenty miles, Hudson's sense of crisis about death gradually disappeared.

The ghost ship broke through the holy land, which was beyond his cognition. He had searched through all the books of the kingdom, but could not find any relevant records.

I never expected that there is racial discrimination in the world.

Maxim and Bear Stearns broke through the sanctuary directly in their sleep, without any setbacks throughout the process.

Robert broke through the Holy Land, and although he had someone to protect him, he didn't cause any big commotion. It was just that the magic elements between heaven and earth became a little more active.

Changing to a ghost ship and delivering a thunder tribulation package directly was enough to prove how unwelcome these aliens were.

Under normal circumstances, these three ghost ships would not be able to break through, but Hudson fed them too much.

Not only did he extort money from the coastal nobles, but even the blood and energy he harvested from the battlefield became food for the ghost ship.

Under normal circumstances, even if they looted all the ships at sea, they would not be able to gather so much food.

Hudson had no idea how powerful the thunder was, and the biting cold wind had already torn apart his magic shield.

If it weren't for Bells standing in front, he might have become the first dragon rider to fall off the dragon's back and die.

Of course, the more likely possibility is that he would be torn to pieces by the wind blades, and even the step of collecting the body would be omitted.

If you can't afford to offend, you can afford to avoid it. Mr. Hudson looked down on this kind of excitement.

Deep down, Hudson was already worried about the three ghost ships below. He had managed to fatten them up with great difficulty, and if they were torn apart, it would be a huge loss.

"You two, do you know what's going on?"

After avoiding the storm, Hudson asked with concern.

"A Dragon Emperor once recorded in his Dragon Life Experience that creatures from other worlds that break through the Holy Land will encounter thunder tribulations.

It seems that the ghost ship is an alien species. I don't know exactly when it came here, but the first time it appeared in the inherited memory was more than 9,000 years ago."

Maxim's words made Hudson happy. His silly dragon actually recovered his inherited memory.

In the world of dragons, there is a saying that dragons without inherited memories are considered second-class cripples.

Although the Dragon Mother can teach inherited knowledge, the dragon race's inherited memory is so vast that it is usually only looked through when needed.

Without inherited memory and the valuable experience accumulated by our ancestors, it is almost impossible to break through to a higher level.

Maxim, who had lost his inherited memory due to his own fault, has now recovered. This is definitely a good thing.

Hudson then focused his attention on "more than nine thousand years ago". Judging from the time node, the Dragon Emperor who left the information was very likely to have experienced the last catastrophe of ten thousand years.

It is possible that the ghost ship is an alien species left over from the last catastrophe that occurred thousands of years ago.

There are more and more products proving the existence of the Ten Thousand Year Catastrophe, but the specific information has been erased, which makes Hudson feel depressed.

It is very easy for a short-lived race like the human race to tamper with history and hide some information. As long as three to five hundred years have passed, the truth can be tampered with beyond recognition.

It's different for long-lived species like dragons; even after thousands of years, the dragon in question may still be alive.

Unless the dragon is killed to silence him, or a part of their memory is forcibly erased, it is difficult to keep the secret.

Even if the gods gave orders, it was difficult to make the unruly dragons obey. In the ancient myths circulating on the continent of Aslant, there were many stories of dragons rebelling against the gods.

Seeing that the dragon clan is living a comfortable life now, we know that gods are not omnipotent. At least in this world, the ancient dragons can fight with them.

"Maxim, according to your inherited memory, is the probability of these alien species successfully surviving the tribulation high?"

Hudson couldn't help but care about these three ghost ships, which were an important part of his plan.

It takes time for a navy to grow. If you want to control sea power, you must resort to unexpected tactics.

The notorious "Three Kings of the Netherworld" are undoubtedly the best helpers. They can do all the dirty work at sea.

"have no idea!

It was just mentioned casually in the inherited memory that these things are not what we dragons care about, and no dragon would do statistics. "

Maxim said, shaking his head.

The kingdom does have some naval foundation, but due to limited financial resources, it has no ability to develop maritime power.

The nobles' private armies were also not to be relied upon. Being strong was only relative, and looking at the entire continent, it was nothing at all.

As time passed, the Poison Dragon Island revealed its true appearance again. The shrouded fog was dispersed by the storm, and the sky became exceptionally bright.

The ghosts on the ship were busy listlessly, as if they were repairing a warship.

Just by standing in the distance and taking a look, Hudson felt endless sadness, as if it was going to completely swallow up this world.

Seeing their master coming, the embarrassed ghosts hurried out to greet him. The three ghost kings in the lead were the worst off, their breaths were a little unstable.

"Did you succeed in breaking through?"

Hudson asked with concern.

If they are in bad condition, they can recover. Anyway, the kingdom has no shortage of wars, and there is plenty of blood and evil energy to serve as nourishment for their growth.

The key lies in the realm. As long as there is a breakthrough in the realm, energy replenishment can be completed quickly.

"Master, we are halfway to success. Fortunately, you prepared enough supplies for us, so we can survive the thunderstorm.

It's just that the one that just completed the promotion was the ghost ship. If the three of us want to be promoted to the sanctuary, we still need to comprehend the laws.

However, with the help of the ghost ship, our speed of understanding the laws will be much faster than that of ordinary people, so it shouldn't take much time."

The Ghost King's answer made Hudson feel relieved. As long as the ghost ship broke through, it would be enough. The ghosts on the ship were not in a hurry.

Bullying the soldiers is really the best choice. Except for the strong ones at the Saint level who can pose a threat to them, it is difficult for the navies of various countries to wipe them out.

Even if you are a bit high-profile and draw hatred, it is not a big deal. After all, ghosts can be resurrected after death. If you want to wear them out, you first need to see if you can afford it.

"In that case, you should repair the battleship first! Try to comprehend the rules as soon as possible. We will not assign you combat missions in the short term.

You are now in a weak period and must be on high alert, especially when the fog clears.

Once someone sees through our true intentions, we will be in big trouble. If we find that the situation is not good, we can retreat to the open sea first."

Human beings have very limited understanding of the ocean, and unfamiliar waters that have not been explored are often considered forbidden areas in everyone's mind.

Those who dare to explore deeply are warriors before they set out, but they will become martyrs in a short time.

Bad weather, monsters, sea creatures...these are all enemies.

If we want to go deep into the ocean, we must make further breakthroughs in shipbuilding technology and be able to withstand various tests.

Just like the extreme weather changes just now, the storm was mixed with wind blades, and ordinary ships would be torn to pieces quickly.

Only a few warships equipped with magic arrays could resist, but damage to their hulls was inevitable.

The most troublesome thing is the cost. Hundreds of magic crystals are gone when the magic circle is activated once. If you hold on for a little longer, it will cost thousands of gold coins.

It would be too expensive to use such a gold-eating beast for ocean exploration.

If an accident happens, the loss will be even greater. Unless it is true love, I will think twice before doing it.

However, the risk only belongs to ordinary humans. Creatures like ghost ships have always been a risk to others.

In the Orc Steppe, after a round of killing, the royal competition has reached a critical moment.

"You three, you can't continue like this!

However, this world is ultimately a world where the strong prey on the weak, and some races whose strength is close to that of the Eagle People no longer buy into their accounts.

If you don't obey, you will be destroyed!

In the face of racial interests, the empire must also take a detour. These powerful races that have the strength to threaten their royal status must be suppressed.

Using legion warfare to determine the affiliation of the royal family is simply forcing a group of powerful races to kill each other.

Even if they win or lose, they will inevitably suffer a great loss in strength. Even if they successfully become a royal family, it is difficult for them to have a say in the empire.

"Eagle King, the rulers of each tribe are not fools. If you do this, the backlash will be very serious.

The more we force them, the stronger their resistance will be. Maybe the various tribes will resist and refuse to participate in this..."

Before the Bear Emperor could finish his words, the Eagle Emperor interrupted him and said, "Bear Emperor, there is nothing to be afraid of!

If there are any races that do not participate, their qualifications will be disqualified and they will be targeted for suppression.

Find an opportunity to combine the strength of the four of us and destroy them in one fell swoop, just in time to make an example of them!"

Chapter 173: Strategic Extension

The benefits are attractive, and under the stimulation of generous prizes, the students started a crazy internal competition mode, and the laboratory is overcrowded every day.

In fact, it was not only the students who coveted the magic potion, but also many of the college instructors were tempted. However, this was a competition for the students, and they really couldn't bring themselves to do it.

Everyone worked enthusiastically to lay the technical foundation for the establishment of the Near East Development Bank.

The first batch of magic crystal cards arrived, and the three major outlets opened together, without flowers or applause, and opened quietly.

The performance of a bank that is so low-key is naturally not very good. The users who came to open a card in the early stage were all old friends.

It's not that Hudson doesn't know the importance of publicity, it's mainly because the bank is still groping in the dark about its business and simply doesn't have the capacity to serve more customers.

After all, the people we are dealing with now are mainly nobles, and we can't let them queue up to handle business, right?

Since we have chosen the high-end route, we must provide matching services. There are few customers in the early stage, which is a good opportunity to train the team.

The three major outlets issued a total of 136 Magic Crystal Cards. This number at the opening made Mr. Hudson very satisfied.

The number of customers was indeed small, but they were all high-quality customers. More than one hundred cardholders deposited more than 300,000 gold coins, giving him enough face.

The most important thing next is not to expand the deposit business, nor to find loan customers, but to let everyone see the benefits of banks.

Anyway, once the money is collected, it can be piled up in the warehouse. There is no need to pay interest on the funds. The biggest expense is staff salaries. Hudson is not worried about cost pressure at all.

The day of the skills competition arrived in a flash. As the event's largest sponsor and honorary principal, Hudson naturally attended the event.

The theme of the event is a skill competition, which is naturally not limited to magic crystal card making. The two colleges have also added alchemy, medicine making, divination, fighting, magic array...

As the number of projects increased, so did the number of sponsors. In addition to Hudson, the royal family, some nobles, and chambers of commerce also came to join in the fun.

The value of the prizes offered is certainly not comparable to Hudson's, but it is better in terms of variety and applicability.

As the scale of the event grew, so did the attention from the outside world. Perhaps out of boredom, many princes and ministers, including King Caesar IV, came to join in the fun.

Hudson, who was not prepared to continue to be in the limelight, declined the invitation to give a speech at the opening ceremony and chose to sit in the VIP seats with a group of dignitaries in the royal capital.

Looking at the dense crowd of people watching the show, Hudson was very suspicious that the nobles in the royal capital had all come over to join in the fun.

It would have been fine if they just watched the fun, but they actually brought their families along. The scene became lively before the game even started.

The students who were maintaining order were unable to hold on, and finally Caesar IV had to dispatch the palace guards to maintain order.

"Robert, how many tickets did you sell? Why are there so many people watching?"

Hudson asked jokingly.

Comparing the on-site flow of people and the seats prepared in advance, it can be seen that the plan is out of touch with reality, and there is a clear lack of relevant experience in hosting events.

I guess the academy's top brass didn't expect that the nobles in the royal capital would be so enthusiastic and come with their families to watch the fun.

Not only was the outside crowded, but even the VIP seats were a bit crowded. Many dignitaries brought their family tickets, so the organizers had to temporarily add chairs.

"Tickets, what tickets?

Marshal Hudson, you can't slander my innocence!"

Robert explained hastily.

I swear to God, he only invited a few sponsors to this event, and the rest of the guests were uninvited.

In order to limit the flow of people and prevent "cult members" from sneaking in and causing trouble, he ordered the college security personnel to strictly check the identities and prohibit non-nobles from entering.

Unfortunately, he still underestimated the enthusiasm of the spectators. For such a major event, everyone wanted to come and watch, and the nobles were not alone, so the number of people eventually exceeded expectations.

The chaos at the scene was embarrassing enough. It would be even more embarrassing if he was mistakenly considered as "profit-seeking".

Think about it, Robert is a powerful man in the Holy Land and the principal of the Arcane Academy. How could he bow down for a few dollars!

"There are no tickets, no wonder there are so many people. With such a large flow of people, you are not afraid of sneaking in..."

Halfway through his complaint, Hudson decisively shut up when he saw Caesar IV's face turn pale.

The previous king, Caesar III, died young due to an assassination attempt. Talking about such a sensitive topic is just trying to seduce the king.

Looking at the arrangement of seats in the VIP seats, Hudson knew that he would have to work part-time as a bodyguard today.

Deep down, he already secretly despised Robert's lack of financial acumen.

If you are smart and sell tickets at different prices according to the viewing positions, not only can you limit the flow of people, but you can also earn at least hundreds of thousands of gold coins.

If we put up some banners, get advertising sponsorship, and sell tea and snacks, the profits will be even greater.

No wonder the college is short of money. They have given up such a good monetization channel.

Anyway, the prizes are all sponsored, and if we hold such events a few times a year, we can earn millions.

As long as we can invite all the dignitaries in the royal capital, there will be no problem of no one buying tickets.

The nobles of the kingdom were poor, but that was only in terms of large expenses. They still had enough money for the ticket fee of one or two gold coins.

Although he despised it, Hudson still did not interfere. This kind of suggestion was purely a thankless task.

If word got out, the nobles who paid for the tickets would curse him to death behind his back.

While the students were competing hard, the guests in the VIP seats were already chatting with each other. Some were commenting on the competition, while others were just chatting about other things.

Apart from their own children who were paying special attention to the results of the game, the rest of the dignitaries just came to watch the fun.

This is the age of nobility!

Except for times of war, or when they need to develop new territories and are busy for a while, the nobles are idle most of the time.

With the inherent production model and productivity that has remained unchanged for thousands of years, territory governance can be directly copied according to the original experience.

The king has slightly more things to do, but it mainly depends on whether the monarch wants to pursue a career.

The salted fish monarch is no different from the noble lords. In normal times, as long as you don't look for trouble, basically nothing will happen.

A career-oriented monarch is another type of monarch. He is busy with endless official duties and countless plans to plan every day.

There is no doubt that Caesar IV is a career-oriented monarch. He inherited the wishes of the monarchs of the Alpha Kingdom and was ready to resolve the threat of the orcs during his lifetime.

Compared with previous monarchs, Caesar IV faced a much better situation. Not only did he have a good foundation left by Caesar III, but the key was that the Orc Empire had entered a period of decline.

"Marshal Hudson, I heard that the Orc Empire has started to make unusual moves again. The four royal families want to start a legion war and select a new race to fill the vacancy left by Behemoth. What do you think?"

Oruchi, who is not without political wisdom, whispered.

Chapter 176: Money Shortage

With Hudson's tacit approval, truckloads of weapons were sent to the dock and loaded onto ships for departure.

Ever since the Kingdom's Magician Corps began clearing coastal reefs, the smuggling trade has gradually transitioned to the 2.0 era, from the original land smuggling to simultaneous sea and land smuggling.

Compared with traditional land transportation, sea transportation not only has lower costs but also greatly improved safety.

It is an established rule not to attack caravans, but there are so many orc tribes, so there are always a few that don't follow the rules.

As long as it is done cleanly, the smugglers' deaths will be in vain and no one will stand up for a group of dead people.

The price to be paid is that accidents often happen along the route and no more caravans will pass by in the future, which is equivalent to a business that will wipe out the entire family.

In contrast, large tribes with stronger risk resistance consider issues more comprehensively. For the long-term development of the tribe, they usually prohibit robbing merchants.

The smart orc tribes would even take the initiative to cooperate with the caravans, open up trade on their own territory, attract nearby small tribes to come and trade, and take commissions from them.

With the rise of smuggling trade, many smugglers also spontaneously cleared coastal reefs to facilitate transportation.

As a result, the coastal areas that were originally not valued by the orcs suddenly became a battleground for all tribes.

For their own safety, many smugglers no longer lead their convoys deep inland. Instead, they choose to transport supplies to coastal areas and trade directly with local tribes.

Some cautious teams even requested to trade at sea, usually stopping their ships a few hundred meters from the coast, and then using small boats to transport supplies to land after the deal was concluded.

Especially some sensitive commodities, all of them have switched to sea routes, and the trade volume of land transportation has shrunk sharply.

The Behemoths, who bordered the Snow Moon Territory, naturally became the biggest victims. Originally, they could make a lot of money just by collecting tolls, but now they can only stare at the scattered caravans in a daze.

As good neighbors, they should have convenient trade. Even if they buy the goods themselves and resell them back, they can still make a lot of money.

Unfortunately, it is precisely because they are neighbors that the Behemoths are suffering. Smugglers have no bottom line and are only interested in profit, but they are definitely not fools.

A little inquiry revealed that Master Hudson's policy towards the orcs was to make friends with distant countries and attack nearby ones, and the Behemoths were never the ones to be supported.

What ordinary smugglers knew was even more clear to the Kingdom Intelligence Organization. As a result, all the friends who challenged the four royal families were able to buy weapons at high prices, but the Behemoths got nothing.

"What's going on? Didn't I ask you to contact the human caravan?

Could it be that Behemoth has taken advantage of this and forced those smugglers to stop doing business? "

Butzweig demanded sharply.

As smugglers, they were in a business that put their heads on the line. They didn't even want to pay taxes to Master Hudson, let alone taxes to Beamon.

High taxes and unsafe routes directly contributed to the booming maritime smuggling trade.

As a last resort, Butzweig had to clean up the internal situation and prohibit Behemoth from exploiting merchants and travelers privately.

"Chief, the situation this time is different. We have contacted the leaders of many tribe caravans, and none of them deal in weapons.

Butzweig said helplessly.

At this critical moment in the fight for the royal throne, he didn't want to provoke border conflicts and get himself into trouble.

...

Under the trend of interests, two major camps emerged in the Orc Empire. Unfortunately, these races were not good at conspiracy, and they were clashing with each other in a big way, as if they were afraid that the four royal families would not find out.

It seems that the team is expanding and the situation is very good, but unfortunately the internal conflicts within the group are also intensifying.

We stand together temporarily for common interests, and no one knows how the future will develop.

As the leader of the Near Eastern nobles, Hudson naturally could not let everyone down and also developed several ranches.

Forget about farmland for now. It is more economically valuable to develop animal husbandry in areas with vast land and sparse population.

If the situation is not right, it will be convenient for strategic transfer. Directly turning livestock into military rations will not cause much loss.

As time goes by, the once inconspicuous Middle East Development Bank has become the most eye-catching one.

It was originally agreed that the three major branches would conduct business simultaneously, but the final result was that the Xueyueling branch was "overcrowded" with a long line of customers waiting for review, while the other two major branches received a mediocre response.

Perhaps some nobles still lacked emergency funds, but most of them raised funds through their connections and overcame the difficulties.

As long as there are no major disasters such as disasters or wars, there will basically be no need for funds.

After launching its loan business for more than two months, the Wangdu branch has taken on a total of 36 orders and issued loans totaling 200,000 gold coins.

Among the thirty-three transactions, the clients were all nobles, and only three transactions were merchant loans.

It's not that all merchants in the royal capital are not short of money, but those who are short of money cannot come up with the corresponding collateral.

It is obvious that under the ancient system of rule by aristocratic lords, the industry, commerce and manufacturing industries of the continent of Aslant developed very slowly.

In addition, banks are new things, and human nature is to reject unfamiliar things. Even if you are short of money, you may not dare to apply for a loan.

The situation at the Mountain Territory branch was better, with a total of 147 loans issued for a total amount of 860,000 gold coins, and the clients were all noble lords.

If we don't consider the personal connections, this performance is already very impressive. Unfortunately, the business of the Shandiling branch is all for the Hudson name.

After dealing with each other before, everyone had enough understanding of the Koslow family and believed that Hudson would not cheat them for tens of thousands of gold coins.

Even if the bank is dishonest, everyone is related to each other, so if there are problems later, you can still find a middleman to mediate.

"The business of Wangdu Branch and Shandiling Branch needs to be further explored and expanded, which will be an important foundation for the bank to fight risks.

Even if he took out an amount of 10 million gold coins, it would be immediately swept away by the nobles outside.

We must add more ancillary businesses to reduce the withdrawal ratio, preferably to within 30%.

As long as the gold coins are piled up in the warehouse, we will not be afraid of the risk of bank runs and our business can continue to expand.

The Ministry of Government Affairs can cooperate and, when necessary, introduce implicit favorable policies to guide smugglers to deposit their money in banks.

From now on, the territory's taxes, budget revenues and expenditures will also be transferred directly from the bank.

Including payments for government project funds, you can also choose to transfer money, or settle with gold bills and let them withdraw money from the bank themselves.

For a single account, the daily withdrawal limit is 5,000 gold coins; for large withdrawals of more than 50,000 gold coins, reservations must be made five days in advance; for large withdrawals of more than 200,000 gold coins, notice must be given one month in advance; for withdrawals of more than 1,000,000 gold coins, notice must be given three months in advance.

After all, lending a loan does not generate profit, but collecting it back is.

With this long cycle and the high-risk business model of the Near East, it is impossible for outsiders to understand whether it can make money.

"Duke, it is easy to increase the bank's book profit. All you need to do is increase the amount of loans issued.

The output of the mines alone is not enough to fill this hole. The current Orc Empire has returned to the traditional era of barter.

The smugglers always returned with a full load, but what they got was real goods that needed to be transported back to the kingdom for sale.

According to our observations, in recent times, the prices of many commodities in the kingdom have declined to varying degrees, especially the specialty products of the Orc Empire, which have fallen most sharply.

Especially in the past two months, many smuggling caravans have returned with cattle, sheep and horses. In the past, they would not bother to sell low-profit goods. "

Based on the data collected, the Ministry of Government believes that the Kingdom's economy has also had problems. The Kingdom is also at a disadvantage in trade with the southern countries.

In addition to the aftermath of the war, in order to repay international debts, the kingdom paid large amounts of gold and silver to various countries.

The rapid fall in prices after the war may not only be due to changes in supply and demand, but also because there was not enough gold and silver circulating in the market.

This is reflected in all places, and as a new development zone, Xueyueling is more obvious.

The crisis did not break out, in large part due to the emergence of the Near East Development Bank. Whether it is transfer transactions or the gold notes we issued, they have played the role of currency to a certain extent.

However, this was limited to Crescent Harbor. In some remote noble territories in the kingdom, the ancient practice of barter also appeared.

When Hudson heard the word "money shortage", his brows furrowed instantly. He had already been aware of this problem since the last orc invasion.

However, the situation at that time was not as serious as it is now. Even if the kingdom had to repay a huge foreign debt, it would not be paid out all at once.

The era when the kingdom should have been recovering was hit by a continental war. The high prices of strategic materials once again led to a large outflow of the kingdom's wealth.

After the war, the crisis began to brew. The smuggling trade with the Orc Empire alleviated the kingdom's money shortage to a certain extent.

With the launch of the Near East development strategy, a large amount of funds was swallowed up by the Near East, and the "money shortage" crisis once again hit the kingdom.

Chapter 177: Unexpected Opportunity

The Government Department is particularly sensitive to the "money shortage". In addition to the fact that the Near East requires a large amount of funds to promote development, the main reason is that the southeastern province is the hardest hit area in the kingdom's previous money shortages.

Economic prosperity often means a large demand for currency. Unfortunately, the kingdom does not have the ability to send enough currency to the southeast region, and does not even have the idea to do so.

As for the rest, let time heal the wounds naturally. Anyway, as long as the war is over, the kingdom's dependence on the outside world will decrease.

With the sharp decline in import trade volume, the situation of continuous outflow of gold and silver will gradually change.

Through mining and trade with the Orc Empire, the amount of currency circulating in the market will gradually increase until the "money shortage" crisis is overcome.

As for the economic pain experienced during this process, no one has a good way to solve it and can only endure it.

Rubbing his forehead, Hudson also looked embarrassed. Theoretically, if there is a "money shortage", all you need to do is increase the money supply.

"Paper money", just think about it.

Under the existing basic conditions, if the Alpha Kingdom dares to be the first in the world to issue paper money, it will immediately be taught a lesson by the market.

Changing the monetary system, unlike the gold notes previously issued by the Near East Development Bank, requires very strong credibility.

The value of paper money will not be recognized internationally, and the nobles within the kingdom will most likely not accept "paper money" replacing gold and silver.

If you really have no money, using rusty iron coins to make up the difference is more acceptable to people than using paper money.
