In the eyes of outsiders, this thing is just an anonymous deposit certificate and cannot be considered as currency at all.

The top chambers of commerce all have their own commercial bills, but they are called differently. The ones linked to gold coins are called gold bills, and the ones linked to silver coins are called silver bills.

Without exception, these bills have a very small circulation range. They can only be used in certain areas and have great limitations.

If the gold notes issued by Hudson were not linked to the territory's commodity trading, even dogs would probably despise them.

In the eyes of the outside world, this thing was made by Hudson to facilitate transactions. It can be used within the fiefdom of Master Hudson, but it is just waste paper outside of here.

In order for this thing to replace gold coins and become the mainstream currency on the market, Hudson would probably have to destroy the Orc Empire and establish a human empire of his own.

"The shortage of money has become inevitable. And this situation will continue for many years. How is the Ministry of Government Affairs going to deal with it?"

Hudson asked with concern.

The monetary system was too advanced to change, so the only solution was to adopt primitive methods. In this regard, Hudson might not be as good as the native territorial officials.

"Your Excellency the Duke, the money shortage is at the kingdom level, and you personally are not short of money.

Including the income from magic potions, our currency actually has a net inflow. It's just that the stall is too big, and there is a shortage of currency in the short term.

There are two most suitable solutions at present:

1. Reduce external purchases and practice bartering internally, supplemented by gold notes as a means of payment;

2. Introduce funds from outside.

The first option is the most common measure.

As early as half a year ago, many places in the southeastern province had begun bartering.

At that time, the Snow Moon Territory was just starting out, and the Mountain Territory had basically achieved self-sufficiency. The daily trade volume was not large, and we were not affected by the money shortage.

It was not until recently, when the smuggling trade flourished and the trade volume of Crescent Port increased dramatically, that signs of a money shortage appeared.

As long as we buy fewer slaves and promote the gold note settlement system, the money shortage crisis can be curbed.

However, the aftereffects are also serious. Slaves are an important supplement to the territory's labor force. If they are suddenly stopped, it will slow down the development of the territory.

The second option seems simple, but it is actually very difficult to implement.

It is easy for funds to flow out, but no one has experience in how to bring money in.

The Ministry of Government Affairs has only one reference measure: you can sell your future magic potion quota in advance and get some cash back.

However, this cash can only solve the immediate problem. The cash shortage is a crisis for the entire kingdom, and we cannot be immune to it.

If you want to quell this crisis, you may have to invest tens of millions of gold coins in the market to solve the problem.

Such a huge funding gap is beyond the ability of our family to raise."

After listening to Jacob's explanation, Hudson nodded slightly. Both methods can solve the problem, but neither is what he wants.

If there were no threat from orcs, Hudson would definitely choose the first method. Stability is the most important thing, and the slower the development, the better.

"It's not realistic to sell magic potions in advance, and the pre-orders are scheduled for several years later.

There are a lot of magic potion masters out there studying it, and no one can tell how long the monopoly can be maintained.

Once substitutes appear, prices are bound to plummet.

It is difficult to sell uncertain things at a good price, and people may also think that I have no money.

The Middle East Development Bank has just gotten on the right track and such news must not be leaked.

Invite all the major chambers of commerce for me and tell them that I have a big deal to discuss with them!"

Hudson said without changing his expression.

...

Emerald Palace. Caesar IV had the same troubles, but felt them even more deeply.

The "money shortage" crisis further spread, not only affecting the kingdom's fiscal revenue, but also affecting the development progress of the royal territory.

The stalls have been set up and there is absolutely no reason to temporarily close them down.

The internal conflicts in the Alpha Kingdom were easing, but that didn't mean they were gone. The disputes between the royal family and the nobles had never ceased.

Either the east wind prevails over the west wind, or the west wind prevails over the east wind.

The political struggle for power has never stopped.

No matter which side it is, as long as they show signs of decadence, it will trigger a new round of political struggle.

Especially in the previous actions, Caesar IV's behavior of eating alone offended all the great nobles of the kingdom.

As a result, even the actions against the five great nobles in the North ended in failure.

No matter how conclusive the evidence is, it is useless. Politics is never about looking at evidence alone.

The five major families in the north do indeed attract hatred, but everyone is more worried about the twelve provinces of the royal family becoming one.

In order to limit the royal power, everyone tacitly chose to turn a deaf ear and turn a blind eye to the serious crimes previously committed by the northern nobles.

Even when it was brought up in court, it was still rejected. The reason was very simple: the previous five dukes committed suicide out of fear of punishment, and the kingdom had already dealt with it.

These are all facts. The dirty laundry on the Northern nobles in the hands of the royal family is basically the fault of the previous, the previous, and the five great dukes.

The five great dukes of the North now have attracted a lot of hatred, but they have never committed any serious crime that would irritate God and man.

It's useless to catch them. Some minor charges are just a tickle to the great nobles.

The final result was a fine imposed on the northern nobles.

Of course, as the price of escaping punishment, the five major families also paid a lot in private.

The progress of the royal territory development was affected, it was just a matter of time. Caesar IV was still young and had plenty of time to spend on it.

However, the sharp decline in fiscal revenue is an urgent problem that needs to be solved.

...

"asshole!

What do these nobles do for a living?

When they were covering the tax, they made a good promise, but now they are suddenly playing this trick on me, what do they want to do?"

Caesar IV's questioning made the ministers very embarrassed.

The biggest feature of the tax farming system is stability. No matter how the tax is collected or what the profit or loss is, the share paid to the kingdom must not be reduced.

Now everyone is crying out for tax cuts, and in the eyes of Caesar IV, this is a provocation to the royal government.

After all, when they were making money, these people never paid a penny more.

Since it is a business, you have to bear your own profits and losses. You can't make money for yourself and let the kingdom pay for the losses.

If this precedent is set, the kingdom will have no future.

"Your Majesty, those who are now requesting the deferral or reduction of taxes are all small and medium-sized nobles.

The kingdom has been at war for many years and is now facing a cash shortage. A large number of goods cannot be sold and their finances are indeed in trouble.

Affected by the money shortage, prices across the kingdom generally fell. Even if the kingdom accepted in-kind compensation, they needed to pay more than before.

Taking into account the losses during transportation, the burden is indeed heavy. If they are forcibly collected, it is likely to cause them to go bankrupt. "

The Prime Minister, the Grand Duke of Newfoundland, said objectively.

Small and medium nobles are an important part of the royal family's checks and balances on the great nobles. Although with the advent of the era of great mergers, their effectiveness has become increasingly smaller, it is still better than having nothing.

Without these people, the control of the nobles over the local areas would definitely be further enhanced. By then, it would truly become a country within a country, and it would become extremely difficult for the kingdom to interfere in local affairs.

As history has shown, several empire collapses in history all began with the rise of local nobles.

In order to suppress the great nobles, the royal family also worked hard.

You have to both value them and be on guard against them, but this is a very demanding task that requires both political cunning and political tactics.

"Prime Minister, you have been deceived by your subordinates. We are indeed in trouble, but we are not bankrupt.

In order to ensure the smooth collection of autumn taxes, our Ministry of Finance has specially sent people to conduct in-depth investigations in various places.

This year the weather has been good and the kingdom has had a bumper harvest, and the autumn grain will soon be stored in the warehouse.

The taxes collected by the kingdom were at most one-tenth of the output. The only things that were really affected were the commercial taxes in various places, but they could also collect taxes in kind, so they were not going to go bankrupt.

Most likely it's the local nobles who are becoming restless again and are deliberately doing this to test us.

Since everyone is short of money, let them choose how to pay their taxes. Whether they use autumn grain, cloth and other materials to offset the taxes, or directly send gold coins, our Ministry of Finance will accept it.

These materials don't need to be transported to the capital, they can be sent directly to the front line in the Near East. They can be used to repair the defense line, saving the kingdom from having to spend money on purchasing them!"

Marquis Delgado hastily retorted.

As a hard-working finance minister, being thrifty is an essential skill.

Given the kingdom's present financial situation, the precedent of reducing taxes because of a "cash shortage" must not be set.

Otherwise, the "money shortage" crisis in various places will be immediately magnified tenfold. In the face of interests, it is difficult for people to remain rational.

Under normal circumstances, the "money shortage" crisis can be slowly repaired through market self-regulation.

If a man-made disaster were added to the mix, everything would be different. No one knew what the nobles could do when they were stupid.

"The issue of autumn taxes must not be neglected. However, it is time to solve the problem of money shortage.

If all the great nobles in the kingdom work together to release a batch of currency into the market, is it possible to quell this crisis?"

Caesar IV asked with concern.

Fortunately, the Alpha Kingdom is a traditional agricultural country and its industry and commerce are not very developed, otherwise the destructive power of the "money shortage" would be even greater.

In this regard, Caesar IV was very pragmatic. Once a problem was discovered, it had to be solved.

"Your Majesty, there is no precedent for success. Theoretically, as long as enough currency is released, the crisis can be overcome.

But the problem is that no one knows how big the currency gap is.

Among the great nobles of the kingdom, except for a few who have invested heavily in the development of the Northern Frontier and the Near East and have the need to purchase supplies, the others do not know what to buy even if they are willing to invest money.

If there is enough money in the treasury, the government can release money into the market by purchasing and storing strategic materials.

Unfortunately, the kingdom's financial resources are limited and it is unable to purchase supplies on a large scale. Now it can only wait for the money shortage crisis to further expand and lower the prices of goods in the kingdom.

When prices drop to a certain level, those big chambers of commerce will take action and buy up stocks in the market.

During this process, incremental money flowed into the market, and the money shortage crisis was gradually overcome."

The Prime Minister, the Grand Duke of Newfoundland, replied helplessly.

No matter which world it is, a crisis is the beginning of a new round of harvest. It seems to be an economic law, but in fact it is more of a man-made disaster.

International capital is sharpening its knives, and the domestic nobles are also ready to make a move. Each of them wants to make a fortune in the "money shortage" crisis.

If the Royal Government takes strong measures to intervene, it will cut off the financial resources of these people, and also cut off their own financial resources. In essence, everyone present is also a member of the vested interest group.

After getting the exact answer, Caesar IV sighed. It was obvious that it was impossible to expect the great nobles to work together to quell the money shortage crisis.

No matter how many measures are introduced, it is useless. After all, government orders need people to execute them. If the government orders touch the interests of interest groups, they will not leave the Jade Palace.

Caesar IV could not find any collaborators on this issue. Even within the royal family, many people were eager to participate in this feast.

In the short term, the shortage of money affected the development of the royal territory. However, when deflation occurred and prices dropped, the cost of developing the territory would also decrease.

What does the shrinking market and depressed business have to do with them?

The real victims were nothing more than the exploited small and medium nobles, the nascent industrial and commercial manufacturing industries, and handicraftsmen.

...

As time goes by and the autumn harvest begins, the money shortage crisis in the market becomes more and more serious.

Southeastern Province.

With the blessing of the Lord of the Dawn, we have had more than a dozen sunny days in a row and the autumn harvest has been successfully completed.

Looking at the grain drying yard full of grain, Baron Ezekiel, the owner of the grain, could not feel happy at all.

The grain harvest was good, but the grain was unsalable. In previous years, grain merchants would have rushed in to buy the grain at this time of year.

Unfortunately, the situation is different this year. Baron Ezekiel contacted several familiar grain merchants, but none of them were willing to purchase.

It's not that no one wants the food, but that those who want it don't have enough cash in their pockets.

You can sell food if you want, but you must accept barter.

This is a tough situation for Baron Ezekiel, as his territory is basically self-sufficient. If so much food has to be bartered, what can he get in return?

Moreover, even if there is something you want to exchange, the other party must be in need of food. The biggest drawback of bartering is that the needs of both parties must be complementary in order for the deal to be concluded.

"Tell the steward to build five more large granaries. If no one comes to buy them, just store them for me!"

Baron Ezekiel said with a cruel heart.

"Master, it's easy to build a granary. But if all this grain is stored, I'm afraid it will lose a lot of value later."

The old butler reminded.

Although both are grain, old grain is not as valuable as new grain. Even if it is only stored in the warehouse for a few months, when it is sold to grain merchants, it will be discounted by 10% or 20%.

Even if the grain is sold later, the territory's income this year will be greatly reduced. Some unnecessary expenses will have to be cut down in the future.

After gritting his teeth and stamping his feet, Baron Ezekiel added: "You guys should prepare like this first!

I will go to some nearby cities to see if I can find new buyers. I will sell it even if the price is lower.

According to the current market situation, food prices will continue to fall in the future!"

...

Similar scenes were constantly played out in different regions of the Alpha Kingdom. Countless noble lords suffered from "depression" during this harvest season.

Emotional transmission usually expands. Affected by the "money shortage" crisis, many people who hold cash have become more cautious at this moment.

Especially the merchants who are keen on the market reacted most strongly. They all tacitly chose to hold their money and wait and see. Even though the prices of many commodities have begun to fall, everyone remained unmoved.

The Shandiling branch suddenly became busy. The market lacked cash flow, and the bank's loan business suddenly improved.

Faced with the surge in business volume, Rudolph rushed back directly from Xueyue Territory and took personal charge of the overall situation.
Chapter 498:
Chapter 178: First Financing Meeting

"Da da da......"

The carriage moved forward slowly with the sound of turning gears.

"Becca, speed up, we must reach the mountain territory today!"

The old man's words made the coachman stunned for a moment, and the whip in his hand stopped in the air.

"Master, please rest assured! If the road ahead is this easy to walk on, we will be able to reach the mountain territory this afternoon."

After realizing what was happening, Becca quickly replied.

"Um!"

After getting the exact answer, the old man looked much better. As a sharp-eyed businessman, he could see things much further than ordinary people.

He noticed the Near East Development Bank as soon as it opened. With Hudson's reputation and an uncertain future, he boldly opened an account and deposited 2,000 gold coins.

Originally, he wanted to sell himself to Hudson and make him a familiar face. Unfortunately, the gap in status between the two parties was too big, and a small customer worth only 2,000 gold coins was not worth the attention of Master Hudson.

The world is so realistic, and Tamer can't do anything about it. He wants to get in touch with Hudson because he is forced by the environment.

As his business continued to grow and expand, the original boss behind the scenes could no longer provide support and he urgently needed to find a new backer.

It was not easy to take this step. There were many merchants who wanted to join the nobles. Without some special qualities, they could not even get in.

"Father, why are you in such a hurry? Even if it's just one or two days at night, it won't affect anything!"

The young man next to him asked doubtfully.

It is true that doing business requires efficiency, but the current situation is different. Under the crisis of "money shortage", there is no business to do.

Prices continue to fall, so buying now is a good deal. Almost all merchants in the kingdom are deliberately reducing their inventory.

Under the influence of panic, no one knows where the bottom is. All we can do is to wait and see the situation and look for opportunities.

"No, Jack.

What we have to fight for are these few days!

The funds of the Near East Development Bank are not unlimited. Against the backdrop of the "money shortage" crisis, it will become more difficult to get loans as time goes by.

Under the same conditions, we cannot compete with the nobles when applying for commercial loans.

The decline in prices has begun to accelerate, and the current situation is that whoever has cash in hand will be able to make a fortune in the upcoming changes.

Once everyone realizes this, there will be nothing left for us to do!"

Tamer said with a serious look.

This is a big gamble. If you make a wrong judgment and place the wrong bet, you may not even be able to earn back the interest on the loan.

There is nothing wrong with buying high and selling low, the key is the speed of collecting the payment. For ordinary merchants, a large amount of money accumulated for a long time can be very fatal.

This means that the time to exit the market must be chosen correctly. If you exit the market too early or too late, you may suffer heavy losses.

"Father, I remember you said: only do business within your ability.

We are not aristocrats and cannot get the most favorable interest rates. Even if we are able to borrow money, the cost of funds we need to pay will not be low.

Even if we can make a lot of money, with our connections, it would be difficult to snatch food from the tiger's mouth..."

Before Jack could finish, Tamer interrupted and said, "My child, you have indeed grown up and are not blinded by the immediate interests.

You are right, some money cannot be earned. Many times, money is the original sin.

In recent years, we have performed too well and have been targeted by others. If we don't want to be devoured, we must find a way to save ourselves.

I am going to mortgage all of my coveted businesses to the Near East Development Bank!

Including subsequent business, we will also use the loan to do it. Even if we are not short of money, the loan will not stop. "

Jack was stunned when he heard the answer. He never expected that his father would use such a roundabout way to deceive others.

Once the industry is mortgaged to the Near East Development Bank, it will be difficult for the outside world to spy on it. There are few people in the entire kingdom who dare to snatch food from the hands of Master Hudson.

The interest cost paid for this is equivalent to paying protection fees.

With the banks as cover, no one can figure out how much money they actually make.

Even if someone peeked, it was useless because the money was all in the Near East Development Bank. In addition to daily operating funds, most of the wealth was in the numbers on the magic crystal card.

Magic Crystal Cards are all real-name cards, so even if you rob them you can't withdraw money. You can't force them to go to the bank to withdraw money!

Forcing customers to withdraw money is no different from robbing a bank. No one with a normal mind would dare to do such a thing.

The biggest problem with this operation is that one has to gamble on the credibility of the Near East Development Bank, or in other words, on the moral integrity of Mr. Hudson.

Thanks to the good reputation built up over the years, Hudson's name was still very useful in the southeastern provinces. How could an aristocratic model who didn't even engage in land annexation possibly plot against their little industry?

At least in the past few years, no one has heard of any stories about the Koslo family's plundering.

Even if they wanted to rob, they were robbing the orcs. The new nobles of the Koslo family were either opening up wasteland in the Near East or taking root in the northern border.

Apart from the legal inheritance of territory, there has been no deliberate expansion of fiefdoms in the province. Word of mouth and credibility are both excellent in the circle.

The next morning, Tamer and his team went straight to the branch of the Near East Development Bank. When they arrived at the scene and saw the queue of people, he fell silent.

As a bank that only serves high-end customers and only has a few scattered customers every day, when has such a scene ever occurred?

There is no way, there are too many smart people. After realizing the spread of the "money shortage" crisis, everyone's first reaction is to raise cash.

Judging from the annual interest rate, the interest rate of the Near East Development Bank is indeed not low, but when broken down into months, it is really not high.

Not everyone is like Tamer, who needs to use someone else's money to protect himself from disaster. Most people just need to borrow money for a short period of time.

The monthly interest rate is less than two percentage points, and there is no loan lower than this in the entire Aslant continent.

If the Near East Development Bank did not require collateral for lending and had a strict review process, it would probably have run out of money to lend.

On the third floor, Rudolph's forehead began to sweat as he looked at the people queuing below. Only then did he realize that having too much business was not a good thing.

Banks can use the review as an excuse to delay loan issuance, but they cannot delay lending for a long time.

Lending money is very simple, but the prerequisite is that there is money in the vault. Due to lack of experience, the bank has already lent a large amount of money a few days ago.

The customers who came now were all ordinary businessmen who were not well-informed. The well-informed ones started to reserve cash flow long before the autumn harvest.

Those who came before were all high-quality customers who had sufficient collateral and met the bank's lending standards. The staff directly released the loans after review.

The business volume has increased, but the aftermath is that the bank's cash reserves continue to decline. Even if some customers leave their money in the bank, some choose to withdraw cash.

In order to reduce cash loss, the staff worked hard to sell gold notes to customers. Merchants who were more receptive to new things were fine, most of them could accept the gold notes of the Near East Development Bank, but the conservative nobles were different, they only accepted cash.

Seeing that the capital adequacy ratio limit stipulated by Hudson was approaching, Rudolph, as the person in charge, was also having a headache.

"President, Baron Ezekiel is here to visit us. We were going to send him away, but he claimed to be an old friend of yours."

Rudolf's scalp tingled when he heard the word "old friend". It used to be that the more friends you have, the easier it is to travel, but now he is most afraid of running into friends.

No matter how good his connections are, he is still working for Master Hudson. He has worked hard to get to his current position, and he doesn't want to sacrifice himself just to do favors.

"Please come in!"

No matter what, since they are here, we must meet them.

Similar scenes have been encountered every day since returning to the mountain territory.

Everyone knew he was back, and even if he tried to make excuses saying he was not here, they would still be willing to wait even if he used the excuse that he was busy with work.

It's inevitable, so just receive it.

The reason why he has so many friends is mainly due to the nature of his work. Rudolph originally helped Hudson sell arms, which was a business involving dealing with people.

Then he was transferred to the position of Minister of Commerce, which is also a position with extensive connections. With the platform provided by Hudson, it is difficult to have few friends.

The first contact with Baron Ezekiel was the sale of weapons.

In the past, Baron Ezekiel was also very powerful. He once organized local nobles to fight against the northern nobles who came south, and even gained a considerable advantage.

Unfortunately, this good time didn't last for a few days before he was defeated. If it weren't for the noble protection mechanism on the Aslant Continent, he would have been dead.

Such was the fate of the petty nobles. After one failure, Baron Ezekiel never got up from the quagmire.

Including the once glorious northern nobles, who have now become ordinary people!

It's not that they are not capable, but that the opportunity of the times has passed. No matter how strong an individual's ability is, he cannot fight against the general trend.

He was not welcomed by the royal government and was hostile to the nobles of the southeastern provinces. In order to protect his foundation, he could only quietly join Hudson's army.

Including several people who had made military achievements, they were eventually exposed and accused of having secret dealings with orcs. It was only after Hudson stepped in that they were able to "redeem themselves".

Baron Ezekiel was better off, without so many dark histories and without attracting much hatred. After the military strength of the territory was annihilated, life became a little more difficult.

One step slow, every step slow.

Without sufficient strength, he would naturally not be able to take part in the subsequent military exploits. At most, he would take on some minor achievements after the victory of the army, in exchange for some verbal praise from the kingdom.

When they met again, their identities and positions had been reversed. The salesman who used to sell door-to-door had now become a baron.

Although the title was conferred by Hudson and its value is lower, he still holds an important position under Master Hudson.

Whether in terms of social status or actual power, Baron Ezekiel cannot compare to it now.

After a few brief greetings, we got straight to the point.

"Mr. President, the Near East is undergoing a major development, so they should need a lot of food right now, right?"

Baron Ezekiel asked slightly nervously.

He had been rejected many times in recent days. No matter grain merchants or nobles who went to the Near East to open up wasteland, they were not willing to buy grain.

"There is indeed a food shortage in the Near East, but the need may not be as great as you think.

The kingdom has agreed to collect taxes in kind, so the food needed by the troops stationed in the Near East and the construction workers on the front line does not need to be purchased from outside.

If the cash crisis continues, everyone will use goods to pay taxes, and the royal government will even have surplus food to sell.

Your Excellency Baron, the current grain market is not very good. It is difficult to get a good price for the grain we have at this time.

It is better to store the food first and wait and see the market situation. The money shortage crisis will eventually pass. "

Rudolph spoke to comfort her.

It was all true. Xueyue Territory did purchase grain, but that was after the grain price fell sharply.

Now the noble lords are still holding on, and the price of grain in the market has not fallen by less than ten points, unlike other commodities, many of which have been discounted by 70% to 80%.

In this context, selling grain will definitely result in a bargain price.

"Mr. President, if there is a choice, why should I be so anxious?

I don't know why, but food prices have been bad since the end of the war.

I thought the same thing before, as long as I could survive the cash crunch, I would be fine. Last year, I only sold a small amount of my grain, and the rest was piled up in the warehouse.

I never expected that the situation this year would be even more severe. It's as if the food consumption market has shrunk all of a sudden!"

After listening to Baron Ezekiel, Rudolf shook his head secretly.

The decline in the kingdom's food consumption was not due to population decline, but mainly to the rapid development of the fishery industry.

Fish is also meat. As long as the price is cheap enough, it will inevitably have an impact on the grain market.

What's worse is that even if the price of fish has been reduced, the profit from fishing is still considerable. The nobles in coastal areas are basically vigorously developing the fishery.

When the fish and meat entered the market, the free people were so excited that they could finally see meat. As a result, the food consumption in most cities in the kingdom showed a downward trend.

Slight changes may not impact the market, but when the money shortage crisis is added and the contradictions are artificially magnified, the situation will be different.

Now the only hope for the agricultural nobles is the Near East, a major consumer of grain. Otherwise, the grain will just pile up in the warehouse.

It was not a life-and-death crisis, and no noble had ever gone bankrupt because of a good harvest.

However, it is difficult to cash out in the short term, and those nobles who rely on the income from growing crops to do other things are doomed to failure.

"If Your Excellency the Baron really wants to sell grain, I can help you make some connections, but you'll need to negotiate the specific price yourself.

Generally speaking, the transaction of territories will follow the market trend. The final price given will most likely not satisfy you!

If you can accept the deferred gold ticket, then the price can be slightly negotiated.

You can rest assured that the gold notes are safe. The deferred gold notes issued by the Near East Development Bank can be used to purchase any goods in the mountainous territory. The face value and gold coins are locked, so there is no risk of depreciation.

If you don't use it, you can take it to our bank to exchange it for cash after it expires."

Rudolph said slowly.

Since the early days of his business, Hudson has had the habit of stockpiling food, and he still does so today.

But today is different from the past. The mountainous territories, where large tracts of farmland have been developed, have long achieved food self-sufficiency.

One of the important factors for the sluggish sales of grain in the southeastern provinces is that the largest buyer in the grain market has reduced its grain purchases since last year.

Even if they were to purchase grain now, it would be strategic stockpiles. Such purchases that were not urgently needed would usually be made when grain prices were at their lowest.

However, in order to promote the Golden Ticket, some concessions are acceptable. A short-term extension of the Golden Ticket will not bring a lot of benefits, but it can help the Golden Ticket establish its credibility.

Changing people's habits is not something that can be done overnight. Now we just let them try it out, and after they have the experience of using the gold ticket for the first time, they will be reluctant to use it again.

It is unrealistic to shake the gold and silver standard, but it is still possible to join this system.

...

On the Xueyue Lake, Hudson was boating on the lake with a group of chamber of commerce leaders.

Apart from the lively conversations when they first boarded the ship, the scene afterwards became a little serious. Everyone came here for what Hudson called "big business" and they didn't have the time to chat here.

"Tom, distribute the information to the guests!"

Hudson said nonchalantly.

If he had a choice, he really didn't want to seek financing from others. But there was no other way, the Near East Development Bank required too much capital.

In the early stage, Hudson could still inject it himself, but if it develops to the later stage, that hole would not be filled by him.

All financing strategies are the same: a beautiful financial report and an attractive story.

As for the leakage of the business model and the emergence of competitors, Hudson didn't care at all.

Since everyone is out to fool people into raising funds, they will naturally choose the good ones. Who would be stupid enough to note the risks?

If you blindly follow suit and replicate this business model in other parts of the mainland, you will most likely be able to make money in the early stages, but the question will be how you will fail in the later stages.

In the face of interests, few people can control their greed. A bank without any legal constraints ended the era of barbaric financial enclosure. If nothing goes wrong, Hudson can write his name backwards.

Time passed by, and everyone was watching attentively. The more they turned the pages, the more shocked their faces became.

"Marshal Hudson, the Near East Development Bank is so profitable, there's no need for you to drag us in, right?"

Wulfdek asked doubtfully.

There is no reason to give away profitable business easily.

Judging from the data on the books alone, in the past five months, the Near East Development Bank's book profit has reached as high as 140,000 gold coins, and is still growing wildly.

At the current growth rate, by the end of the year, the total profit will exceed 350,000 gold coins.

The profit estimate for next year is an astonishing 800,000 to 2 million gold coins. The range of numbers is so wide that it seems like a joke.

"Mr. Wolfdek, the Near East Development Bank is indeed very profitable, but the kingdom is facing a cash shortage!

Under normal circumstances, we only need to attract deposits and make loans to make huge profits. Unfortunately, depositors have no money now.

However, difficulties are temporary, and the cash shortage is not big news for the kingdom.

After almost every war, there will be a cash shortage to varying degrees, the only difference is that this time the scope of the impact is wider.

As long as we get through these difficult years, the road ahead will be smooth.

I originally wanted to slow down the pace of bank development, but time waits for no one. If I fail to seize the market quickly, competitors will emerge.

Many people are watching the Near East Development Bank, including you. If the profit model is not clear, I am afraid that some people have already followed suit.

Money cannot be earned by one person alone. Instead of diluting profits in competition, why don't we join forces and share the huge profits together! "

Hudson tried his best to deceive.

Whether it will be a huge profit or not is a matter for the future. The problem now is that the Near East Development Bank is running out of money to lend.

Either increase the leverage ratio or reduce the scale of lending, but this is not what Hudson wants.
Chapter 499:
Chapter 179: Dramatic Changes in the Orc Empire

Huge amounts of financing cannot be negotiated in a day or two. Even if the invited chamber of commerce representatives were convinced, they could not make the decision.

The main purpose of inviting these people here is to let them convey the news to the masters behind them.

No one can resist money. Even if you are not interested in financing, this new business model can still attract attention.

What's more, in the picture given by Hudson, banks can not only make money, but also control the local economic lifeline.

After laying out such a big "bait", if the real owner behind the scenes can still sit still, then he has no point in getting into trouble.

Even if it is just to understand this business model, everyone will actively participate. The rise of emerging industries cannot be achieved without people pioneering the way ahead.

The Near East Development Bank, which has taken the first step, is undoubtedly a good chess piece. As long as it tells a good story in the future, it will not worry about lack of investment.

The problem is that there may be too many people in this wave of frames. Not only will international capital be involved, but a large number of domestic nobles will also likely participate.

Once these guys become familiar with the operating model of banks, it won't be long before a bunch of banks pop up all over the mainland.

Now is the time to win people's hearts and minds. We are at a disadvantage and must show more sincerity than the four royal families.

Even with the advantage of royal status, the conditions they can offer in winning over the hearts of the various ethnic groups are still not as good as those of the Seven Clans Alliance.

Chapter 180: Huge Financing of 6 Million

The more trouble the Orc Empire makes, the more peaceful the Near East will be. The nobles who originally had little confidence in the Near East development plan could not help but increase their investment when they saw the civil war breaking out in the Orc Empire.

For a time, Crescent Port became more and more prosperous, with ships coming in and out in an endless stream every day.

Although the transit tax was exempted, the large number of people still brought countless wealth to Xueyue Territory. Other places still lost money, but Xinyue Port achieved a balance between income and expenditure.

Excluding the monopoly transactions under the Ministry of Commerce, daily business taxes and rents alone cover the administrative costs and even generate a surplus.

This is undoubtedly a good start. This year's shop rents are all symbolic. With the current flow of people, it would be unfair to not increase the rental income next year.

As time goes by and the Near East region is further developed, the passenger flow of Crescent Harbor will continue to increase.

By then, commercial taxes and rental income will increase accordingly, and will have the ability to feed back to the territory.

The good news is not just that. With the rise of the Orc Empire, the smuggling trade has become more prosperous.

The prices of all commodities that are related to war are constantly rising. Basically, the orcs will buy as much as the smugglers have.

If there is not enough cash to pay, then slaves and livestock will be used to pay off the debt. Since the war started, the number of livestock and slaves pouring into Xueyue Territory has skyrocketed fivefold.

The sequelae of the sharp increase in quantity is that prices have dropped rapidly. If it weren't for the Lord's Mansion's open purchase at a guaranteed price, the market would have been ruined.

Looking at boatload after boatload of slaves, Hudson strongly suspected that the orcs were packing up the tribe and selling it to him.

Originally, only some weak races would become slaves, but now it has expanded. Including the four royal families, almost all the orc races can be found in Crescent Harbor.

The slave traders are all smart people and know what their customers need. After the slaves are delivered to Crescent Harbor, they are first screened and classified.

The high-quality slaves were sold to nobles, entertainment venues, and arenas, and the rest were packaged and sold to Master Hudson.

As for hard labor, as long as the price is cheap and you have some strength, that's enough. There's no need to ask for anything else.

Generally speaking, the more attractive the slave is, the higher the transaction price will be.

The only exception is the orc royal family. No matter how good-looking they are, this identity alone makes their worth doubled.

The most typical example is the Behemoth clan. When they were once the royal family, the starting salary of any Behemoth was three digits, but now it has dropped to double digits.

Hudson didn't have time to care about these things. He just had to pay taxes to him properly. If it weren't for the contributions of the smugglers, Crescent Harbor would not have been able to make a profit so quickly.

The influx of orc slaves filled the labor shortage in Snow Moon Territory. Many planned infrastructure projects were put on schedule in advance.

The original plan of gaining a firm foothold in the first five years and then seeking development has obviously failed to keep up with the changes in the situation, and a systematic adjustment must be made.

The main reason was the internal fighting among the orcs. Hudson just came up with an idea, and the subsequent things were all caused by the orcs themselves.

It was because the conflicts accumulated in the past were too deep. The orcs had suffered from the rule of the royal family for a long time, and the royal family was too arrogant. The problems that could have been solved by political means eventually turned into armed conflicts.

Although both sides tried to suppress the situation and a full-scale civil war did not break out, local conflicts never stopped. If it weren't for the fierce internal fighting among the orcs, the Snow Moon Territory would not have received so many slaves.

Not only Hudson was using a large number of orc slaves, but the nobles in the Near East were also following suit. Even some lords in the northern border area who were short of population joined in the fun.

According to statistics from the tax department, the total number of orc slaves sold to the kingdom has reached nearly 180,000, half of which remained in the Snow Moon Territory.

This is just a statistical figure, the actual number is much higher. After all, slave trade also requires taxation, no matter how low the tax rate is, it still costs money.

Hudson was not naive enough to think that these unscrupulous slave traders would honestly pay taxes in full.

There was no further investigation because what they were doing was still within the tolerance range. Snow Moon Territory needed more orc slaves to do hard labor, and their enthusiasm could not be dampened.

Huge profits are the driving force. Every time a slave is brought back, the kingdom gains a labor force and the Orc Empire is weakened.

With one increase and one decrease, that's double the happiness. The strategic materials sold over there are not wasted, they will all be consumed in the internal fighting of the orcs.

If Hudson had not been worried about interfering too much and leaving clues, which would arouse the orcs' vigilance, he would have wanted to take action himself to provoke a conflict.

In fact, similar actions have already existed. When Bear Stearns went out for a walk, he would often hang orcs of different races on each other's flagpoles.

Many of the races that already have conflicts are too lazy to even conduct investigations and just start fighting.

This situation continued until the two camps confronted each other, and then it slowly stopped. It is easier to fish in turbulent waters, but it is not suitable to make too many moves when the situation is clear.

If the orcs discovered the problem, it would be troublesome. Hudson didn't want to become their common enemy and ease the internal strife in the Orc Empire.

The change in the situation directly affected the judgment of all parties. The price was that the cash flow of the Near East Development Bank was getting smaller and smaller. In order to make up for the bank's liquidity, Hudson had injected capital several times.

Not only did he lose his own vault, but he also scammed out the vaults of Bear Stearns and Maxim.

Unlike other customers' savings, Maxim and Bear Stearns' money was charged interest, and the interest rate was the same as the bank's external lending standard.

Despite such strenuous efforts to attract deposits, the total amount of currency in the vault of the Near East Development Bank is only about 4 million gold coins, while the loans issued have reached more than 18 million.

Having seen the high leverage ratio in his previous life, Hudson could accept it, but Rudolph, the bank president, was almost scared to tears.

With such a huge financial leverage, if something goes wrong, no one may be able to do anything to Hudson, but he, as a bank manager, will definitely die a miserable death.

The reason why so much cash can be retained is not only due to leverage, but also due to the issuance of gold notes.

In the face of the cash crisis, Hudson used the time-limited gold notes from the Near Eastern Development Bank to keep making purchases in the southeastern provinces.

Although the nobles had no love for gold notes, they found it more convenient than bartering, and with Hudson's reputation as a guarantee, everyone could reluctantly accept it.

After buying, it's all about selling, selling, selling

After delivering the goods to those who needed them, a large amount of gold notes flowed back into Hudson's hands.

There was no taking advantage of the situation; all the money earned was hard-earned. Some products even incurred losses due to poor sales.

After spending a lot of effort for more than two months and making transactions worth millions, I found in the end that the profit was only a bunch of goods in my hands.

Fortunately, the gold notes used were all printed by themselves. If the capital cost was calculated, this would be a loss-making business.

Judging from the benefits alone, this wave of operations is purely charitable.

The only effect was to increase the popularity of the gold notes and let the nobles in the southeastern provinces know that the gold notes of the Near East Development Bank could be used for transactions.

Unfortunately, Hudson has limited talent and its promotional activities are confined to the southeastern provinces. Otherwise, this wave of operations alone would be able to double the valuation of the Near East Development Bank.

Ordinary people don't know the significance of gold notes, but major chambers of commerce that have experienced similar operations are well aware of the huge profits hidden therein.

The main reason why it was not popularized was that there was too much resistance from the outside world. The conservative nobles simply did not believe that a piece of paper could replace currency.

Even with the endorsement of a strong figure like Hudson, the nobles in their own nest could only be skeptical, let alone expanding to the outside world.

The first step is always the hardest. After Hudson's constant efforts, the Near East Development Bank's gold bills finally became a little famous.

There is still a long way to go to promote it nationwide. However, it has already gained a certain degree of recognition in the southeastern provinces and the Near East.

With beautiful performance reports in hand, the second financing meeting of the Near East Development Bank was once again held on Xueyue Lake.

Unlike the Chamber of Commerce representatives from the last meeting, the guests attending this meeting were much more important.

They were either the core descendants of great nobles or the heads of large chambers of commerce. It was obvious that everyone attached great importance to this meeting.

As a bank manager, Rudolf has praised the achievements of the Near East Development Bank.

Although the ability to deceive people is still lacking, the impressive data cannot deceive people.

From the incredulous expressions on the faces of the investors, Hudson knew that today's financing meeting was halfway successful.

According to the report data, one-third of your loan customers are in the Middle East.

Has the management considered shrinking or even abandoning the business in the Middle East and focusing on developing other areas in the northern continent to improve the bank's risk resistance?

The purple-clothed man's question made Rudolph slightly stunned, and then he replied:

"Lord Lauren, that's not how you calculate the accounts!

Even if the threat of orcs still exists, that is a matter for the future. At least in the next few years, there will not be much risk in the Near East.

Apart from the risks involved in lending, all of our other businesses in the Middle East are profitable.

Everyone knows that the special situation in the Near East has led to particularly developed local commercial trade and frequent commodity transactions.

Now more than 90% of commodity transactions in the Middle East are using gold notes issued by our bank, and business travelers are also accustomed to depositing cash in banks.

These businesses alone can generate hundreds of thousands of gold coins in profit every year.

Taking all business operations into consideration, as long as the Middle East region can remain stable for five years, we will have recovered all our investment.

Even if all subsequent loans become bad debts, we will not suffer any loss.

Given the situation of the Orc Empire, you don't think they will be able to launch an all-out war in just five years, right?

Moreover, these high-risk businesses are also the foundation of the Near East Development Bank.

Investing is not just about investing in the economy, but also about considering political factors.

If the bank cannot provide funds for the development of the Near East, why should the Kingdom support us?

Since the establishment of the Near East Development Bank, the Kingdom has not levied any taxes and has not imposed any restrictive measures. These are all returns on our investment.

Investing in "politics" is a very good reason. If the Near East Development Bank wants to expand overseas, it cannot do without the support of the kingdom.

Theoretically, as long as it obtains strong support from the Alpha Kingdom, the Near East Development Bank is fully capable of expanding its business to all human-controlled areas in the northern continent.

Compared with this vast market, the investment in the Near East is not worth mentioning at all.

If they lose money, they can just treat it as an expansion expense. Are banks with a monopoly afraid that they won't be able to make back their investment?

Besides, the loan was not fully compensated, and the bank was collecting interest every month. If the Middle East had been peaceful for a few more years, perhaps the cost would have been recovered.

However, the prerequisite for all this is that the loan business in the Middle East does not expand. If it continues to expand, the risks will be out of control.

"Baron Rudolf, we can understand investing in politics, and I believe everyone can accept the cost.

Of course, your bank's mortgage guarantee system is still very good and can minimize risks.

But isn't this profit report too exaggerated?

According to the data above, you don't have to do anything and you will earn millions of gold coins in the next year?"

Viscount Laurent questioned again.

Seeing this scene, Rudolf felt relieved instantly. Those who find faults are the buyers. If you are not interested in the Near East Development Bank, why take it so seriously?

Viscount Laurent is one of the leaders of the four major chambers of commerce on the mainland. As long as he is convinced, today's investment meeting will not fall apart.

"Don't worry, sir. The accounts can be checked. I can guarantee with the honor of my family that all the data is true.

If the investment is successfully completed, we can also sign a magic contract. If you are still worried, you can also provide the magic contract yourself.

Compared with these detailed issues, we can actually give an estimate of the value of the Near East Development Bank first.

I think that in addition to investment, everyone who came here today also wants to learn more about the operating model of the Near East Development Bank.

It is not easy to find a profitable business, and it is even rarer to find a stable and profitable business.

If you miss it, you will probably regret it for the rest of your life.

The most valuable thing about Near East Development Bank now is its business model, so please carefully consider this premium when evaluating its value.

Once the cooperation is reached, as shareholders, you can send people to observe the daily operations of the bank."

Rudolph said calmly.

Faced with so many big shots, he would have panicked if Hudson hadn't been sitting next to him.

However, as the president of the bank, he still had to deal with some things himself. Hudson had already accomplished his mission by tricking these people into coming.

When it comes to specific investments, we must consider management factors. After all, no matter how good the business model is, it still needs people to operate and manage it.

If the management fails, even a monopoly-run and highly profitable industry can still lose money.

From the outside, the profits of the Middle East Development Bank are too high. However, the premise of all this is - monopoly.

The Alpha Kingdom cannot have only one bank forever, and competitors are bound to emerge in the future. Once any industry starts to roll back, profits will drop sharply.

Tax exemption is also unsustainable. Once the bank's operating model is understood, the kingdom can formulate corresponding tax laws.

However, these issues have been clearly blurred today. "Near East Development" is a good slogan, and those who don't understand it may think it is an agreement reached between Hudson and the Kingdom.

Unfortunately, this is just a tacit agreement between Hudson and the Kingdom. The Near East Development Bank will fill the funding gap in the Near East Strategy, and the Kingdom supports the development of the bank.

Once the Middle East development strategy is completed, or the kingdom declares the strategy a failure, the good days of the Middle East Development Bank will be over.

Since its inception, the highly profitable banking industry has been destined to be unable to stop newcomers.

No matter how many people Hudson brings on board, there will always be people who want to jump out and work on their own because they are not satisfied with the benefits they have already gained.

Seeing everyone's embarrassed expressions, Hudson knew that everyone was stumped. Valuation of emerging industries is the most difficult, there is no reference, and it is completely based on feeling.
